description:
I can't believe I haven't done this in the past 4 years of being a regular who embarrassingly gets this delivered about 3x a week (my friends even call me carrie tikka masala)... I've tried EVERYWHERE in the city trying to replace urban curry (eat24 minimum hurts the wallet after years) and you just will not find better. The sauce is thick and perfect for dunking naan, delivery is made to order so is always fresh, chicken itself has flavor and you can change up your spice level based on your mood (not one size fits all buffet food). 

Pro tips: "chicken makhani= butter chicken", eat24/ Grubhub is easiest but has a high delivery minimum, uber eats has no min but is a higher delivery fee OR if you want to go through the SUPER painful process of calling and ordering, the rice is included in all curry orders (where ordering online charges 2.00). If your hungover, the chow main is actually bomb. ENJOY!
author: CJ T.

description:
Good Indian food. We ordered indian Chinese food, and was super good, very less oil. 

We also requested fried momos, the host was very kind to do that for us (you usually don't find fried momos in the Bay Area).
author: Anshul A.

description:
Great food. Plastic container they use deteriorates under hot temperature of the food and brakes in small sharp pieces. It's dangerous to swallow those sharp fragments. If those pieces get stock in your body they can create infection and you can die.
I hope they will find other way of packaging their food before someone dies or the health department will shut them down.
Other then that the food is worth 4 stars.
author: Event Horizon L.

description:
For part three of our weekly office lunch, I decided to get something from Urban Curry. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Friday, July 6th around 12:30pm.

I ended up getting one of the Appetizers ($2.10) - Samosa: Fried pastry filled with potatoes and peas, Two pieces (+$3.15). The samosas were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I did ask for extra mint chutney and no tamarind chutney, but they ended up giving me one of each. Would have been better with two mint chutneys as one was only enough for one samosa. And I didn't order curry or anything else to give it some moisture. A coworker got the chicken tikka masala, extra spicy and it was actually really hot. So if you like heat, Urban Curry will deliver.

Price wise, I think this spot is a little expensive. $13.65 for chicken tikka masala is a little pricey in my opinion. I probably would have ordered my whole lunch from this spot if their price points were lower. Maybe that's the price you pay for being in North Beach? Based solely on my app, I'd say 3 stars.
author: Elena N.

description:
My boyfriend felt like a celebrity for 3 minutes when the server asked if he has been to this restaurant before. This was actually our first and most likely not our last time eating at this restaurant. 

We ordered Chicken Biryani ($12.99), Goat Curry ($13.99), Mutter Paneer ($10.99), and Basmati Rice ($1.99). Each of the dishes was pretty good. 

Chicken Biryani - We requested this dish to be a little spicy. It was very flavorful and had a lot of spices in it. It tasted as good as what the pictures looked like on Yelp. 

Goat Curry - My boyfriend thought this dish was very spicy and flavorful. The sauce was thick and the meat was tender and fell right off the bones in a good way. He said he will goat back. 

Mutter Paneer - The peas were cooked to perfection. They were not too soft or too hard. There was a decent amount of paneer cubes. I asked for mild and I was glad the dish still had some flavor. 

You should definitely go to this place if you are in the area.
author: Kristina M.

description:
Randomly stopped in for a la Carte lunch on Sunday, and found delicious food. 

Especially if you are pretty hungry, this will not be a cheap meal. But the quality and flavor of the food was wonderful. 

Chicken tikka masala - their version is darker and creamier than others I have had, and I found the flavor addicting! 

Chicken biryani - the chunks of chicken in here were juicy and succulent. The fish tasted great

Naan - I wish you got more with an order, considering the price, but it is hot and tasty.
author: Tasha H.

description:
This review is for delivery.

Holy cow, Urban Curry the BEST Indian food I've ever had for delivery.  We always get the same thing: saag paneer and chicken korma (both medium spicy), as well as naan and basmati rice.  

It really is medium spicy; my mouth has a slight burn when eating both the saag and the korma.  Just to give you context, my tolerance for spicy food is very low... but even my boyfriend (who loves all things spicy) felt the burn.

Both the saag and korma are spiced well and simply...tasty.  Highly recommend you order both.  

Delivery has been mixed.  It's always fast, but there have been accidents.  Last time, the plastic container for the saag was squished, so the top popped off and the saag spilled out.  We still love this place so much that we're going to order again, but we will be checking the order before tipping the delivery person.
author: Elle W.

description: This place is so YUM! I love their chicken tikka masala, the fragrance of coconut milk hits your nose before you even take a bite of it. Partner that with their garlic naan, it's like food party in your mouth! Their lamb vindaloo is more like lamb stew, depending on your preference, you might like it. Over all, highly reecommend this place to people!
author: Jie L.

description:
Fantastic Indian food right in Little Italy / Chinatown. Didn't know we were looking for Indian, but there it was, and boy were we happy we stopped in!

The server was super sweet, and very knowledgeable about the food. She seemed excited to share with us how some of the dishes were made. She brought us free papadums because our food was going to take a while.

Of course we would want the stomach space back for the food we ordered later, though, because wow!
author: Brian S.

description: Delicious food. The waitress was super courteous. The ambience is pleasant as well. Great place to enjoy wholesome Indian food.
author: Prateek J.

description:
Offered to have us come back and give us "store credit" for their mistake?  Or are they going to refund the amount to my card? Wow...so we should encourage fraud?

They could and should offer to refund the entire check and give a credit and not hold my hard earned dollars for ransom!  What if I were a tourist?

DO NOT TRUST THIS ESTABLISHMENT WITH YOUR CREDIT OR DEBIT CARDS!
author: Alfredo C.

description: Great buffet lunch - one of the most reasonably priced places in the area. Chicken Tikka Masala was tasty!
author: Caitlyn G.

description:
Came here around 5PM on a Saturday and it wasn't busy at all. There were probably 3 or 4 other parties which was fine with me. This place has a lot of seating and that's always a positive. 

My boyfriend is vegetarian and we wanted to share food so we got an order of veggie momos, paneer tikka masala, and some naan. I really enjoyed their paneer curry cause it was really flavorful. Their plain naan was a really good complement to it and their food tasted very fresh. Our momos came last and I actually didn't like those that much. My boyfriend seemed to enjoy them but I had one and was not about to take another one. 

Overall, this place has good food and lots of seating (especially for a restaurant in the city).
author: Karishma K.

description: I got the chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. Ordering it in person will get you the rice included for free. Only had to wait five minutes, very fast!
author: Garrick B.

description: Best tasting food and clean and the waiters are really nice. I love the dumplings(mo mo) and the chow mein.
author: Muna Y.

description:
The best thing to do here would be to go for combo and you can try two curries with the best possible deal. 
Food is great
Prices are super reasonable 
Service is all right
author: Nidhi S.

description:
We had a pleasant meal at Urban Curry. The food is Indian/Nepalese and the spices used in their curries reflect this.

We shared the vegetable korma, garlic naan and chicken vindaloo. Both dishes tasted good and went well with the lightly crispy naan. It did taste different than other korma and vindaloos I've had in the past at other Indian restaurants but that isn't necessarily a bad thing. 

Service was friendly and the person in charge that night (Owner? Manager?) came by and asked how everything was. He even reminded us to use our check in offer. Thanks!

The dishes more Nepalese in origin were intriguing on the menu so if I came back here again I'd be sure to try a few!
author: Karen W.

description:
I got delivery dinner from this place, and was pleasantly surprised at how good everything was. 

First off delivery was super fast, and I always appreciate that. 

I got the Lamb Tikki Masala with Naan, and it was quite good. The naan was soft and fluffy and overall it worked really well with the Tikki Masala sauce. The lamb was well cooked, tender and not gamey. Overall it's a little pricey, but portions were excellent, and I would order again!
author: Sophie W.

description: First time come here for the lamb curry  to test the water. It was good and spicy level is just perfect. service is great. I will come back for the lunch buffet for sure !
author: Mike C.

description:
Awful. I had the chicken karahi and samosas. Nothing taste like it should. The inside of the samosa is soggy and it doesn't taste like meat. It taste like mush and smells weird. The chicken karahi has so much oil on the top. I don't taste any spices. No ginger, no particular flavor I can even recognize. I really wish I can get my money back....

I'm not a picky person. I'm not even had to please when comes to food because I'll eat anything. This is the worst Indian food I have ever had. I don't think it's authentically made. I wish I could give it zero stars. The positive reviews shock me.
author: Kristal R.

description:
Our group was hanging out next door at the Noc Noc on Broadway. I ordered the chicken tiki masala (mild) at Urban Curry and they awesomely delivered to Noc Noc!

It was creamy, flavorful, and delicious. Its still pretty expensive for me to shell out ~$15.00 for a curry and no rice/naan. But the flavors are solid.

Should definitely come back for their $12.99 All You Can Eat lunch buffet. 

Pro-Tip: Sign in with Yelp and receive 10% off!
author: Cynthia M.

description:
$12.99 for all you can eat Indian food for lunch. Definitely caught my attention as soon as my coworker brought it up. We went as a small group, and were seated immediately without any wait.

Tikka Masala: Flavorful, plenty of chicken included
Garlic Naan: So good! I think this was one of my favorite things offered
Tandoori Chicken: Decent, well-cooked and seasoned chicken
Saag Paneer: Decent - great option for those who are vegetarian
Chow mein?? I was so very confused when I saw this in the lineup of items. I wasn't a big fan, but the Cantonese people I went with were huge fans of it.

So why the 4 stars? Unfortunately some of the food was cold, and some dishes were just mediocre. Definitely a good option if you're hungry and having a big lunchtime craving. It's fairly convenient as the restaurant doesn't seem to fill up for weekday lunches.
author: Michael L.

description: Came here on a recommendation when I was looking for Indian food downtown. Good food, not expensive, but no character and nothing to crow about. Did the job tho.
author: Matt K.

description:
I go here all the time. Best Indian food in town. Super friendly and efficient service. 

Highly recommend the Fish Pakora!
author: John K.

description: One of the best chicken fried rice I had in SF. Chicken biryani also tasted good. We also got large pieces of shrimp in prawn curry, enough for three people. I would definitely recommend this place for lunch/dinner.
author: Ratul M.

description:
Urban Curry is great lunch buffet option in North Beach/Telegraph Hill. My sister and I walked in around 12:30 PM on a weekday and there were plenty of seats available. Servers were refilling buffet items throughout the time we dined, so everything was hot and fresh. Make sure to ask for garlic naan! It goes great with the items they have - saag paneer, veggie pakora, chicken tikki masala, goat curry, tandoori, and more. They have a decent selection of buffet items to try so you'll have some variety on your plate. We also shared an order of mango lassi and it was refreshing. 

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and left satisfied. I would only say that the paneer could have been softer and chicken entrees a little more tender. Otherwise, the service was excellent and I would definitely dine here again! I'm curious to try the Nepalese dishes too. 

Make sure to check-in with the Yelp app to get a 10% coupon.
author: Edwina D.

description:
There are a ton of places in the area with such great curries/korma/tikka masalas, so it's always so difficult to say which one is the best. Currently on a quest to find the best korma in the area and it's definitely a challenge.

The place shouldn't be too busy on a weekday/lunch time, even with the lunch buffet going on (coming back for this!). The outside of the restaurant is plastered with menus, so you could already get a sense of what types of foods and options you have. I do like the fact that this place offers Indian AND Nepalese food, though I still chose to get korma and my friend chose to get the tikka masala (korma is the dish I typically order to compare to other places in the area). Love that this place offers chowmein.

How convenient that you could order online and set your level of spiciness. I chose to get the highest level of spiciness, which was not too spicy. Both the tikka masala and korma were rich and flavorful. We also ordered a side of garlic naan, which I think could have been a bit more garlicky, but nevertheless, it was still great naan. The prices are slightly more expensive compared to other places that offer similar dishes, but it makes sense as you do get a bigger portion here. 

Would definitely come back to try more things (maybe Nepalese next time!?). But I've definitely got my eye on the lunch buffet!
author: Meghan J.

description:
One of the finest authentic Nepalese and Indian cuisine in the heart of San Francisco. The taste of food in urban curry  can beat any other restaurant's food . We ordered Nepalese chicken dumplings. The sauce was amazing . And the size of dumplings are way better than in any other restaurants . Apart from the food their costumer service has always been great . The every sip of chai they serve makes me feel homely . 
One of my best place to have dinner with my family and friends . Thank you Mr. Netra for great service in every visit .
author: Shreeja S.

description:
Starving moment. I saw Urban Curry close by. Decided to walk-in alone,  Mr Sherpa, the owner welcomed me on the entrance. What a treat,,,,,!!!!

         The buffet was going on by that time but I choose to go with menu. I tried lamb biryani. 
          
          Sooooo goood,,,,!! Perfectly cooked, flavorful ,soft and the yoghurt sauce they gave me on the side was exquisite, with the touch of medium spice. Awesome.

          Can't wait to go here with family and friends next time. Thank you URBAN.
author: Feroz C.

description: My boyfriend and I ordered the classic chicken tikka masala and it was so bomb. We devoured it in less than 15 minutes. Chairs were super comfy, and the staff was nice and attentive. Our server constantly checked up on us and refilled our waters. The only funny part of this restaurant is that the bathroom entrance reminds us of a stripper club that is literally right next to us. Anyway, we loved this place so much that we even tipped our server 50% and we're broke college students.
author: June P.

description: I had the chicken korma with rice and garlic naan. The spiciness was perfect at level 6. The flavor of the spices was great. The naan was outstanding. Great prices too. Not much atmosphere but the food and service is great.
author: Ryan J.

description: Amazing food, definitely recommend! Friendly customer service and enjoyable sit-down place
author: Matt H.

description:
Had the buffet.  I really liked the entree options, kind & attentive service, complimentary tea, & rice pudding dessert.
I really liked the place and would go back.

10/2018 Update
Had the buffet again.  Loved the Kheer (Rice pudding).
author: Jim I.

description: Decent Indian food... loved their momo chutney... momo was also good... veg pakoda was delicious , I personally like cooriander seed taste in onion pakode, so I just liked it more. Egg fried rice would have been better if they tossed rice with egg instead of adding fried egg to prepared rice, whatever they served is fine but definitely could have been better.... overall decent food... happy stomach
author: Mohanraj S.

description: This place has nice indian ambience. Paneer makhani and dal makhani actually had very indian authentic taste which other indian restaurant are lacking. So if you are looking for place to eat good tasty indian food this is the place for you.
author: Varun J.

description: Went to urban curry twice in a week because it was that good! Our server was incredibly sweet and personable, giving us suggestions and remembering our order from our previous visit. Will definitely be recommending this gem to friends!
author: Rachel G.

description: Ordered delivery through DoorDash. $12.99 for Chicken Tikka Masala without rice...seriously? At least make it clear that it doesn't come with rice. I waited 45 minutes for delivery, and now I am left with just curry sauce and no Naan and no rice.
author: Jeff D.

description:
My favorite Indian restaurant happened to be closed today so I thought I'd try another one on Door Dash. Urban Curry got good reviews so I was excited to try it. WORST FOOD ever. I ordered the chicken fried rice, samosas and prawn jafaraizee. Everything was dry and bland as if they just gave me the leftovers from the lunch buffet. I will never order from here again. There are too many other good Indian restaurants in SF but this definitely  isn't one of them. 

After I originally posted this review I received a call from the restaurant and they apologized that I didn't like the food and offered to send me something else. I thought that was very nice but I still will not eat here again.
author: Susanne B.

description: Excellent food .... i highly recommend this place ... food was amazing and service was good .... spices were on point .... loved the chicken briyani and daal makhani .... check this place out !!
author: Varun R.

description: Gr8 taste and attentive staff; reasonable prices ! Fresh and good quality ingredients and restaurant had good ambience.
author: Anil K.

description: I tried the buffet. I am vegetarian so can only review the boring stuff. The food was above average but short of great. The ambience was fine. The service was prompt. Most of the dishes were typically like "home cooked" food.
author: Chetan M.

description: This is our local delivery spot. Delicious chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. Saag paneer is good, too, and rice is cooked well. Will definitely be reordering from here and trying more dishes. Delivery is consistently on time as well.
author: Robyn B.

description:
My partner and I ordered dinner take out on a weekday. I found the food to be pretty average. The chicken tikka masala was good enough and definitely satisfied my fix and hunger. We also ordered the chicken jalfrezi. That one was a total disappointment. Really lacking in salt and the chicken chunks were too huge, they weren't quite filled with flavor. 

Not sure if I would order from here again. I wonder what the Nepali momos are like.
author: Priti K.

description: Ordered Mutton curry, tasteless, full of chili and without salt. Very less quantity of mutton. Disappointed. There are better Indian restaurent out there. Never going to order again.
author: Devesh M.

description: The restaurant is okay. Located just on the outskirts of Chinatown. The food is North Indian/ Himalayan cuisine which comes with its distinct flavours and spices. I felt it's a bit overpriced but then again most of the Indian food in SF is overpriced compared to South Bay.
author: Gautam P.

description:
Decent spread for a lunch buffet but I've definitely had tastier food at an Indian lunch buffet than at Urban Curry. 

The $12.99 buffet is available only on weekdays. I think most of their business is delivery so it's pretty sparse of dine-in customers. Pretty standard offerings like chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, aloo gobi, and dal makhani. Also 1-2 Nepali dishes like a veggie chow mein. Overall, I was pretty underwhelmed with the food. The chicken in the curry was really dry and the curry tasted a little odd - as though there was milk powder in it. The goat curry was pretty bland although the meat was tender. Typically really like veggie pakoras but I found the ones here to be really tough. Free chai tea was a nice touch though.   

The server was friendly and as attentive as she could being the only one on the floor. She kept my water glass filled frequently and offered me fresh naan which I declined. In a pinch, Urban Curry will do but I have other favorites for an Indian buffet so highly doubt I will be back.
author: Jon L.

description: Excellent food!! And the service is amazing. Their tea is the best. I've tried different restaurant around the town, but this one has the best momo.
author: Srijana O.

description: One of the best Indian food place in San Francisco downtown. Foods were fresh, decent priced and service was quick. Definitely recommend this place for Indian food lovers. Also, they have Nepalese food which I will try next time.
author: Sudarshan D.

description: Finally found my go-to north Indian place in the city. The flavors are amazing, customization was available, and the service was great they even put on the TNF game. They deliver too! So happy.
author: L D.

description:
Best And only one Authentic Food in San Francisco.
Restautant Owner, Mr. Purna Sherpa, who has done an Everest Summit, is very friendly.
It's a must go place if you are in city.
Don't Miss, Chicken momo, chicken chowmen and most importantly lamb Chhoyla.
author: A. K.

description:
I was here with my family.
Lovely service and very good food.
We were with 5 adults and ordered for 4 and this was more then enough.
We ordered lamb korma, lamb biryani, goat biryani and tandori chicken. Everything was very good.
author: Ilco H.

description: Visited Longfellows with friends last Friday. Really lovely meal and very warm welcome - we would recommend this lovely restaurant and will try to go back again.
author: Rajiv R.

description: We had a fantastic authentic meal with our teens. The staff was very friendly and helped us order and select spice level. We had Saag Paneer, Chicken Tikka Masada, Daal, and a veggie dish with chickpeas and spinach. We ordered between mild and medium which was the perfect amount of spice. We topped the meal off with rice pudding, yum! Highly recommend if you are in the mood for Indian cuisine!
author: Brad O.

description:
Bland, Americanized food at the lunch buffet. CTM was OK but lamb in the lamb curry was dry and had almost no flavor. Even the Tandoori Chicken had very little taste.

I understand many Indian places do this, since many Americans don't like the spice. So, either offer at least one dish that's semi-authentic, or devise recipes that keep the flavor without getting too hot.
author: Some Bozo ..

description:
It was a decent Indian place. The staff was really nice and that's probably the only reason for 3 stars. 
The staff was nice enough to make us fresh spicy Indian style noodles ( the only thing my family liked).  They should improve on the food a little.
author: Abhishek P.

description: We ordered delivery last night and it was the best decision. The food arrived and was nice and hot and DELICIOUS. Everything we ordered was fantastic and it was a fantastic vegetarian choice. We might order it again tonight it was so good. If you're a vegetarian, try this now.
author: Katherine P.

description: Came here with family for the lunch buffet and it was absolutely fantastic! Their chicken is super super soft and very tasty in the tandoori chicken and chicken tikka masala. Not spicy which was good for us as a family.
author: Kevin S.

description: Amazing vegetable fried rice. Must try for Indians who want to experience the kind of fried rice you get in Mumbai
author: Bill C.

description: Hi I'm very glad with you guys sometime I ordered chicken momo and chicken tikka masala is the best in this world I love your food Thank you so much for doing such a great job!!!!
author: Yub Raj B.

description: My review is only on their sucky take out. I ordered Chicken Tikka Masala via MealPal and was excited to try a new place, especially one that offers Nepalese food. If my lunch had been good, I'd go back to eat in. However, the lunch plate was not satisfying in that they only gave me two chunks of chicken. Yes, I got plenty of rice and a side of Saag Paneer but really? Just two small chunks of chicken? The flavors were good but the temperature was not that hot. They did scoop it out of the steam table for me when I arrived so maybe it was hot enough to eat there. Urban Curry, you didn't win me over to come try you again. I really wanted to like you. They were friendly there and the place looked nice.
author: Jen L.

description:
Came with a friend for lunch buffet. 

$12.99 per person. Figured this place would be good with 4 stars yelp & 500+ reviews. Nope this place sucked. Never received our basket of naan. Small selection. The tandoori chicken was awfully dry. The chunks of chicken breast in the chicken tikka Marsala was also dry. Vegetable pakora was a bit doughy. Random dish of chow mein was burnt at the bottom and they never whipped up a fresh batch. They have gas burners keeping the food hot. Flame appeared to be on med-high which was too high and dried out the chicken. They should really invest in a buffet steam table. I was there for about an hour and they never added more lamb curry. I spent a good 2 mins combing thru the lamb curry and found nothing but bones with pea sized bits of meat. 

Their Aloo Gobi was the only good dish. Which is why I rated 2 stars instead of 1. 

Been to 20+ Indian buffets in Bay Area. Urban curry ranks on the lower end of the spectrum. My friend and I left disappointed.
author: Jason X.

description:
Food was great except I would expect the tandoori to be served on a hot pot. 
Interior wise this restaurant has great potential if they removed the huge TVs and countless cables, dim the lighting and have few candles ))
author: Anna N.

description: Food was good but they messed up my takeout order. Now I don't know what their Tandoori Chicken tastes like.
author: Naveen V.

description: Service is awful. Food was not great. The man who served us was not friendly and never came to our table to check on us. Would not recommend this place for good curry
author: Jessica G.

description: It was wonderful!  The chicken makahani was delicious.  I got Medium spicy and it has just the right kick.  The kind that creeps up after you take a bite and leaves your lips tingling at the end of the meal.  The garlic naan was fluffy and very fresh.  The lunch buffet looked awesome but we got here too late to have it.
author: Lynne O.

description:
Not very tasty.  Had Dal soup, chicken Jalfrazee and Naan. 

The Naan was good. The rest was just blah. Asked for medium spice like I do every time I try a new place but this was not even mild IMO. 

Took 3 attempts to get my bill right (tried to charge me for table next to me. They had just paid
author: Joe S.

description: I went to SFO on 10 days trip. Its the best Indian/Pakistani resturant i have tried in SFO. The menu is very good covering almost all the main courses of indian cousine. Service is very good n prompet. Our waiteress was manzu she is such a nice and polite lady. she always helped me in ordering food. on my whole trip i always tried to get one meal from there. Highly recomended for all chiken curry/lamb curry.
author: Mudassar A.

description: The place and the food is really good here. I have tried the food delivery too and they always deliver on time while the food is still hot. Would surely recommend you all!
author: They-one S.

description: The food here was great, the Tikki Masala has a very unique flavor that was awesome! I will be coming back. Thank you
author: Paul B.

description:
This place is incredible. 

The service is very friendly and the food is dynamite. 

Everything we got was fantastic:
Vegetarian samosas 
Chicken tikka masala 
Vegetable biryani
Naan 
Fish curry
author: Tom P.

description: So good!! I had medium chicken curry (quite spicy but DELICIOUS) and the onion naan. I highly recommend it!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Never had worse food in my life...

Dal was ORANGE?! Naan was rock solid and not fluffy. Roti was similarly hard.
author: Richa B.

description: Hands down the best Indo chinese food in SF! The chicken and vegetariam momos are amazing. The chicken and egg chowmein are really good as well. I order delivery through them at least once a week. Had a great experience overall!
author: Ami B.

description:
Mix vege was super spicy, on request they made another batch which was nice.
Malai kofta full of red color. Bharata also very spicy.
The place can be cleaner.
Overall not good food.
author: Sangeeta S.

description: Best place to get Nepali or Indian food. You should definitely try Momos. Best momos you can get in the bay area..
author: Vibek B.

description: This place is probably the best restaurant in SF for authentic Nepali style CHOWMEIN. I love most of their foods and the service is great as well. Hopefully, I will visit soon.
author: Swapna T.

description: This place was a pleasant surprise!! We stumbled upon this spot and truly enjoyed the food here. We ordered the chicken marsala, chicken curry, aloo gobi and garlic naan... all were some of the best we've ever had!! My kids asked for seconds and the service was especially awesome!!
author: Toki L.

description: Let me preface this by saying I used to not like Indian food. It always gave me a stomach ache and heart burn (I just can't eat spicy food). But BOY is this place worth it. There is something about that Chicken Tikka Massala and Garlic Naan that is to die for. I recently tried the Onion Naan too and it was delicious. Now, mind you, I'm the pickiest eater in the world and I actually dislike onions and garlic...so I think that really says something. If you haven't tried it yet just do it. I've only gotten delivery, but they've always been on time! (unlike a lot of other places I get delivery from). Great place!!
author: Ava M.

description:
I really liked the contrast of the traditional interior decoration with not one, but TWO giant flat screen TVs broadcasting basketball games on the night that I went LOL. True fusion of cultures. 

The Garlic Naan was amazing, we ate a whole platter and took one more to go. I enjoyed the Nepalese dumplings, which were like chubbier Chinese dumplings with thinner outside and came with a tangy and nutty dipping sauce. I was really full after eating about half of the plate, so I was glad someone was there to share with me. I also got the Lamb Jafrezi, and it was a unique new taste, mostly tomato based.

Despite a poor food safety rating, our stomachs were happy.
author: Shelley C.

description: Me and my husband were craving for some nice chicken momos for a long time. We had enough of dim sum and wanted a taste of home. The momos at this place are awesome to say the least.. and the fish pakoras are a perfect complement to the momos. Its a small little spot in san francisco with great service and very close to where we live.....perfect for a nice quick spicy bite
author: Shweta B.

description:
LACKING in flavor. First time trying this restaurant, as my go to is Deccan Spice. Deccan Spice did not open until 4, but I will not order from urban curry again. 

Ordered chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. Chicken tikka lacked any Spice whatsoever. Flavor is just bare cream and tomato. Only positive is that the chicken was tender. The garlic naan lacked flavor as well. The garlic pieces kept falling off too. 

They also forgot my Diet Coke. Ordered off of uber eats.
author: Julianna M.

description: Awesome Chicken Tikka Masala--get it spicy! Cheese naan is the best for sure. I would suggest take out because the restaurant is not the best vibe or a great location...but if you want indian take out, this is the go to for SURE.
author: Zoe P.

description:
Ordered for delivery via eat24 and the wait time suggested it would take between 45-60 mins which was fine for me. They ended up delivering in 35 mins. Service has never been a part of my rating, but I just wanted to note it in my review since there are many bad reviews about their delivery service. I did order this with a hungry stomach at 11:40a. 

I ordered chicken vindaloo (extra hot), navrattan korma (extra hot), roti, and a side of rice. 

The vindaloo had dencent sized pieces of chicken and they were tender. The spice was on point. Usually, I put medium and it comes out mild for me. I also have a higher tolerance for spice than my peers. Also, I lived in India for 6 months and knew what spice was. Lol the vindaloo met my expectations. It wasn't the absolute best I've had, but good.

The korma was a bit too sweet for my taste. There were decent sized veggies, but I wish there was more. Instead of one giant piece of paneer, cauliflower, and potato, I wish they had cut them up a little smaller and given me more veggies. 

Another reason I am giving 4 stars is because their roti was OK. It was dry and lacking the fat homemade rotis are made with. 

Overall, a good place to order lunch from. The food is good. They really give you the spice, if you're looking for it.
author: Christina L.

description:
And as I said last time, I would order again. So I did. Ordered the Vegetarian Chowmein. And though spicy, it was awesome. I had a bad cold, and this was yummy, helped unblock my sinus  the Chowmein was very reminiscent of what I would eat in India. Indo-Chinese.  And I would order again!!!

I also ordered some roti, mushroom korma and chicken soup. They were good too although I would wish the soup was more brothy and less starchy.
author: Vidya K.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised when I came here with my group for lunch. The bbq chicken was tender and juicy while the naan was a combination of thin, crispy and flakey. I ended up getting more chicken and the white cabbage dish since I opted for the $13 all you can eat special. They also have a salad bar and rice pudding if you're more health conscious...

Next time I'll make sure I come hungrier
author: Sam Y.

description:
We missed so much Indo-Chinese food here. We went to Urban curry now a couple of time over the weekend and had Mo-mos, Chamin and we just loved it. It's Nepali restaurant but had a unique flavor of Indian food. We just loved it. I am Vegetarian and I got so many options that I tell you this if you are non-vegetarian then you have more than us. 

They have snack kind of corner in San Jose and they have more Indo-Chinese options which I am going to try one day.
author: Dhwani T.

description: The place is a great little stop. We tried a few appetizers and my wife got chicken chow mein. I had a hot tikka masala and it was on point.  The naan deserves 5 stars by itself.
author: Paul K.

description: One of the few Indian buffets that will serve a lamb option consistently.  A dollar or two more than it's competitors in SF.  Worth it for a lamb lover like me.  Friendly service.  Basic decor.
author: Add C.

description: Wow very authentic Nepali food. Surprisingly I haven't had good Nepalese food like this in a while. Most all Nepalese restaurants in US customize their food for foreigners taste. This place made me feel back home. I ordered Chowmein, Momo and Choila and devoured it all. The Chowmein was my favorite but the Choila was just as good. My husband loved the momo and said it was better then the ones I make, which is crazy cause I am a pretty great cook.
author: Pratigya T.

description: Excellent Indian/Nepal blend of flavors and tastes.  Try the lunch buffet to get a good idea of how flavorful and healthy the food is.  Excellent service.  A must try.
author: jerry t.

description: Soooo fucking good. Some of the best indian food i had. Just like. Wow. Ordered the vegetarian curry w nan and rice and the tofu is so firm and nice and the bread is so nicely baked and floured and the dish has an excellent taste. And they didn't put cilantro in their rice, which i like. A lot of indian food places will do that. 10/10
author: Cheyenne D.

description:
When was the last time you had Nepalese food?  Yeah, exactly!  Me too.  
(side note:  The Pakistani call-out on the restaurant's facade is incorrect.  A server confirmed it.  Urban Curry specializes in Indian and Nepalese food)

Appetizer:  Samosas.  These were great and the sauces served with them were event better

I HAD to order a Nepalese dish...we went for the chicken momo and chicken chow mein.  The momo (dumplings) were delicious and generously filled with chicken.  The chow mein was flavorful with plenty of garlic (I love garlic) and tender pieces of grilled chicken.  Just the right amount of spice was tossed throughout the dish.

My dinner was satisfying and between the two of us we had enough for a doggy bag of leftovers for a lunch tomorrow.  

Very friendly staff, service was swift and pleasant.

Takeout and delivery is available (I hope to remember this for lazy weekends!)
author: Andrea H.

description: Very good and tasty food..Had veg chowmein and veg biryani and thoroughly enjoyed it. Will definately recommend
author: Sunila V.

description:
I would love to give Urban Curry a better rating. The food is quite good and consistent. (We have been coming here as locals since 2015.)

My big complaint is it's total lack of ambiance. This was accelerated some time ago by their closing off the street facing windows with menu pictures for street passerbys. 

Probably tourists looking for good food at reasonable prices will find nothing amiss. But Urban Curry could be so much more - let the light in, liven up the interior, and maybe you will enjoy the influx of devoted Indian food locals!
author: Letty B.

description: Being not a huge fan of the Indian/Nepalese food, the food here was delicious. We ordered chicken momo (Indian potstickers), tikka masala, goat biriyani and garlic naan. Yum!!! The service was great too. Our waiter was attentive and informative but not overbearing.
author: Anat N.

description:
Lo mein on the buffet? No Indians or Pakistanis working or cooking? Surly waitstaff? Chafing dishes filled with sauce but no meat? Everything else on the buffet cold and/or stale and tasteless?

We've been coming here for years whenever in SF. Owners, new or otherwise, have ruined a great thing.
author: Don N.

description:
This was just bad.
For starters I asked for Thai tea without milk since I don't consume dairy. No complaints there. 
I ordered mixed vegetable curry and my friends ordered the chicken tikka masala and the chicken korma. Two of us ordered naan while the other had to order a side of rice because this place apparently doesn't serve rice with their curry dishes (never heard of this before and I eat Indian food quite frequently). 
The food came out and the waitress gave me my dish and informed me that there were paneer cubes in my vegetable curry and would I mind just picking them out? She did offer to have them make another dish without the paneer but I said I wouldn't mind avoiding the cheese cubes. 
We started eating and the dishes were just okay. My friend said her tikka masala was seriously lacking in flavor and my other friend said her korma was bland. As I'm finishing up my first piece of naan the waitress comes back out and says 'is it okay that there's butter on the naan?' I dropped my unfinished slice onto the plate and she immediately offered to bring out more without butter. 

Im done writing about our terrible experience and I won't even get into the mixup with the bill at the end. I'm upset that we were mislead with this place receiving 4 out of 5 stars. It was bad and we were disappointed.
author: Iulietta G.

description: I have been ordering from them for over 2 years now, they are my default for dinner. Delicious tasting food, always on time and sometimes with on the house extras. I love these guys.
author: Ameya D.

description:
You know that place that you just don't get why it existed in that way, amongst strip clubs and competes with Italian food at the edge of North Beach / Telegraph Hill / Chinatown? That Indian place that is so spacious, airy and yet often empty, perfect for that Sunday evening book reading along with your curry? Yep, that's the place.

I met my friend O (Hey look at this, I'm getting better at indexing friends' names!) at a music venue, like most people I meet I often become, subconsciously or unconsciously their wing woman, now exactly why I am a friend material is beyond me but what do you do when you have time to kill and friends to see? You go and have a nice and quiet meal and share ideas and thoughts. Such was one evening. After parking at the edge of North Beach and Chinatown we walked down Columbus and found this joint on Broadway to park ourselves for some delicious curry and biryani. He got curry lamb and I got goat biryani. Wish we had brought dental floss. Biryani was surprisingly spicy and delicious. Better than most I've had. Plain naan to dip into the curry lamb sauce.

The food is good but not exceptional. The restaurant has a really good vibe. I would say that it veers towards traditional side, After Dosa on Valencia and varies other southern Indian places you'd get in the Mission, Northern Indian isn't bad after all. You just forget about coming here because you are in the heart of other worldly cuisine heaven. 

We got along quite well. He's got the rugged good looks, I've got wry sense of humor with a drunken woman's laugh (except I can't drink to save my life) with too much teeth showing when laughing, we are from the opposite end of the worlds, yet somehow between the beer and curry, I knew everything I needed to know about this man and he me. I see eating a very social event. I take eating seriously. I like restaurants that facilitated the eating experience, rather than rushing people through and taking themselves too seriously. 

O says that often he came here after being in the studio making music to grab some curry and read a book. I can see him doing that, alone, a lot. He's a solitary man. I told him that next time if he needs to read a book I'm happy to join him at this joint. He said, "No, I'd much rather you be my wing woman when we go out." So much for a good book and a quiet Sunday afternoon at this quiet and delightful restaurant.
author: Victoria E.

description:
**Best Momos in N. California!**

I have been looking for a decent Nepalese place for a few months now. Looks like I have found one.

My friends and I decided to check this place out. We ordered momo, chowmein and chowila. With the exception of chowmein, food was delicious. Momos were made fresh and it was very yummy. The servers were very friendly too. I will definitely return for more momos.
author: J D.

description: The ambience was not great. There was a funky smell when we walked in the restaurant. Food was ok. I ordered chicken chowmein. Too spicy. No flavor at all. Too dry and spices mainly included lots of black pepper. Will not recommend.
author: Natasha L.

description: One of the best authentic Nepalese food in bay area. Momo and chowmein highly recommended. And yeah, self serve Chai just complements the great meal!  Overall great food amd service. Will definitely be back for more of their menu options.
author: Vychung L.

description:
how hillarious that your order does not include any rice.. 
As far as the qaulity of food, it is definitely overpriced. Definitely wont recommend it.
author: Omid G.

description: Wow! Run, Run, Run Run.....They are using processed gravy mix for their base in the Chef signature chicken Tikka Masala curry. Let's start there. As soon as you smell it, it is processed and then they add some curry to an American gravy base you would use in a cheap dinner. I have lived in Russian Hill for 16 years and this is not a place that will survive. I should have turned around and left at 7:15 when there was on person in a huge restaurant. RUN
author: Romwald C.

description:
Good service. Clean facility. 
Chicken chili & coconut chicken curry are delicious. Absolutely delicious.  
Naan was very fresh. 
Momo is so so..see what I did there 
Will be back!
author: Tina H.

description:
Urban Curry is on one of my jogging routes. Every time I run past it, I've made a mental note to try it. Well this pile of mental notes has been accumulating, so it was time to catch up and try it.

Located on Broadway in the middle of the strip clubs, it doesn't score that well on decor or ambiance. 

The food however, scored much better. They have some Nepalese items that I don't usually encounter, which I really enjoyed. 

The staff were very friendly. Don't do takeout on a rainy day, unless you bring your own bags. They pack your to-go plastic containers in paper bags.

Note:  I really like spicy food, but I found MEDIUM is actually pretty hot on their spice scale. I think I will be a wimp and going with MILD here in future.

Tried the following:

Chicken MoMo - From the Authentic Nepali Specialties section of the menu. Won Ton like dumplings filled with minced curried chicken - outstandingly delicious.

Prawn Karahi - Not my favorite - Prawns were dry and appeared to be cooked separate from gravy and had little flavor.

Saag Paneer - very good.

Chicken Korma - very good

Goat Curry - Nepali home-style - good - nice goaty flavor.

Gulab jamun - very good - just the way I like it, sweet and not overly fragrant.

This is about 3.5 stars for me, but I will round up to 4.
author: David T.

description: Always in the neighborhood and decide to try , delivery came faster than expected and was piping hot. They even called to be sure if I wanted rice. The food was fresh only thing I think I would get my food more spicer next time
author: Anjelica H.

description: Good food, fast delivery, and good prices. Great for a lazy Sunday afternoon of Netflix bingeing.
author: Lindsey F.

description: The lamb biryani and garlic naan were delish. And I liked the chai tea that was complimentary :)
author: Louise N.

description:
If you haven't had Urban Curry you're cheating yourself. The food here is excellent. 
I like my food spicy but no one I eat with ever does so when I find an Indian place that can make a non-spicy dish that is flavorful enough to satisfy my palette I know I've found a gem. Start off your meal with the Aloo Tikki appetizer, an item I have a hard time finding in most Indian spots. 
Their naans are beautiful and fluffy. The saag nice and smooth. 
I've yet to encounter a dish they do wrong. I was also delighted to find Nepalese momos on their menu. They are perfectly executed, steamed to the right tenderness with the accompanying having a nice fresh bite to it.
author: Paolo R.

description: One of the best Chicken Tikka Masala with garlic naan...hhhhmmm the perfect combination.
author: RB L.

description: Awesome place for Indian Buffet! Love their chicken Tikka Masala and Naan! Pretty good service also, a gem in north beach
author: Roy O.

description: This is a really good restaurant with indian curry and delicious naan. My favorite is chicken coconut with their garlic naan. I highly recommend everybody try it.
author: Xu-Chen W.

description:
This is for takeout, not dine in experience.  Looks like my default Indian restaurant, Shalimar, doesn't deliver so after perusing on EAT24, Urban Curry showed up as the best reviews for Indian food.

I ordered a lot of food:

1) Goat Vindaloo: asked for spicy but turned out mild and only about four chunks of lamb meat.  Flavor was good.
2) Chicken Tandoori: flavorful and moist meat
3) Goat Biryani: needed something carby to balance out the other protein dishes.  I'd pass on this because not spicy at all (again ordered spicy), flavorless, and it contained goat bone bits which I had to spit out. 
4) Samosa: big and loaded with potatoes.  This gets my approval.  Came with tamarind and yogurt sauce.
5) Roti: excellent for curry dipping, but I do prefer Indonesian roti better
6) Garlic naan: I think this was mislabeled because it had the exact doughey consistency of the roti but with garlic in it.  Naan should be crispier.

Overall, I think Urban Curry is worth another take out order as the delivery time was prompt and the food was satisfactory for our Indian craving.  Next time, I'll call them up and emphasize spicier dishes and none of this mild flavoring bs.  This isn't the type of restaurant I'd go out of my way of since there's better places to eat in North Beach. I'm surmising that the four star reviews come from drunk hungry patrons who are ready to go savage on any food in the middle of the night in North Beach.

On days when I'm not lazy, I'd still rather make a run into the Tenderloin for tastier Indian food.
author: Bailey N.

description:
I have ordered delivery from this place several times now and it's top notch.  Fast Delivery, Hot Food, and Delicious!

Most Indian restaurants in the North Beach area use too many hot spices for me.  But Urban Curry spices just enough so their dishes are really savory and the taste is not competing with heat.
author: Karen L.

description:
My sister and I are from out of town so since place was down the street, we wanted to try. It's also because I just took out my wisdom tooth and this place had curry so I figure I can slurp on that. We were greeted at the door and seated immediately. They gave us our drinks immediately. The place is quiet and we had dinner here at 6pm. There was probably just us and another couple. The place is decent size. The bathrooms is shared with this other restaurant (you'll see when u walk through). I don't mind. There was 2 stalls. 

We ordered our food and the waiter didn't take long to ask to take our order, which we didn't mind because she asked if we needed more time but we were ready. 

We ordered curry fish, brown rice, curry chicken (which has a complete different taste from fish btw because it had this sweet taste to it) both were mild in spice. We ordered a side of 2 potato samosas. Our total came out to $38.02 btw. Indian food but they also have so many different types of food. Like from Nepalese, Pakistani, & etc. They have vegetarian options which is a plus.

The portion was decent the price is a little higher because it is the bay. Loved the music selection here. There was like 3 tvs playing news/sports. Cooks were pretty fast. There was probably 4 cooks and 1 waiter. The waiter was friendly and asked a few times for water refills. She even offered us their free tea (it taste like hot soy milk tea or like regular milk tea) but she said it was Chai tea with some milk and other tea leaves and hot water. It was pretty good for me. They even have pretty comfy chairs which I liked because my sister and I have been walking and standing all day from 8am-6pm til dinner time.  

Overall I enjoyed our dinner here. I'm surprised it's not packed....but it is the bay with a billion other places. I would recommend.
author: See V.

description: Visiting from Australia and craved some Indian. Had a a selection of vegetarian and non and everything was wonderful. Thank Urban Curry for great food and service.
author: Andrew M.

description: Delivery came very quickly. The lamb biryani was ok - nothing special. The chicken tandoori was good! Price a bit higher than the Indian restaurants in the TL.
author: Ai N.

description: We ordered food from eat24 and it was said to be delivered at 12:54pm. It is now 1:06 and we are still waiting. We will either go starving to the next meeting. Or be late to the meeting. The delivery times you advertise should mean something.
author: bora o.

description: My husband and I got the chicken vindaloo and the chicken tikka masala, both were wonderful and incredibly flavorful. We love Indian food, but this was one of the better places we've tried! Definitely recommend!
author: Marissa K.

description: Great place. Good prices. Chicken Tikka Masala was best I've ever had.  Good service. Definitely a must try place. Naan was good also.
author: Colt K.

description:
I couldn't decide whether to go for the buffet or order from the menu. I took a tour the buffet spread. There weren't that many different dishes available, and the meats were all cheap. I wanted lamb or goat and all I saw was chicken, chicken, chicken.

So we ordered from the menu. We had Fish Curry, Lamb Biryani, and a garlic naan.  

The Fish Curry was very soft and tender, and I liked it a lot. The portion size of the Lamb Biryani was a little smaller than I hoped for (anything less than an obscenely enormous OMG-I-couldn't-possibly-eat-all-that-food-in-one-sitting sized portion is not enough food for me). But the lamb was tender and tasty and complemented the rice well.

The highlight of the meal was the garlic naan. It was just a little on the crispy side, and not doughy at all. If I had more room in my stomach I would have ordered another one.

Our server was very good. She was very patient with us as we decided on the buffet or the menu. Water glasses were refilled as soon as we emptied them. We were thirsty, so that was pretty often.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description: I placed an order via DoorDash from here and the food was good however, the food was delivered to us at our hotel room with nothing at all but two small containers of the food (chicken saag and lamb vindaloo). There was no silverware, napkins and most importantly there was no rice. After I had placed this order I called the restaurant to tell them I was in a hotel and please include these things. Basically I was stuck with two small containers of food. I have never ordered any type of Indian food like this where it doesn't come with rice on the side. Essentially I paid over $40 for two small containers of food and it didn't have an abundance of meat either, so this was an all around fail. I had to call the hotel front desk to ask for silverware. This is not acceptable when your paying this much for food and having it delivered!
author: Nat Q.

description:
3 stars for the food and minus 5 million stars for the delivery nightmare. It took them over 3 hours, yes you read it right 3 hours, to deliver the food. I called twice and they said drive is pulling up and then nothing and then the 3rd time they hung up on me. See a screenshot of eat24 order in photos section for proof. 

Feel free to try them if you want lunch but are ok with getting it delivered by dinner time!
author: Kaveh G.

description:
I ordered delivery from Urban Curry and it came 30 minutes faster than I had expected.  Good job!  Service means everything.

I ordered the Chicken Curry and Samosas.  The chicken was massive.  It was a bit on the dry side, but the curry definitely helped to "even it out."  I would highly recommend the Samosas and Garlic Naan.  Eating just curry can get boring, so you need things to dip into it as well.

I'm definitely going to order from here again.
author: Andrew H.

description:
We ordered through eat24. The quality just wasn't there. Chicken tikka was flat (which is hard to do for a chicken tikka). The goat biriani was extremely fatty (instead of having chunks of meat, it was essentially chunks of low quality meat with a lot of fat on each piece). 

Given the high reviews of the place, I'm not sure if it was an off night for them or not but what we got was really bad.
author: Farid F.

description: Absolutely outstanding. I was referred here by a friend.it is very decent indian food with lot of vegan and vegetarian option. So i would highly recommend it that respect, fresh, flavorful and great variety .
author: Dil Bahadur S.

description: This place is bomb. Really hit the spot. The chicken korma and chicken tikka were great. We used eat24 and got our food pretty quick. Tender chicken breast in the curries and doesn't taste too heavy
author: Nina H.

description:
What if you went to an Italian restaurant and ordered spaghetti Bolognese. And the waiter showed up with a bowl of sauce, but no spaghetti? 

I ordered delivery. Chicken Tikka Masala, aloo paneer, and rice. I prepaid, leaving a nice tip. Then find they forgot the rice. I called less than one minute after drop off. I told the restaurant about the problem and they asked me four times to check the bag. There was no apology whatsoever. Then he put me on hold twice to try and figure out who packed the bag! I asked if I could get the rice delivered and he said that it would be one hour. But he would refund me two dollars. I told him an apology would've gone a long way, but he still refused to offer one. I made my own rice, but the food was mediocre on top of all of that. 

Tip... You can find great Indian food at these restaurants:
Curry Leaf
Lasan (Delivers)
author: Scott W.

description: I literally drive 5 hours for their chicken dumplings!! I crave it so much sometimes.. It beats every dumplings I have had in LA. + I have a huge crush on this guy that works here lol  so it's worth a drive lol
author: Sanju S.

description: Holy cr*p this place is delicious. Our office is right next door and we come here for lunch at least once a week. The paneer and garlic naan were absolute must haves. Make sure you get the rice, too - you'll want as many things as possible to soak up the super tasty curries.
author: Christina W.

description:
Our office is just down the street, so I eat here all the time. They have some pretty stiff competition in this neighborhood, but I still find myself circling back. The lunch buffet is delectable and I find myself crawling back to my office on a regular basis. If you find yourself in the mood for some really delicious Indian food I cannot recommend a finer establishment. 

The lamb vindaloo is truly a treat, but if you get the goat, it may just change your outlook on life. The garlic naan is not to be missed. The quality is high on this place and the price is just right.
author: Steven B.

description: Saroj is the best waitress of all time! Excellent service, terrific food, comfy seats.
author: Johnny L.

description: Great lunch buffet! Love the Chana masala, saag paneer and chicken tikki masala. The naan and tandoori chicken were good too
author: Russell W.

description: My friend and I really love this place. We had try so many restaurant in city but this place "Urban curry" is awesome. We went for dinner. The food was amazing especially chicken dumplings so we will come back again.
author: Nitaphiphat C.

description: Really really good chicken tika masala the service was amazing the atmosphere was cool, the designs were nice, the whole place was huge and the food was perfect there are a lot of Indian spots in sf but this one for sure is my top 3 now I'm sf!!
author: Mhateen W.

description:
The best THUKPA i ever had in USA.  MOMO is always at it's best. 
Binita or BINNI :) is always cheerful. Always best at customer service.
author: Naam T.

description: Great food and great service. The house deco is amazing and in detail. I had the lunch baf and oh man...come early, they are just as good as every single dish on the menu but you have the luck to try a little bit everything. Also has fruits and salads unlimited. Very flavorful food and better than the many other Indian food I tried so far. Will definitely come back soon.
author: Donna Z.

description: Amazing food. They have all the things you'd expect of course at an Indian restaurant and more. The flavors are really multi-level and tasty. You can order them directly or through any of those delivery services or dine in. I've done all of the above. They will customize the spice, but be careful, medium is hot.... I love my usual dishes- of course chicken Tila masala, saag paneer, and other veggie dishes like alo gobi, but we love trying the Nepalese dinners too, like the Chicken Chili
author: Traci H.

description:
I'd totally recommend this place.
Great selection of regular Indian food, plus some really interesting
options from Nepalese cuisine.

Portions are generous and the garlic Naan bread is really nice.
Service was prompt and quite friendly.

And they do have Indian beer (Taj). 
Tip: There is 10% off Yelp Deal when you check in.
author: Piotr G.

description:
Tried the chicken karahi, garlic naan, rice, Mango lassi. 
Meh overall. Asked for medium spicy - was just "spicy hot" without any flavour.
Questionable hygiene too. Will skip next time.
author: Vighnesh R.

description:
Best momo ever 
Best thukpa 
And best hospitality
Chowmin is the best too

It has authentic nepali food.
author: Dhanik K.

description: Checked Yelp before I stopped by.  With a Groupon, we ordered the Chicken Tiki Masala, Curry Prawns, and order of Samosa to go.  All 3 tastes delicious and very favoring.  Both chicken and prawns order comes w/ rice. so no need to order rice on the side.  Service fast and courteous.  While I was there saw their lunch buffet.  Will be back to give it a try!  Thumps Up!
author: Denis Y.

description: I was introduced to Nepalese food by my old coworker and she recommended this place.  Needless to say, chicken momo, chicken chili and mango lassi have become a regular rotation in my diet.  Tasty food and the staff here is pretty attentive. They were even nice enough to add a complimentary rice pudding dessert with my order the last time I went.  If youre looking for something different, in a good way, give these guys a shot.
author: Fernando C.

description: Went to a alumni meeting and we had some food from this restaurant. I liked the chicken tikka masala and naan. It was decent Indian food.
author: Denise C.

description:
Great food!!!! 
Loved everything 
Lamb choyla is the best,  reminds of nepal 
Loved chowmein and  momo
Loved the place,  should definitely try :)
author: Sandhya S.

description:
I am giving a 3 star cause some of their dishes were good but lacked ambience and neatness.
We ordered mixed Fried rice with lassi which was awesome.. very fresh and lassi was not overloaded with sugar . garlic Naan was awesome too.oh and they have awesome chai 
Their house speciality was little disappointing but it's a nice place in the Heart of downtown.
author: Munch B.

description: This is by far the best chicken tiki masala in town. AND it has the best wait staff.  Bienita is the best, takes great care of you and will make sure that you order well and eat quickly:). No need to explore, I already did so and this place is the best!!! Enjoy.
author: Rogier d.

description: Delicious chicken momos. Taste like chicken seekh kababs stuffed dumplings. Spicy n flavorful. The aloo naans were fresh and buttery. They even gave us a free butter chicken sample side that was yummy. Free chai!
author: sara h.

description: Their lamb biryani is one of the best I've ever had. I've mostly gotten delivery from them, but the dine-in experience was also good.
author: Mike S.

description: My boyfriend and I ordered Urban Curry a few nights ago and now we have decided to order it once a week. We got the Chicken tiki masala and saag paneer with garlic nan. It was sooo yummy! Big portions too so I could eat the rest for lunch the next day. :)
author: Hannah A.

description: Came in with a large group ordered multiple dishes and each one was amazing. The chicken tikka masala was fantastic! Our vegetatian friends were equally happy with their dishes as well. We will definitely come back!
author: Adi G.

description:
Ordered delivery of chicken tikka masala, rice and tandoori chicken.  The tikka masala was VERY MEH.  Bland.  The rice was rice and the tandoori chicken was good.  Nicely cooked and flavorful.
Not inclined to order from here again with so many other proven options.
author: Ken H.

description:
One of the owners is a former Sherpa from Nepal who has summitted Mt. Everest twice. While the restaurant is in a seeder part of the City, it's also on one of the ways back to the Bay Bridge so it's not out of the way.  My Chicken Makahani had delicate, balanced flavors and my BF's Chicken Tikka Masala was the best he's ever had. While I did not try the Chicken Momo (steamed dumplings filled with seasoned minced chicken), I do intend to as they are authentically Nepalese.

Service was friendly and efficient and the owner (partner of the Sherpa) came out to greet and check on us. 

It was a treat to eat here and I wish them much success. They have been open for just over two years. There's an impressive mural of Mt. Everest on the back wall and good people watching from the window.
author: Hilary C.

description: Am ok restaurant, the service was pretty bad, the chai tee was free but they had none, the food was not the best Indian I had, it really didn't have any flavor and Indian food has lots of great tasty flavors.
author: Custo A.

description: great chicken curry, cheesy naan, and fast delivery.
author: Jen G.

description: After 5 years still consistently one of the best Indian eateries around.. and always service with a smile
author: chris h.

description: This place is incredibly inconsistent. I'd say we've ordered takeout from them a dozen or so times, and every time the food is different. Sometimes they're great, but most of the time they're mediocre unti ltoday it was just bad. And, they still charge on the upper end of indian food. The only conclusion I can come to is they outsource their food and sometimes from different places, or have different chefs. Their naan is sometimes soggy, sometimes way too much garlic, or sometimes great. Their curries are sometimes super spicy, others not at all even though we order them medium every time. That, combined with the safety score, makes me recommend steering clear and finding another place.
author: Kristen W.

description:
We come here every time we're in the neighborhood. 
Love the endless chai!
Other favorites:
Bindi
Paneer tikka masala
Salty lassi
Dahl soup

The wait staff is accommodating. The restrooms could be cleaner.
author: Nihal K.

description: Food is decent but never order from this restaurant using Grubhub.  The food took over 90 minutes to be delivered when it was promised to arrive in a much shorter time window.  The driver was gracious enough to admit the mistakes made but neither Grubhub nor Urban Curry seemed to care about my concerns when I filed a complaint.  I had been a very loyal customer but no more!  I'll take my business elsewhere.
author: Ernesto Q.

description:
We had a male server at first. He was darling! We ordered the chicken tikka masala and another chicken dish that was spicy. The both sauces were super tasty! We also ordered plain rice and garlic naan bread. The rice was a bit too dry and the bread was delicious. My favorites overall was definitely the chicken tikka masala and the garlic naan bread. 
When we were done eating we were thinking about dessert but a female waiter brought the check without asking us if we wanted anything else. That was the only negative thing about this experience. Other than that, loved it!!
author: Ida A.

description: Awesome food, good service and great chi tea. I will eat here again next time I'm in town and would recommend it to anyone else to try.
author: Alexander L.

description: Awesome food. I basically go here for the free Chai, I love their tea and have the craving for their version at home. So I'll headed down...I ordered Chicken Tikka Massala and Chicken Curry Momo, the two great dishes. I have yet to try their luncheon buffet so I can sample a little of everything. I also ordered the Garlic Naan, but it wasn't too garlicky (I'm thinking they gave me the regular Naan).
author: Thuy V.

description:
Food was pretty bomb. Came here on a Saturday for a late lunch. Ordered Fish pakora and chicken vindaloo with plain naan. The fish pakora was better than I expected. It had a nice crunch on the outside and not dry on the inside. The tamarind sauce and the mint sauce were good complements to the dish.

The chicken vindaloo had good flavor, but I expected it to be spicier. Oh well, my digestive system probably thanks me.

I also likes the addition of self-serve milk tea. 

Service was good, the waitress knew how often to come over as well as not be bothersome.

Found out the buffet is only Monday through Friday 11am to 3 pm, which is quite the bummer since I work out of town. Minus 1 star for that because I love going to Indian buffets once in a while.
author: Evan L.

description: I was so excited to find a Nepali restaurant somewhat close to my work. Went there couple of times for momo, signature Nepali dish. It's delicious but I can't get over how pricey it is. It's $12 for 8 momo!!! You can go across the street to the Chinese restaurant and get 10 soup dumplings (which are similar to momo) and pay $7 for it! Wish their price was a bit lower, but the food is great!
author: Saluna N.

description:
made the mistake of ordering takeout for lunch yesterday, instead of going to their lunch buffet (which I only learned of when I stopped by to pick up my order). I'm excited to try the buffet sometime, they had a bunch of tasty-looking options.

Anyway, I got the saag paneer yesterday - it was a pretty nice mix of greens (for the saag) and reasonable paneer. What I liked most was that the dish wasn't creamy at all - this is something that a lot of places do to fill up customers, and it isn't authentic at all. So I was really happy about that. The paneer was decent, but nothing special - it didn't taste like it had been cooked with the saag for very long, because it hadn't absorbed any of those flavors. So that is one thing that could be different, but given that we picked up our order 15 mins after calling it in, I can't be that surprised.

One BIG plus, (given that it's san francisco) is that entree dishes come with rice! So you don't have to worry about the additional cost of rice. I really value restaurants that do this, because I hate when a place looks super cheap and then you realize it's because they didn't include the cost of rice. So it's a good, honest place and I'm planning on coming back.
author: Amaresh S.

description: This place is awesome the food and the people working there were just very nice to us and I want to recognize it, they were extremely nice to us,  good food there, they were taking care of us all the time and of course I want to recognize everything they did. thank you very much everyone working there was really a pleasure to be with you few evenings I totally recommend this place. thank you
author: Edu D.

description:
I've ordered from Urban Curry in the past without a problem, so of course on a night when I am home, sick with a cold and craving some spice to open my sinuses, they screw the pooch.  No-show, despite calls from me and from GrubHub.  Hung up on me repeatedly until I cancelled, two hours after placing the order.

----
The delivery guy did show up, 3 hours after I placed the order, to apologize and give me the meal for free.  Given how long it had been out in his car, I am not sure I am going to eat it.
author: Robin W.

description: I've probably eaten here 100 times over the last few years. It's always good. Try the kheer and get some self-serve tea!
author: Eric W.

description: UPDATE- I love this place!! Have been coming here quite often since my job is close by. The waiters are always friendly & always make sure my order is exactly how I want it. I can't get enough
author: Ashley J.

description:
The curry is the best I've had! The service is outstanding friendly and charming.
Next time in San Francisco I will be back
author: Danielle K.

description:
When you first walk in the door, you are greeted with a friendly staff and the delightful aromas of Indian spices. This nice smell really gives you a hard time on deciding what to order since it tempts you in many choices. I ended up ordering the Tikka Masala (~$8.99) while my sister got the spinach lamb saagwala. Both dishes were amazing! ahhh It's especially good with their garlic naan (But of course naan is extra cost)

If you are ever craving delicious Indian food at a reasonable price, Urban Curry is for you. I haven't been there in a while though so prices may vary.
author: Danny L.

description: Was recommended this place by a Nepali friend - their momos are delicious, and definitely try the chow mein!
author: Nora R.

description:
My first time eating Indian food was at this restaurant. It's also the place that made me fell in love with Indian food. I had the Chicken Tikka Masala and it was soooo good! Ate it with some garlic naan. MMMMM so delicious.

 I also tried the lamb curry which wasn't all that great. I was a bit surprise when the waitress brought out the lamb curry because I had thought curry was supposed to be creamy. This dish was not at all.. I guess i was just a noob and didn't know better. I didn't really like how the lamb curry tasted. It just taste like chunky stew. But on the bright side I really like the chai tea they had!
author: Nguyet T.

description: I always get takeouts from here and I have never been disappointed. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the food...what else can I say other than delicious! Unlike most indian restaurants, their spicy food is actually spicy and not too mild for me. Their Dal makhini and Saag paneer are a must try!
author: Prem B.

description: The order came late and there was hair in one of the dishes. The rest of the food was flavorless and over cooked. Save yourself the aggravation and order elsewhere.
author: LionThings D.

description: Very good mushroom korma and palak paneer. Spacious restaurant and not busy on a Saturday evening. Good service. We enjoyed the respite from the busyness outside and a chance to talk without being hurried.
author: P S.

description:
This review is for their lunch buffet. 5 stars all around because the food was absolutely delicious!

The lunch buffet included about seven different dishes, garlic naan (mmmmm... The garlic naan deserves an amazing review all on its own), chai tea, and a salad bar!  Every single thing was tasty. There were four vegetarian dishes, and the others were chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, and goat curry. I love being able to taste different entrees with a variety of flavors, all in one meal.

There's plenty of seating at this place and our server was wonderful.
author: Tracy C.

description:
I contacted Urban Curry for a company dinner that we were having to see if they could do catering for us. Absolutely amazing service; they gave us a great menu that included several vegan options, appetizers, main courses, rice, naan, and dessert, all for an EXTREMELY reasonable price.

Everyone LOVED the food and there was nothing but good feedback for all of the dishes. They have an exceptional catering menu as it is but are very flexible if you want to switch out some dishes for others (for example, I requested samosa for appetizers and changed the chicken vindaloo they originally had on the menu to lamb vindaloo).

More importantly, their communication was key. I called to place and order and requested an emailed receipt, which I instantly received. They answered all of my questions, honored all my requests, and followed up with everything. They delivered all of our food, still hot, 5 minutes early and were extremely professional.

Would HIGHLY, highly recommend Urban Curry to anyone looking for a flawless catering experience with food that everyone will absolutely love! They're great to work with and I can't say enough good things about the food and service at all levels.
author: Chrystal Z.

description: This place is cool. Big place. Has Nepalese food, which was interesting. The samosas were awesome. My dumb friend ordered too much food, but I would speculate that normally it should be reasonably priced.
author: B H.

description: Very tasty! We were craving curry and this place did not disappoint. I said spicy and could have actually had more spice but I think they were trying to be conservative. Very friendly. Lamb curry and Chana Dahl were yummmm
author: Shelly H.

description: Had the chicken Tika masala was a big portion with plain nan.   Very good.  Place was clean and waitress was very nice.  Nothing fancy but good.
author: Craig L.

description:
Urban Curry represents my first trip to an Indian buffet. I eat Indian food fairly often but I've never seemed to make it to a lunch buffet. I know Indian food is very Vegetarian friendly but not always the best Vegan option. This being their buffet, I was fully ready to order from the menu since I ASSumed that all or most of the veg dishes would be paneer or cream based. Thankfully, I was wrong as usual.

I was cautious that there would be very little Vegan choices until I talked to the host who went all out to make me welcome here. He showed me which dishes were Vegan and explained how their buffet works. Normally Naan is served with the buffet but the dude even hooked it up with a Vegan whole wheat Roti instead. 

As for the actual buffet line, 3 of the 4 veg options presented were Vegan. The host even offered to have some more Vegan dishes whipped up and added to the buffet line. I declined since all that were already available looked very tasty. This customer service is what sets Urban Curry apart from other Indian restaurants. The food was very good but not sure I would give it a full star rating based on price unless the customer service was as great as it is. So 4.5 it is!

The Dal soup had a satisfying spice to add some kick to the lentils in it. I had two servings of this soup! I think the other Vegan option was an okra something. It was good and again, very spicy. Sensing a theme here? Yep, all of their dishes are fairly spicy, especially considering its their standard spice level. Even the papadums have a bit of a peppery bite to them. The only thing missing from the buffet is a selection of chutney. Too bad they don't have some squeeze bottles of this stuff available. 

The Aloo Gobi is always a great Vegan option and the version here is no exception. It was actually spicier than I have had at most places without specifying "spicy". It's very good and I would order this as an entree if I ever make it here for dinner.

The interior makes me think this used to be an Italian or Pizza place. It's fairly large inside and next door to some of the most friendly businesses in town. I could see this as a great dinner spot before catching some of the outstanding entertainment that is available nearby...

Pro Tip: Don't forget 15% off for your Yelp check-in!
author: John B.

description: I'm not sharing the love for this joint, which was the venue of choice for a casual luncheon with co-workers today (and often is on other days).
