The all-you-can-eat offerings looked less-than-fresh, and were so-so in taste. I ate cautiously and sparingly so as not to risk re-encountering lunch later, during my scheduled 6-mile run. One co-worker discovered a fruit fly on her food (in January!), thus killing her (and my) appetite. And at $14.99 for the buffet, it is offensively pricey. I'll pass on the invite next time.
author: Kim S.

description:
I looked up this place on yelp and checked in to get 10% off.
Restaurant was good with nice ambience and waiter was cheerful.
I enjoyed egg biryani and would definitely recommend this place to anyone
author: Suhas H.

description:
Ordered through Grub Hub. 

Food arrived hot and delicious. I ordered a chicken biryani and lamb jalfraizee. It wasn't oily or strangely colored. The rice was excellent and all the ingredients tasted like they were good quality.
author: Kira G.

description: Fast delivery and delicious! Samosas were huge! 2 is more than enough for 4-6 people. The chicken tikka masala is buttery and super spicy (just the way I like it), goat karahi was tendered and not as gamey as I thought it would be and prawn vindaloo was good but not as good as the goat karahi. Get extra garlic naan! They even called me to confirm my order.
author: T. T.

description: I'm no expert of Indian food at all, so I let my my Indian friend order and everything was good. We had fried chicken as starter, and then lamb curry and some vegetarian curry, plus a spicy chicken pot. All of them are decent. All meals come with Indian milk tea ( self serve) They also serve lunch buffet which looks decent too.
author: Sophia H.

description: Wow... Yelp really led me wrong here. I ordered some tiki masala for delivery, which showed up flavorless and dry. Super fast delivery, but won't be ordering from here again...
author: Emy D.

description: Still my favorite place for pakora. Such nice staff. Chai is complimentary. I love their buffet. So glad they are still open. I always come when I'm in North Beach.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: I got chicken tiki masala. Boyfriend got chicken vandaloo. Both very good.  The garlic naan was delicious.  Service was decent. I would recommend.
author: J L.

description:
The five-star rating also mean "Really Spicy". With the recent cold weather, it's not a bad way to warm you up; would you say?

I came here on my lunch break in the evening. I was amazed on how clean this big place was. Everything in the restaurant is brand new. The hostess/waitress was very nice and took me to my seat. 

From the menu, I had the Chicken Biryani. For $8.99, I get chicken pieces with Basmati Rice mixed with various herbs and spices. For a little kick, I was brave enough and decided to get my dish "extra spicy." When I received my rice dish and my first bite was what I expected, "spicy." For $2.00, I also had a glass of Mango Lassi (Mango Puree with a Yogurt drink) to sooth the spiciness down my system. I've also added a bowl of fresh Naan bread with my meal. And the fresh Naan was buttery and tasty. 

My dish: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/EFjaNaqg2foSIM--mML49g?select=pHcwXdf7uLK_eaZZDnSkcQ

Naan: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/EFjaNaqg2foSIM--mML49g?select=VhOrmsYnX83cLgcYQpJhdg

Mango Lassi: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/EFjaNaqg2foSIM--mML49g?select=o7Zmf0a9wq_9Clx24rwysQ

My Visa was accepted for my meal. 

The restaurant also honor Yelpers a discount for your meal. But I forgot. 

But I'll definitely be back and check out other delicious Indian/Pakistiani foods. 

I'm knocking off one-star, because they were playing Michael Bolton's greatest hits while I was dining there. I don't mind their own ethnic music, but not Michael Bolton.
author: Matt G.

description:
I went to Urban Curry for the $11.99 buffet during lunch hour with a coworker. The place was mostly empty, which always makes me skeptical at buffet spots because it means the food has just been sitting there. The lunch buffet comes with chai or a soft drink and naan.

Most of the choices were uninspiring and almost bland. The chicken tikka masala was strangely sweet and overly buttery. It was also this unappetizing shade of neon orange. The variety is also quite lackluster, although there is a healthy balance of vegetarian and non-vegetarian options.

The setup is also quite confusing, as there's no one at the door to greet you or explain the buffet deal. I probably wouldn't be back, but it's not entirely terrible and didn't leave me feeling bloated after.
author: Jessica F.

description: Good WAS NOT fresh. Too expensive for stale, bad quality bland good. I rather pay $20 for buffet and have a nice and fresh meal. We will not be back.
author: Livelove L.

description: I appreciate their ease of ordering on various websites, but there is absolutely no flavor in this food! We had their lamb korma and channa masala; two of my most favorite indian dishes. The korma looked like it was dyed artificially with some sort of yellow and had absolutely no spice at all! the channa masala was more edible, but equally disappointing.  The naan was fluffy and seemed recently reheated or cooked, but again, lacked flavor. Definitely not authentic, but edible cuisine.  If you like bland food, this is your goto spot for sure!
author: Meredith A.

description: Food is EXCELLENT, this was the restaurant that introduced me to Indian Food it's been 5 or 6 years and this spot is still my favorite! The owner is a real nice guy as well. Only thing is the Indian guy with glasses was kind of rude last time but still don't affect my 5 star rating. Chicken tikka masala hands down the best on the menu
author: Lance L.

description:
I have only ordered takeout from here but this is really solid Indian food. In short, flavor is good and it's not overly oily like too many Indian places are.

The channa masala was very interestingly flavored; a nice kick of spice but the spice didn't overwhelm the dish. 

The daal was perfect - not too creamy but the lentils were still falling apart. 

Roti is the flavor lacking younger brother of naan (my only choice as a vegan) but this place actually makes really good roti; nice and thick and definitely has flavor.

Ordered through grub hub and the food came very quickly and was packaged well. This might be my new go to spot for Indian food in the city!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Pros: price
Cons: no flavor, poor meat quality? I ordered two chicken dishes and they were both extremely plain, no spice and very little flavor. Meat always seemed sketchy, and then the 2nd time going here I got 3 very very large bones in the dish, reflecting very little attention to detail with meat selection. Also very dangerous. They were nearly the size of chicken wings.
author: Brandon N.

description:
If I were a Bollywood hero this would be the part of the film where I confront the villain and tell him he has shamed our village.

The fact that this place is located next to three different strip clubs should have been a warning sign. Perhaps the cook called in sick and they had a lap dancer from next door fill in for him. 

When I opened my container of take out daal there was enough oil on top to entice Chevron to open a refinery. I spent about five minutes trying to drain it. The chicken tikka masala, well it looks generous till you realize there's about five bites of chicken and the rest is just sauce. Kun-joos!

I wanted to go back there and shout like I was Amitabh Bachchan confronting the goons in Zanjeer.
author: Ash S.

description:
Perfectly decent, reasonably cheap Indian/Pakistani food in a surprisingly large, if a bit dingy, space that's conducive to large groups. Indeed, I came with 5 other people one recent weekday evening and found it largely empty; we stayed and chatted for quite a long time. I imagine this place is far busier during the weekday lunch hour as it's not far from the Financial District.

Large portions, reasonably friendly service (although mostly self-serve), and a 15% discount for checking in on Yelp. Score!
author: Vincent L.

description:
Disclaimer: I haven't actually dined in to this place but have ordered delivery many times now. 

Urban curry is consistently very good. We usually order the same thing; chicken tikka masala, rice, mango lassi and cheese/plain naan. Nothing particularly adventurous by any means but they do a great job with the classic dishes. 

I am giving them five stars not because they are on par with the cities top dining options, but because they consistently execute the basics well and are a great take out/ delivery option.
author: Nicholas H.

description: We had the lunch buffet and apart from the naan pretty much everything was mediocre at best.
author: Julian A.

description:
"45 minute confirmed delivery" turned into 90 minute, then turned into 115 minutes, then turned into a cancellation.  After the 90-minute wait, I cancelled the order 25 minutes after restaurant told me that driver would be here in "10-15 minutes".

Don't make promises you can't keep.
author: David P.

description: Veeeeeeeery tasty!!!!   Simosa, lamb & shrimp korma Very flavorful , and fluffy delicious naan!   A def revisit for me!!!
author: GW W.

description:
Absolutely awesome place! During my childhood, I have had great Indo-Chinese/Nepalese food in India. Chicken chili, paneer chili, manchurians, momos, hakka noodles. This place is about as authentic as you can get for this kind of food. And ridiculously cheap for the quality. Must visit for people wanting to taste a different type of cuisine. Would definitely go there again. 
Seemed like they had the usual Indian dishes too, but I only tried the Indo-Chinese items. Chai was very good too.
author: S P.

description:
Ordered this as delivery. 

I would have to say that this is by far one of the best indian delivery that I've had. 
The nan was on spot. Oh my! the moment you open the foil and open it up you can smell the garlic that it's like you're tasting it! 

The curry itself was also very good and well done. Ordered the Tikka Masala and it was well made. More buttery in taste than sour, which I like and I enjoy that it was customizable in spice. 

The delivery time was also good and quick.
author: Suzie B.

description:
Some of the best Bollywood cuisine I've eaten in a long time!

My girlfriend and I decided to take a break from all the sushi, barbeque, deep fried and oily, and overly consumed Asian cuisine and just wanted a more lighter dinner, which evidently lead us here with high expectations for some good curry: lamb curry to be exact. 

Lamb Curry - [http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/0UBR3MMYJSQ-93jJk9G7Zg/l.jpg]
Big chunks of lamb smothered in a thick curry sauce cooked with various chilies and spices: now that's how lamb curry should be done! The lamb was super tender and soft while the spices of the curry really fired my taste buds (as well as sinuses!)

Goat Biryani - [http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/3Vv9TCJ74Qb-HYsQpiBgQw/l.jpg]
Considering rice was not included with any of the entrees, we decided to order this dish because it came with rice, of course! and it was yet another great dish. Indian spiced fried rice with fall-off-the-bone goat meat, which sounds so wrong, but tastes so right. It could have used more goat meat but with the lamb curry already, it sufficed. Need I mention, it was a MOUNTAIN amount of rice for just the two of us.. 

Garlic Naan - [http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/GPA4wVoFRsqs7DtUfq-K_A/l.jpg]
What's an Indian dinner without some fresh naan!? Especially if they have garlic naan! That's like saying, "would you like french fries with that? or curly fries?" Of course, curly! The fresh out-of-the-oven garlic flat-bread was light, crispy, and the garlic on the naan was amazing with the lamb curry! 

Urban Curry gives off a hole-in-the-wall vibe to it, but not in a negative way. Spaciously separated tables, dimly-lit Indian decor, very chill atmosphere, and of course, a flat-screen playing your favorite Bollywood music videos back to back. Along with that, all of the food is made fresh to order, the employees are very friendly (our waiter kept our water refilled and even gave us complimentary Chai milk teas), and the food isn't expensive at all. Why this restaurant is classified as $$ when it's merely just $ is beyond me (Yelp typo!?). Annnnndd especially since you get 15% off your TOTAL bill for those of you that check-in on Yelp -- That's insane! 

Urban Curry, your going down as one of my cheapest, friendly, fullest, and flavorful-est dinners yet.
author: Albert L.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of Indian food, but I really liked the food when I ate here. I first tried it because we ordered lunch from here and had it delivered at work. I had the Chicken Makhani with naan. DELICIOUS. I dreamt about when I could eat that meal again. Luckily, my coworker felt the same and we went to check out the restaurant that weekend. We ordered the same thing and we weren't disappointed. We also had the Fish Pakora, which is a fried fish with spices and some kind of crunchy breading. It was great - soft, flaky fish that was not dry with a tasty, crunchy coating.

The actual place is nothing fancy. It's clean. It doesn't smell. And the toilets are clean. However, the service was great and the food is delicious.
author: Japs C.

description: Very good!!! Service is quick and very attentive to your needs, the Cheese Naan is great with the Chicken Tikka Masala!!!
author: Francesco F.

description:
The authentic Indian cuisine here is outstanding and the place is very tidy. We ordered the cheese naan to start; it was warm and gooey and exceeded expectations. Next, we ordered the dumplings with chicken (we forgot to order them initially) and the chef rushed them for us so they could be an appetizer, a sign of what great service we had. 

I ordered the goat biryani as an entree with medium spice. The goat was tender and juicy (bone-in of course) and full of flavor in true Indian style...the level of spiciness was just enough to finish off each bite but not close to making your head steam.  

My friend ordered the chicken tikka masala and the meat was also very juicy. 

We'd both recommend this place to anyone in the area...and we will come again next time we're in town!!
author: AmiJo B.

description:
Urban Curry was okay. Friendly service and quick delivery but the food was very average in my opinion.

The best part of the meal was the vegetable pakoras which were good. The rest...eh. Naan was not very good. Very doughy. The chicken tikka masala was quite greasy. As other reviewers have mentioned you could see the oil floating in the sauce rather than the sauce having a smooth, creamy consistency. Too bad because usually chicken tikka masala has such a lovely delectable sauce. 

My boyfriend had the chicken curry and said it was pretty good. I tried it and thought it was alright. One plus was that the prices were very cheap. Having the Yelp deal didn't hurt, either! 

Worth a try when in San Francisco but sadly this was a miss for me in spite of the good price!
author: Chelsea J.

description:
One of the best Indian restaurants I've been so far. The food was excellent. The staff was, let's say OK. They tried to be friendly but didn't always succeed ;)
But the reason you go to a restaurant is the food and here they were literally flawless. 
Only the interior of the place wasn't very inviting but when you taste the food everything is forgotten...
author: Fabian H.

description:
I get what other reviewers are saying about the authenticity/spice issue. This is definitely americanized Indian food - but you know what? It's SO DELISH!

My dream meal: samosas to start (perfectly crunchy/salty on the outside), chicken tikka masala over basmati rice, a side of cheese naan, and some kheer for dessert. Holy moly, that's heaven right there.

I usually order delivery from GrubHub and it arrives within 45 minutes, STEAMING hot (no idea how they accomplish that fresh-out-the-oven situation, but love it).
author: Kelly B.

description:
PARKING SUCKS SUCKS SUCKS!!!  I arrived in the neighborhood at about 9pm on a Saturday night.. I probably drove around the area until 9:30 or 9:45 for a parking spot.  I WAS SO MAD!!!  

Sorry Urban Curry, I know I shouldn't take this out on you.. but I was just not a happy camper when I got to your restaurant.

We had a fairly large party, and they were able to accommodate us immediately.  We ordered a few dishes and shared them family style among 8 people.  My favorite was probably the curry chicken - it was slightly spicy and the chicken was really tender.  I also loved the garlic nan.. yummy!  

Tip: If you check-in on Yelp, you get a 15% discount!  The coupon said it only applied to one item, but our waitress gave us 15% off our entire tab!  SWEET!!!  

However, I will still have to give this place 3 stars... it's not the BEST Indian food, and like I said before.. parking is really terrible...
author: Cecilia S.

description:
Came here on my lunch break for a to-go order 

Free Chai Tea while you wait, not for to-go

Garlic Naan fresh and flavorful, but not as buttery as i would like it to be

Tikka Masala - not an excellent tikka massala - there seemed to be something missing, and there were clumps of dry chicken breast in it.  it was all in a small container.   no wonder why i recieved a slight discount, i just gave the difference in tip anyways.

all the staff are really nice, however it's certainly not the best choice for a lunch near chinatown
author: Tina A.

description: The food was great. I got it delivered to the hotel and the momos were still steaming. Loved their taste - very authentic and rare in these parts. The chicken tikka, naan and biryani tasted good too. Overall a good experience!
author: Amit K.

description:
Since they've come under new management I stopped going as much (they took my favorite item off the menu #cryingfaceemoji). Nonetheless the food is still pretty good. I had to substitute my favorite menu item, the creamy pepper chicken, for the Chicken taka masala. It's delicious, there's an amazing velvety, spicy, creamy sauce that the chicken itself must be marinated in because it holds the flavor so well. I dont order indian food from any other place.


PS
The basmati rice and paneer naan are still bomb af too
author: Candice B.

description: Terrible food and terrible attitude of delivery staff as well. We called the restaurant to inform them that the quality was not good for what we had paid and the manager agreed to refund. However the delivery man decided to give us a lecture on how our untouched food was 50% eaten and the money would not be refunded. We were forced to take pictures to prove our case because this man was lying to our face. Sort your team out, this kind of service in unacceptable anywhere in the world.
author: Keerthi S.

description: My dad came to the US for the first time and this was the first reataurant where I took him to for lunch, we were sitting there for 15mins and no one took out order, finally some did, we ordered two naans becAuse we thought we'll order some more, when we were finished with our naan, I was hoping someone will show up, i even tried calling them for help but it seemed they didn't care. Food was barely average this is not good Indian food that they are selling, places like these make Indin cuisine look bad.
author: Bhavesh S.

description: This used to be my favorite indian food restaurant (that delivers). However, now they have started charging separately for rice. Additionally, the delivery time is usually upwards of an hour, and the service is terrible--i ordered 2 sides of rice and they only gave me 1. When I called to see if it was a mistake, they told me that it would be another hour before they could return my money or deliver the side of rice. RIDICULOUS. i will never order from here again.
author: Dani P.

description: Had a delivery of samosas for an office Staff Social and decided to order them from Urban Curry.  The head honcho was vegan so this place fit the bill for ordering.  The samosas were delivered on time (important for any scheduled office gathering), hot, and came with two sauces -- both were spicy but were great compliments.  Will definitely use them again for catering an order.
author: Emy B.

description:
Overall, decent food but nothing to rave about

Aloo tikki was very oily and plain tasting but samosas were good (not too much oil).
Medium mushroom korma was pretty spicy to me but in a good way.
Butter naan was not very crispy or fluffy - good medium.
author: Sandhya S.

description:
We ordered lunch today from Urban Curry to be delivered. The online ordering was very easy. Delivery estimate was 45 minutes to an hour, it was definitely on the hour plus side when the food arrived. But, the guy who delivered our food was very polite and came up to our floor rather than waiting for us in the lobby which was a bonus. 

I ordered the chicken gobhi, mild. It was definitely more medium than mild, although I am notoriously a wimp about that. The chicken was all dark meat which was slightly disappointing. The naan was good and arrived nice and fluffy still! + 1 for that

My coworkers ordered the mushroom masala and the chicken vindaloo. Everyone agreed the food was pretty good. We will most likely order from here again.
author: Rachel E.

description:
This place has the best chicken tikka masala, garlic nan, and kheer I have ever had- and I've been to dozens of Indian and Pakistani restaurants across the west coast. 

Some places make the chicken tikka masala very tomato-y, or add too few spices- these guys got it right, with a perfect balance of spices and no tomato flavor, it's also perfectly creamy.

The garlic nan came out after the chicken tikka masala, and I had already been waiting quite a while, so I was going to give them 4 stars. But then I tasted the nan and kheer (best kheer ever!! It's creamy and flavorful- mindblowing), and I couldn't care less if I had been made to wait even an hour! It was that good! (I waited about 20-25 min for the chicken tikka masala, and the place was empty.) 

Maybe they make everything from scratch- I wouldn't be surprised! 

I honestly wouldn't even care if I got food poisoning, the flavor is so good I would give them 5 stars and come back the next day. Actually, I plan to come here every night for the remainder of my week stay in SF. They're just that awesome.
author: Cristina M.

description: Nice save!!! We were starving and walked all around Broadway and other streets before we found Urban Curry. We ordered the chefs special "Curry Tikka Masala" and "Lamb Biryani." The waitress was informative and patient with us as we asked her to explain. The food was hot, delicious and filling (a lot of food)! They have self serve Chi Tea that was a nice touch! The place is warm and inviting!
author: Katt D.

description: We found this place by chance while visiting San Fran. We had two kids with us and the waiter was very kind making sure the items we ordered for them were not spicy. The food was cooked fresh and was excellent. The food was priced low and tasted superb.
author: Dylan F.

description: They have great unlimited milk tea, and the chicken momo is delightful! I recommend this place for late night or take-out! They also deliver! If you want good Indian food, then Urban Curry is a great choice!
author: Kyeihong K.

description:
Since moving back to the neighborhood I decided to give Urban curry a chance, and I was very pleased. I haven't yet tried their lunch buffet, but I've had a few things on the menu and everything was delicious. When you tell them very spicy, they actually do it! 

Every time I went to pick up my to-go orders the staff has been exceptionally friendly and helpful. They allow me to sit at a table and have a drink of water or chai while waiting for my food. I'm very happy I've moved so close to this restaurant.
author: Marcus L.

description: Food was pretty good, paneer tikka masala & aloo gobi were tasty. Garlic naan was good and so were paneer pakoda. Its a big place, but the ambiance could be much better. Service was on the dot.
author: Rao S.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE . if u wanna get a taste of real street food of Delhi, I soo so so suggest you to get veg chowmein and momos. I've been craving for this taste since forever and didn't know about this little jewel. The complimentary tea is also a plus cuz I love chai.  Although I wish it was cooked more and had more ginger.  I'd say great customer service, great food with decent price. Definitely bookmarking this one . Seriously. ..try veg chowmein and momos
author: Neha K.

description:
What is happening, Yelp?! Why does this place have four stars?? Perhaps every Yelper to give a 3+ star rating has never tried Indian before?!?!

Let me just say that my boyfriend is still emotionally recovering from the terrible Chicken Tikka Masala. This is a man who would eat Indian every night if I let him. Let's just say they should rename the CTM to "Chicken in Tomato Bisque." What happened to the cumin and chile?! Haha I should have guessed, being in North Beach, the Italians got to this place. Should have ordered pasta with it!

Ugh and my Navaratan (Veggie) Korma tasted like something that came out of a can! So flat in flavor and where is the spice?! Gross. A waiter even had the audacity to come around and ask if the dishes were too spicy for us! 

A message to all Indian places - don't Americanize or white-ify your food. If people can't handle to spice, good riddance! 

Stay away! If you're in North Beach/Chinatown do yourself a favor and hit up the many decent Italian or Chinese places around. FML.
author: Sarah H.

description: Everything you need for a quick tasty lunch! Try the buffet options, and don't forget to ask for fresh naan as well! Good food at a decent price with very friendly service!
author: Lex L.

description: Wow wow wow.. Had the coconut curry and onion Nan and brown rice.  Wonderful!  Definitely would come again.. I am no expert on indian food but I do have a memory and a decent palette.  From what I can remember this ranks up there in deliciousness..
author: Jim H.

description: My boo and I love this place we've been coming here for the past 6 months. We love everyone here they are down to earth and a super friendly bunch. They always go out of their way to make sure we have a pleasant time. The food is super delicious. We recommend the chicken tikka masala and the tandoori chicken. The portions are generous and the prices are great.
author: Andy C.

description:
Got the coconut chicken curry, cheese naan, saag paneer and three budwisers. delivery. 

It was all really tasty.. I would give it 5 stars, except they forgot to give utensils and being that i was in a hotel....I had to eat it with a complementary coffee cup from the room. (no i'm not going to bother the nice woman at the front desk for a plastic spork)
author: Drawing G.

description:
The first time I went here, I really liked their food.  The chicken tikke masala, garlic naan and lamb biryani were all excellent. They even gave me a discount for checking in through Yelp.  That was for a take out order.

Fast forward a couple months later, I decided to order their delivery service. I really liked how you can put in your order online and I thought that was a nice touch for their business.  It took about an hour for our food to show up which I think is standard for a lot of deliveries. The food that arrived was not what I expected based on my previous experience.  The chicken tikka masala was extremely bland.  In fact, I had to add some salt just to get some flavor with the sauce.  I also felt like the naan they gave us with our order was old. The texture was almost stale.  It was such a bummer!  I think I will have to find a different Indian food delivery service next time. I need a place where the quality is consistent.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description: Finally got a chance to try this place. I really wish it wasn't in the middle of Broadway. The parking sucks balls! Anyways, we had the Chicken Tikka Masala (I've had better), and the Chicken Boti (Excellent, and very tasty. I was very surprised by how good this dish was). I tried a Mango Lassi  for the very first time, which was excellent (but apperently, my friend tells me that she has had much better, so I'm going to try it in other places). A good dining experience, and it doesn't hurt that I get to watch the parade of hookers walk by on a Saturday Night.
author: Ron Z.

description:
We went on a journey to china town and ran into here for a quick app. Service was quite slow since we were the only ones in there.

Food was quite average compared to the ones here in MN, I would give it 3 Stars but it took 10 mins get our order and another 10 mins to cash us out after we received our check, who doesn't want to collect money?!
author: Jack F.

description: The momo dumpling are delish! Very savory and nice spices flavor. Great friendly service
author: Ben H.

description: We had chowmein, momo, biryani!!! This place me fulfill my cravings for those foods. All were quite good. I don't mind visit this place again and again.
author: Jamir M.

description: I loved the noodles and Chicken here ordered so many times, but I guess the chef has changed the food from last 3 times was soooo bad I gave benefit of doubt 2 times the 3rd time food just smelled bad you cant eat.
author: Nitesh J.

description:
This place has a nice decor when you walk in, but since it was a weekday, it was a bit dead in area and an hour before it was close.  Anyways, I came here only because I purchased a deal where I paid ten bucks and got twenty bucks worth of food.  These deals like this are sweet!

Looking in the menu I usually get lamb, I am a fan of Lamb and with curry sauce it's a win!  So I ordered the Tikka Masala Lamb, and Butter Chicken which was not on the menu because it was a daily special and a garlic naan.  I also asked the waiter if they had the black milk tea with sugar called "chai".

The "Chai" is black tea with milk with some kind of spicy to it.  It tastes similar to milk tea and I usually ask for it at an Indian cuisine.

All the food came out at once, which is good, but one of the curries was hotter than the other which kind of suck.  The Naan was delicious and soft and not burnt.  The Tikka Masla Lamb was delicious.  Creamy and the lamb were boneless.  I like more of the bone on stuff on the meat than this. The curry lacked any spicy because my friend couldn't eat spicy so it was pretty neutral.  The Butter chicken was alright, the sauce was creamy and a bit too sweet for my taste and some of the dark meat chicken taste like rubber, as if it was cooking for too long.

Overall, it's alright I have taste better and I wasn't completely satisfied with the food.  It lack some flavors and the lamb and chicken dint' have much flavor in to it.  If it wasn't for the online deal, I doubt I would ever even go to this place.  Their commercial YouTube video of this place looks really nice but it's a bit different when you experience it yourself. 

*parking*

Depending on the time you go parking is readily available, but for meter spots

They take cash or credit.
author: Kenneth Y.

description: The food is authentic and well prepared. The staff are very nice. We really enjoyed our dinner. And we will definitely come back.
author: Dan L.

description: Came here with a few coworkers for lunch. The food was pretty good and would come back again. I wish they had a few more options for protein but the over all experience was positive.
author: Timur M.

description: I really liked this place. There was a little confusion with our order but what we got was tasty, hot and arrived quickly. Some of the best naan I have ever had. I would not hesitate to recommend this place. Two thumbs up!
author: Sean P.

description: Had dinner there for four people.  Having been to Nepal, I can tell you the food was authentic and tasted great.  What awesome variety they have.  The ambiance was casual and low-key.  The owner, Purna Sherpa, was very welcoming and had great stories about coming here and opening the restaurant.
author: Doug D.

description:
I ordered food from here again.  This time it was with my lil bro.

1.  Easy to order from Grubhub.com

2.  Palak Paneer - My bro ordered this.  He loved it.  He said it had great zip and that it was the best he ever had.

http://tinyurl.com/3e494rt

3.  Chicken Masala - I usually order spicier curries.  However, I wanted something a little milder. This was pretty good.  It has a nice creamy consistency.  The flavors were there. The chicken was tender.  I do not enjoy it as much as vindaloo.  But it was pretty good.

http://tinyurl.com/3o628fx

4.  Vegetable Samosa - These were good.  Nice crisp shell.  The texture of the fillings was almost perfect.  There was a nice layering of flavors.

5.  Vegetable Pakora - I enjoyed this.  Nice flavors combined with crispy goodness.  I could eat a saddle bag of these.  This dish get interpreted many ways.  This is the version that I really enjoy.  It is pretty much a fritter made of vegetables which are fried.

6.  Garlic Naan - This was good naan.  The amount of garlic was just right.  I

7.  Delivery was fast.  The delivery person was professional and polite.
author: Mark D.

description:
Broadway's Urban Curry gets a solid 4.5 due to the excellent food, prepared with care and with thoughtful presentation.  This is quite possibly the best Indian I've had, certainly my favorite in San Francisco (granted that's not saying much since I haven't been to a ton of Indian places).

The neighborhood is fairly sketchy (or awesome, depending on your affinity for strip clubs and porn shops).  But inside, Jason G. summed it up well:  "The food is good, The place is clean, The  service was good."  I agree wholeheartedly.  The good is very good.  You can't go wrong with the sizzling plates.  The garlic naan was nice and fluffy, not obnoxiously garlic-y (new word alert). The spice level of their dishes is spot on.  The server asked us how spicy we wanted our meal and we replied, "very spicy, not burn your face off spicy, but very spicy."  He knew exactly what we meant and delivered our meals just the way we asked. 

The friendly servers and staff were always around, smiling, giving suggestions.  They even have a water ninja who took it upon herself to never let my water glass go more than half empty.

Food-wise, I would suggest the Karahi.  The Aloo Palak was very good too.  Then again, the sizzling tandoories looked so good...certainly more reasons for me to come back.
author: Angel S.

description: Great milk tea. Great service. Waiter was very attentive. Delicious vindaloo and tikka masala.
author: Leonidas L.

description: These guys are amazing. Having become a customer here for sometime. I used to get free Mango Lasse.  they use to treat me nicely. Their customer service is on point. I recommend it for anybody.
author: Afamefuna I.

description:
Based on food only (grub hub, delivery):
- Chicken Tikka Masala: good flavor, creamier than usual, but the sauce is rather thin, like a bisque
- Chicken Vindaloo: tasty, but not very spicy
- Garlic naan: decent, a little doughy
- Rice: solid

In a pinch, this place works!
author: Crystal M.

description: I've been trying several Indian restaurants in SF and I can definitely tell this one is my favourite. The tikka massala sauce is really good. I personally ask for mild! I've tried almost all the dishes since I live very close to it. The price ratio is good, the place is big and you don't wait. Waiter are super nice. It's a five star!
author: Mathieu F.

description: Our group of six was looking for dinner around the City Lights Bookstore area so we popped into Urban Curry. It has a giant dining area, and we sat in the very back at a large eight-person table. We ordered an assortment of vegetarian dishes. My favorite was actually the vegetable biryani. Unfortunately, I really didn't love any of the curries. They all seemed excessively creamy, especially the mushroom curry, and I didn't like the strong dairy flavors. They were all a milky orange or yellow color. I likened the mushroom one to alfredo, and another person in our dining party thought the paneer tikka masala tasted like Spaghetti-O's (he said "not in a bad way," but just stating a fact). The one curry that was not super creamy was the fish curry, but it was extremely salty. For six entrees plus some naan and rice, the total plus tax and tip came out to be ~$17 per person. Signs around the restaurant stated that an 18% gratuity would be automatically added for parties of six or more, but it turns out that they didn't add it for us. I've definitely had better Indian food elsewhere.
author: Amy G.

description: This was a great meal! Our party of four ordered fish pakora, goat biryani, goat curry, and malai kofta, and it was the perfect amount. Everything was spiced exactly how we ordered it, which was a plus. The only problems were the goat in both the curry and the biryani- it was slightly undercooked, so it was not really tender, really hard to chew and cut. The fish was also pretty bland. Do keep in mind that everything is served a la carte, so rice and naan need to be ordered on the side. The service was great and the waiters were accommodating, and there was no wait. Overall, everything tasted great and was reasonably priced, but avoid the goat and the fish pakora. Would definitely come again.
author: Priya S.

description:
Location is a bit iffy, but just ignore those guys that offer some "good time" if you come in. Well, unless you actually wanna get one. Make sure you get some curry first tho.

Food:
- Chicken tikka masala: creamy, tomato-y, good portion, not too big not too small. The chicken pieces are tender
- Lamb jalfrezi. Great spice, spicy (well, I chose hot), love the ginger slices and the lamb is tender and not gamy. I love love this dish. Their prawn version is really good as well.
- Chicken boti: The chicken pieces is a bit too big to be flavorful, so I'm not gonna order this again.
- Basmati rice: yummmy

Service is great and they give you a free chai tea. The place is also clean, not like Shalimar which floor I can't even look at (it's gross)
author: Novalina N.

description: This was our first time at this place. People were nice. Service was ok. But the food was pretty darn tasty. The sauces were really flavorful. The dumplings were great. The garlic Naan was the bomb. We had the Tikka Masala and the chicken was kinda dry but the flavor was great. Would definitely go back. No reservation necessary.
author: Aaron B.

description:
Came in for dinner with two other people. We got the chicken tiki masala, lamb coconut, fish tandoori, amd three different naans (plain, cheese, and kabuli). There is also free chai tea.

The place did not have anyone there when we came in around 6:30 Friday night. As we were almost done, more people started coming in, so we came at a good time for faster service and food.

All the food were good. I especially liked the lamb coconut amd kabuki naan. The chicken amd lamb were sauced well. It did taste like any other Indian restaurant, so there wasn't that WOW factor I was looking for..

The waiter was also very nice and attentive. My water was near its last sip, and he came in to refill it without me asking. Always a plus for that. However, they didn't day bye to us like I hoped (for good service from when I walked in to when I leave).

Overall, still recommend for decent indian food at a decent price.
author: Yan L.

description: So I'm a bit confused. This place received a lot of four stars and I give it a 2 compared to other Indian curry places in SF. I had it delivered but it didn't seem as flavorful which was surprising. I ordered a dish mild and it definitely had no spice to a fault in a way. I want to try it again but would probably try somewhere else.
author: Heather R.

description:
Anybody needs tasty food with excellent service with reasonable price??????
  Here they come ,,URBAN CURRY,,
Omg their food tastes really awesome.And price?? price is nothing after trying their food .cheapest n best food ever tried,,Thank u guys for delivering such an excellent service and best food  price.
author: Sandesh U.

description:
Unfortunately the curries were very bland. The waiter asked if it was too spicy so I politely told him it was a little bland. He apologized and told us most people complain it's too spicy. Frankly it could have been more flavorful even without being spicy. I recommend asking for spicy when ordering.

We ordered the mattur paneer and chicken tikka masala.
author: Quarup B.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE!
I was poisoned by the Chicken Saagwala tonight.
Stomach cramps and throwing up within 90 minutes of eating.
I have never had such a violent reaction to food in my life.
I wish I could give no stars!
author: John R.

description:
Urban curry is an outstanding lunchtime buffet value. 

I was here on 3/20/15 at about 12:30 for lunch.

For $14 incl tax you can have the lunch buffet.

You get a choice of regular or garlic naan. As Naan's go, it was good, and the garlic wasn't entirely well distributed on the bread, and was mildly burnt, but still tasted like good naan, and I was happy to pour my entree selections onto as I shepherded indian cuisine into my mouth.

The buffet itself consisted of fried onion things which were great; saag, which was not too creamy, a mushroom something that had tofu in it, chicken Korma, a lamb curry, and tandori chicken. The tandori chicken and saag were my favorite, but the mushroom yello curry thing was a close second as it also had my all time favorite paneer.

Also the thin grains of rice were available.

The salad bar was okay, but don't be upset, because you don't go to the buffet for the salad bar. It had lettuce, that green dressing/sauce you find at indian buffets, carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes and maybe on other thing.

It's pretty fast to get settled as you can claim a table, grab a plate, and get to the buffeting, no waiting to be seated necessary. 

The place felt reasonably clean though it was a little dark in the back of the restaurant, but did not feel unpleasant or dingy, just less bright.

When you're done, just walk to the cashier and settle up.

There's no restroom, so you may have to peepee dance if necessary, but all in all, for $14 to get a really good buffet with no wait at an outstanding SF lunch value.

I'll see you there next time!
author: Sam H.

description: I've been coming here multiple times a week for a year and a half now. The food is reliably great, with various authentic Nepali options that you wouldn't find in most Indian restaurants, like chicken momos, or chowmein. Highly recommended.
author: Andrey L.

description:
Positive: it was easy to seat our large party. 

Otherwise, it was a middle-of-the-road experience.
author: Cynthia M.

description: Place is good for what you pay for and the servers are friendly. They also provided a buffet for $12 and free soda. However I haven't had anything from the buffet so don't quote me on that. The only negative thing I can say is the portion size seems to be a little smaller then the other places I've been too.
author: Antonio C.

description: Ordered here last night with a LS deal. Ordered the Tikka Masala (spicy) and the chicken Jalfrazi (medium) for entrees along with the Aloo and Paneer naan. My masala was tasty but not what I would call spicy at all, I dumped a bunch of chili flakes in it. Hubbs enjoyed the Jalfrazi, it has a somewhat similar profile but with more veggies. Both naan were good, but the Paneer was fricken delicious. My husband fell in love with that piece of bread. All in all a good meal, but they could ramp up the heat level and the portion sizes were a little smaller than other places I've ordered from.
author: Nicole Z.

description: This is my go to for Indian food.  They serve the creamiest chicken ticka massala and their chicken momo is off the hook.  Their delivery service is very timely and the restaurant is clean and charming (it's fun to watch the line of chefs do their thing as well).  When I have gone in, the service is very attentive and awesome.  Thank you for the years of great food!
author: Ryan M.

description: I will never order from here again. The lamb vindaloo was literally 2 small pieces of lamb and 7 - I counted! - giant chunks of carrot (or sweet potato maybe - I wasn't interested in trying it) drowned in a bizarrely watery fire sauce. The chicken saag was bland and weirdly oily.
author: Lisa O.

description: This place was nice, the food was super good and plentiful for the price.  a lot of room for groups of people to go and hang out.  clean, open atmosphere, and very helpful staff.  i would return again when if i'm ever back in the area!
author: Jesse R.

description:
LOVE this place. The people who work here are gems, and the food itself is fabulous. I love Indian food, and eat it a couple times a week. I've never tried their buffet, but I love their bhangan bharta (eggplant dish) lamb vindaloo, and of course, the Indian food for white people--chicken tikka masala.

If you're dining in, it's great for groups. The interior space is really nice. I usually get takeout since I live just up the street-- and they give you delicious chai as you wait for your food! 

This is definitely a local business I love to support! Highly recommended.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: We really love the food .We have order paneer tikka masala and dal makhani taste was outstanding.I like the customer service .My uncle was hurt in hand and leg ladies serving food was so caring and helpful with first aid material .Highly recommend these restaurant with Indian food and excellent customer service
author: Unknown U.

description: Delivery was quick & delivery dude was friendly. Enjoyed ordering our dinner online. Menu had many interesting options, but we chickened out & went with our old standby.
author: Candace V.

description:
I write this review as I suffer the horrible pangs of food poisioning 

I wonder if they call it urban curry because they scour the dumpsters of san francisco for their ingredients...

My fiance and I ordered from Urban Curry to have our food delivered. 45 minutes later the food arrived (sunday june 17th)

We ordered palak paneer, veggie samosas, garlic naan, rice, and Butter chicken.

I eat indian food quite alot and have never experienced this. 30 minutes after finishing my meal something just didn't feel right, here it is 4 hours later and im still unable to sit for too long without running for the restroom.


BEWARE, STAY AWAY! FAR AWAY!!!!
author: Bobby P.

description:
Lamb curry magically appeared at my door from here. I was blacked out drunk and extra juiced to eat. I guess my friend had ordered it while I was next door making friends with my neighbor -_-

We hop in bed and our fat souls are eager...mind you we are wasted. The lamb was tender and the curry was really flavorful and spicy. The naan was fresh, rice was fluffy and we ordered this daal soup thing but never got around to eating it. We (mostly me) were eating like savages and I spilled curry all over my sheets lmao. I did not give a fuck, I was still dipping my naan in the curry off my sheets. 

I guess we passed out and woke up to find ourselves sleeping in curry...curry on the carpet, curry scented finger-tips....the worse part was when I projectile vomited the lamb curry :( OMFG do you know how hard it is to pass lamb chunks through your mouth? nose? eyes?....I thought I was going to die. 

Lesson of the day: Don't drink and eat curry. If you are going to get white girl wasted, then please eat your curry responsibly or else you'll end up with curry sheets like me. ..Or projectile vomiting.
author: Lydia L.

description:
One of my absolute favorite restaurants in the city. Definitely the best Indian food that I've tried so far!

The first thing worth noting about Urban Curry is the customer service. They have recently switched over to self-serve. The only downside of this is that you don't have as much interaction with the wait staff (they're delightful!), but you can tell that they genuinely care about their customers and their overall dining experience.

My favorite items on the menu are the chicken tikka masala, lamb curry, tandoori fish, and baingan bharta (eggplant curry). The tikka masala has a cream base, but it is balanced by spicy tomato curry filled with flavor. The hot chai tea is also great. just a little bit of spice and sweetness to an otherwise creamy tea.  

It's always an amazing experience dining it, but it's also my go-to restaurant for rainy day take-out!
author: Kimi S.

description:
On this trip to San Francisco, I only ate at one restaurant twice. This one. 
Reasonably priced. Smells so great. Owner very nice. Food was delicious. And hot. Good location. Can't say enough good about this place. Loved it. I'll be back when I'm back.
author: Greg A.

description: The food is really good. The staff are always friendly. The decor is nice. The reason I give four stars is because the food can be a little inconsistent, I'm not sure if its because different chefs cook the items differently.
author: John D.

description:
Roxanne.  You don't have to put on the red light.  You're on Broadway.  You expect adult entertainment, but at the edge of the street there's an awesome Indian restaurant that takes you from Broadway to Bombay.  

Urban curry has all the characteristics of good Indian restaurant.  They have a variety of naan (garlic, cheese, plain).  I tried them all and they were delicious.  Perfect for dipping into your curry. 

The samosas were hearty and crisp.  I enjoyed the great flavor.  

My chicken tikka was on the dry side.  It was surrounded by delicious curry, but the chicken itself was not as moist as I wanted.  I preferred the lamb over the chicken because it was more flavorful and juicy.  

I washed this all down with thick, tasty mango lassi.  The cost is on par with most Indian restaurants, but the decor, service, and food is better here.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
Had the great idea of wandering into North Beach to get dinner...but settled on getting Indian food. 

A few pluses and minuses for this place: 
- Chai tasted bad - more cream than chai.
+ Great service for a self service kind of place. 
- I ordered chicken vindaloo and it tasted like salt and chili. Unfortunately probably the worst chicken vindaloo I've had anywhere
+ Really great veggie samosas

It was alright but I definitely wouldn't come here again if I got a hankering for Indian food
author: Cary L.

description:
Went here tonight for a last minute dinner...one of those nights where you just feel like Indian food, you know? Urban Curry did not disappoint! We went straight for the whole wheat naan, basmati rice, lamb vindaloo (get it spicy) and the chicken tikka masala. Were we very creative in our choices? No! Was it absolutely delicious - heck yes!

We had a great meal, it was cheap, tasty and the service was great. We'll be back!
author: Isabel M. L.

description:
I've eaten here several times and always eaten too much!
Their buffet is a real spread of food and several interesting entrees, not all rice and salad.  The problem is just too much food.  When you get the buffet lunch they also bring you an entire slab of naan, which is fresh and delicious, but I'd be fine with just grabbing a piece or two from the buffet.  The dishes include veggie entrees as well as the usual tandoori chicken but they also lay out lamb and goat dishes which is unusual for a buffet.  The waitstaff are very polite and helpful, although the whole set-up is essentially self serve.  The buffet is $11.99 which seems reasonable. 
Come here hungry.
author: Jay A.

description:
Yesterday was the first time, I tried this place ans yes I am coming back here again.
We ordered Chana Saag, Goat curry, chicken tandoori and kheer and everything was very delicious. The best part about this place was the food was not extravagantly spiced up as people think of India food to be full of spices. The food here had the right amount of spices as used in Indian homes.  I definitely recommend this place for good India food.
author: Swati G.

description:
With all the good reviews, Urban Curry was a pretty big disappointment. I can attest to one of the other reviews, which described their chicken tikka masala perfectly: tomato sauce with cream. We also ordered their veggie samosas, which were not good either. The rice was extra and dry. The naan was average. Nothing about this place makes me want to return. The service was fine, but their food is nowhere near rave-worthy, let alone 4 stars. 

The setup of the restaurant is odd. You have to get your own silverware and plates. Then the waiter takes your order and then you pay up front at the end. While free chai tea is a "perk" I could really care less for it.
author: Brian L.

description: Urban Curry has some of the the best momos I have ever had! I order at least 2 orders of their momos for delivery every week. The momos and the accompanying sauce are as tasty and zesty as they get!
author: Karina S.

description: we come here often, and the service is great everytime! malai kofta (vegetarians), chicken jalfreezie  (non vegetarians) garlic naan, raita, and vegetable pakora is our go to, but everything else we've tried is also delicious, not to mention the complimentary tea...mmm :)
author: Mary Lou L.

description:
I hate to say I'm pretty predictable with some of my meals. If I step into an Indian spot I'm going to order Chicken Tikka Masala and two orders of Naan. Guaranteed. 

One advantage to this predictability is being able to use this as my benchmark for any Indian place I try. Urban Curry is conveniently located on strip club row and offers the Chicken Tikka for $6 and change. EVen better - they give a 15% discount to yelpers. 

The chicken tikka was very tasty and loved the sauce they used. 

Our server was very nice to us as well. It is a VERY large space and can easily accomodate large groups. I spent less than $10 for a chicken tikka masala, rice and two orders of Naan. 

I'm a fan and will definitely be coming back.
author: Carlos A.

description:
delicious indian meals, very good price-performance ratio
Ein indisches Restaurant mit leckerem Essen und einem sehr gutem Preis-Leistungsverhältnis.
Uns hat es hier sehr gut gefallen. Das Essen war lecker und wirklich indisch. Als Aufmerksamkeit wir haben kostenlos Chai-Latte-Tee bekommen (hmm, köstlich).

Im Vergleich zu den in der Nachbarschaft recihlich vertretenen Restaurants (viele Italiener) haben wir hier richtig viel für unser Geld bekommen.
author: jebri

description:
The food used to be good here for the first few months they were open, but the quality has gone downhill since.  Now the food is just okay, not horrible, but not all that great either.

Here was my previous review when the restaurant was relatively new:
I love the food here.  It's definitely the best Indian food I've had in SF so far. My favorites are the Palak Paneer and the Chicken Tikka Masala.  I always get the Medium Spicy level and it has just the right amount of spice. Also, the chai here is excellent.

The service has always been great here and the price is great for the amount of food you get.  The location of the restaurant is a bit odd as it's next door to a gentleman's club.  But the decor inside is nice and it is spacious inside.
author: Dipesh G.

description:
This place is mediocre at best, I had read the reviews but decided to try it anyhow given the close proximity to my hotel.  I ordered takeout and got samosas, chicken makhani and plain naan.  The time was 10 minutes, really fast, and I had a yelp coupon for 10% off.  When I gave it to the man checking me out he got very upset, but in the end took it anyway.  

The samosas were flavorless.  The dough was crispy which is what you always want in a samosa but it was extremely oily, dripping through the bag, and tasted very bland.  The chicken makhani I made sure to order extra hot as I love spice, but I wouldn't say it came out any higher than medium.  There were bits of chicken that were brownish black and mushy, and I ended up throwing out about a third of my bites.  When I'm eating Indian food, I don't want to have to pick through every bite.  The naan was fine, but I think it's rather hard to mess up naan.

Furthermore it was a Friday night in a very populated area (Chinatown) and there was nobody in the restaurant.  That's always a warning sign.  If I am ever in the area again I will be skipping Urban Curry.
author: Ariana G.

description:
The Chicken Tikka Masala was divine. Marinated and cooked to perfection. The food may not be the most authentic, but it is executed very well. 

The naan was some of the best I have ever tasted. Tried the garlic and potato naan, and both were exceptional. 

For the price, I was very happy with the whole experience and as a local resident, this will be my go-to Indian restaurant.
author: Andrew H.

description: Cheap, delicious Indian/Pakistani food. Don't come here for the decor or service but do expect good food. I love their take-out. The chicken biryani is the best I've ever had.
author: Victor W.

description: Love this place! We order delivery all the time. It's quick, the price is right, and the food is delish! Some favorites include - chicken tikka masala, chana dal, and sag paneer. Began Bertha is pretty good too but sometimes it's more saucy than substance.
author: jamie m.

description: This place smells great, but I only ordered to go. Chicken Tikka was watered down to the point where I could taste the cream more than the actual spices. Chicken was hard and overcooked. There are better indian restaurants in the area than this place.
author: Arthur K.

description:
No star .should have given negative star : poor hospitality . I have placed my order on phone at 7:30pm to be deliver at 9:00pm . The person on phone said it will be delivered by 9:30pm . So I said ok for it . Now when I called at 9:45pm for asking what happen about my order . It is not delivered . So the guy on phone said I am sorry we can't delivere it plz order it from some where else . Are you crazy !!!!!! 

I am waiting for my order and now you are saying me order it for some where else !!!!! 

A request for the owner of urban curry owner plz don't fool your customers . If you can deliver say yes on the point on call . If no then it is also fine . We can manage buy our own terms . But at this last point point of time you tell any one " to order it from some where else " it very Diss heartening. I would now never recommend any one for this Resturant . I have manny Indian and Nepali friend .
author: Vaibhav S.

description: word on the streets!...get the goat!...quick call to check on the goat...goat is available!...pre-drinking before dinner...no alcohol at urban curry...large, airy and grandeur interiors...walking in and asking for the goat before seating...no goat?...why no goat?...sold out!...called in advance for the goat...told, yes goat...but, no goat!?...few apologies from urban curry...but, no goat!...some trickery?...no goat?...came specifically for the goat...taking the fish, the chicken, nan and such...no goat...standard meal...seasoned well...cooked well...priced high...$fifty-six total for dinner for three...near $twenty per person...
author: Hen A.

description:
I've eaten here on two occasions.  The food is great and the staff very friendly.

It can initially be confusing when you walk in because they sit you down with a menu but then you need to get up and order from the counter when you decid on your meal options.

The silverware, flatware, glasses and water are "self-serve" from an area near the middle of the restaurant.  There are pitchers of water available in a large cold case.

They are relatively attentive to special dietary consideration such as gluten or dairy free.  I got the Lamb Karahi the first time with an onion chile salad on the side.  The next time I had the Lamb Roghan Josh with the same side.  

The food comes out hot (temp) and very flavorful.  One word of CAUTION, they will normally ask you how spicy you want your food...tread lightly.  I ordered the Roghan Josh "medium."  Combined with the, onion chile salad and I was LIT UP!!!  Whew! HA HA! 

I normally try to avoid dairy, but I make it a point to finish a meal here with a Mango Lassi for "dessert."

They also have self-serve hot Chai tea which makes a flavorful after-dinner finisher.

The only reason for 4 stars is the location.  Although, the street and restaurant itself is clean and well-trafficked, it's in an area with "Gentleman's" clubs; one located next door and one across the street.  Of course, this area of San Francisco has a varied mix of business establishments so this really just goes with the territory.

Will definitely be back in Urban Curry whenever I'm in the SFO!
author: Charlie G.

description: I went here last week to help celebrate a friend's birthday.  The staff were very friendly and attentive, and the mango lassis were very delicious.  However I thought the Nepalese style chow mein tasted like Maggi's instant noodles, not that that is a bad thing I would have just preferred something a little more extraordinary.  The chicken makhani was good but definitley heavy, so consider yourself forewarned if you have a delicate constitution.
author: Catherine C.

description: I have tried their Samosa, Chicken Moms, and Chow Mein .........and I thought everything was fantastic, NOT just the food was fantastic but the service is great, too. I liked the friendly people there, especially the owner of the restaurant. ..... I highly recommend all of you to try their food...... they are bunch of welcoming and friendly people.
author: Tseji L.

description: Friendly people. Average food. Food comes out fast.  Naan was undercooked and too soft. Chicken tikka marsala was a bit lacking on the spices.  3 for food, 5 for service and comfort.
author: J J.

description: They started spraying bleach and cleaning the kitchen while we were eating and well before closing. Geez. Use some common sense. No one wants to smell noxious chemicals while eating.
author: Won't B.

description:
Nihari if you are a beef fan. Chicken Karahi with green peppers is awesome.  Mon amore loves and recommends chicken biryani.

I tried chicken karahi a couple of times and always found it true to its roots. This a genuine Pakistani restaurant.
author: Shahey R.

description:
Urban Curry is our goto place for tasty Indian curry at a good price. 

While I wish the curries had a bit more complexity to each of them the lamb vindaloo and chicken tikka masala have a great bite while being hearty and creamy respectively. The lamb in particular has a nice kick that pairs well with the briyani rice, enhancing the fragrant rice. 

The reason that Urban Curry tops our list for Indian though is their papadum. I'm a huge sauce guy and the fact that Urban Curry packs a spicy little chutney and a cooling mint sauce really seals the deal for me. 

Insider tip though: if you dine in, be sure to go straight up to the counter to order since they're not a full service restaurant and don't miss the self service chai tea. The chai has a great flavor and even comes unsweetened, so you can choose exactly how much sugar you want in each cup.
author: George W.

description:
I walk past this place everyday.  I always thought the name was stupid and refused to try it solely because of that.  Then I was on Yelp and saw that it made #2 on Best of Yelp, where there were great reviews and it was 15% all week!

I tried the Chicken Tikka Masala.  I thought medium wouldn't be too overwhelmingly spicy.  I was right.  It was good, but it was kinda bland.  Not very spicy.  There wasn't much chicken in it and it was kinda rough.  

I got the garlic naan, too.  It wasn't very fresh, but it was flavorful.   

If someone asked me to go there again, I probably would.  The atmosphere is interesting.  It is a big space.  I like the tables and the chairs.  And the water glasses are pretty fun.  

I thought the service was decent, but the person I ate with was having all kinds of issues with his food.  

I think you get what you pay for.  There is a place down the street that has a lot more flavor, larger portions, fresher ingredients, etc...  But it costs more, too.  I think for $10 for an entree and some naan it's pretty decent.
author: Derek B.

description:
Plain simple crappy food
The worst biryani and lamb curry I have had in a while 
Shame of a recipe for biryani
author: Vaibhav S.

description: A few of the dishes were pretty good, but overall, it was mediocre. All in all, I feel that Urban Curry lacks flavor. Indian food should be very flavorful with a wide range of spices,  but this was not case. I think there are much better choices in the area.
author: S. G.

description:
I quickly became a regular at this place. Impossible to beat buffet (lunch and dinner), hands down best lamb tika masala in the city, and to top it off they deliver. Will definitely continue to frequent this place!
The owner, Shair i believe is his name, informed me that they will soon be carrying Indian beer. About time I say.
author: Carlos A.

description: Great food! Biriyani was kick ass. Loved the Kefta Kebab too. Super nice service.  I didn't feel pressured like I do at a lot of Indian restaurants where they want you to order naan and other carbs just to up the check. In fact, they offered these items plus chai tea for free. Would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Marc A.

description: Wow ! Finally i had delicious food in this restaurant. Momos and shrimp fried rice are awesome taste and flavorful dish. I recommend for everybody to have nepali and indian food in Urban Curry restaurant. Thanks...
author: Raj L.

description:
Pros: Extremely helpful staff, very tasty food
Con: a little overpriced, especially the lunch menu
 
This place is right near my office, but the prices have always scared me away--lunch is supposed to be my cheap meal. I mean, Urban Curry isn't  expensive, but I their dishes are about two dollars above my favorite Indian place in the Mission and five dollars above my beloved taco truck right around the corner from work. So, I usually do tacos for lunch and then save Indian for dinner. Today, however, it was cold and I wanted the slow burn of complex spices to keep me going through the afternoon. 

Now, I can't eat milk products because they give me raging migraines, and I've learned through painful experiences that Indian places, in particular, don't really understand me when I say that I can have meat but not if it was cooked or marinated in yogurt, and I can have foods cooked with oil but not with ghee. At the very least, it usually turns into a huge negotiation session that I just didn't feel like experiencing, today. So, I just picked a veggie dish (the aloo gobi) and asked if it was vegan. Indian restaurants understand "vegan" very well. 

As it turned out, it was vegan, but I came to wish I'd actually explained my food predicament in whole, because the guy was SUPER helpful. He told me every on the menu that was vegan "for next time." He even said that if I called a day ahead, he would make sure that there were a bunch of good vegan options in the lunch buffet for me. I have a feeling he could have handled the complexity of my situation, which I'll now need to explain next time I go back.

Since it was my first time there, the rice was on the house, and he also offered me some rose water while I was waiting, also on the house. With all that, my order ended up being cheaper than anticipated, so I was very pleased.

The rice was very flavorful and delicious on its own an perfectly cooked. The aloo gobi was nicely salted, if maybe a littler spicier than I'd wanted. That's my fault, though. I asked for medium, which is usually my preference, but I should have done mild my first time at a new place. I suggest knocking down your spice level request about a half a notch lower than usual your first time here. 

The best thing about my lunch is that the aloo gobi had a lot of cauliflower, and some nice chunks of it, too. My main complaint about this dish is that most places make it too heavy on the potatoes or liquify the cauliflower by overcooking it. The cauliflower was tender and flavorful, but still had a lot of intact florets. 

The rosewater was the worst part of the meal. I think I'd expected a clear, lightly sugared water that tasted like rose petals had been sitting in it. That wasn't even close to what I received; instead imagine if roses were a red Koolaid. I had to water it down by half to even drink it, and it was still dark red. I'm not knocking down the restaurant's stars for it because it was free. 

Even thought the food was good and the service was excellent, it still wasn't totally worth the price I'll have to pay for it next time. I mean, come on, it's cauliflower, potatoes, and rice--easily three of the cheapest foods on the planet! I know spices aren't cheap, but Udupi manages to charge less and still turn a profit. I knock it a ful star for that. I don't mind expensive meals, but only when the price is justifiable.
author: Aja S.

description:
This is my first yelp post... Sorry if its really long :(

Today was my first time eating Indian food. I ate a late lunch/early dinner here with my best friend and boyfriend. We got here around 3:40ish pm and the place was empty! I'm guessing the lunch buffet rush hour was over and it was "limbo" time (between lunch in dinner). 

We ordered: 
-Plain naan for two
-Rice 
-Chicken Tikka Marsala
-Chicken Curry
-Chicken Boti
total price: $33.56 for three people
(yup... a lot of chicken)

The plain naan was warm and fluffy and complimented the sauces of the Chicken Tikka Marsala and Chicken Curry. My favorite dish was the Chicken Curry. It had the perfect balance of being spicy and not overly spicy. The dish also came with big chunks of boneless chicken. The Chicken Tikka Marsala had a nice creamy sauce, pretty good. The Chicken Boti was a big disappointment for me... granted this was my first time eating Indian food, but the chicken tasted dry. Needless to say, it was the last dish we finished at our table. 

Taste buds aside, I loved how the restaurant gave us complimentary tea (my friend said the Indian restaurant she usually goes to also comes with complimentary tea, so I don't know if all Indian restaurants do that... but it sure was tasty). The tea came in cute cups with stirrers for adding sugar. I liked we were able to add our own of sugar because everyone has different preferences. The waitress was very tentative to our needs (giving us enough time to figure out our orders without rushing us, she always refilled our water, and asked if everything was good). The decor of the restaurant was really nice too, I especially liked the lanterns and likes that hung from the ceiling. 

However, the food took FOREVER to arrive when we were the only ones dining in the restaurant at that time! We had to wait an extra five-ten minutes for the Chicken Boti to arrive, therefore the rest of our dishes became slightly cold as we waited.

When it came time for the bill we gave the yelp deal coupon ($20 dollars worth of food for $10) and paid the difference in cash + tip. The waitress frowned and told us we should have given her the coupon earlier, which I don't fault her for getting slightly annoyed since she does have to "recalculate" the bill (i.e. subtract $20 dollars from it). But, she took forever to do so.. don't understand why? 

I gave this place 3.5 stars because the food was cheap/worth it, filling, good service from the waitress, clean restaurant, and great ambiance. But, the food took too long (-0.5), everything didn't come out at once (-0.5), and the dry chicken from the Chicken Boti (-0.5).
author: Shirley C.

description: I had a Yelp deal last year and went on a weekday when it first opened, so it wasn't busy at that time. Service was slow. Nice location and atmosphere. Excellent tasty dishes. No complaints. Nice and spicy even though it was mild. Nice wait staff.
author: Priscilla L.

description: Delicious korma, biryani, pakora, and curry!  Restaurant was clean and inviting, staff was attentive, and the food was delectable.  Will definitely return.
author: katinka p.

description:
The other half mentioned that we should try this place, recommended by his indian 'connections'. I was not convinced to begin with and i am hypocritical when it comes to authentic asian food. 

We only ordered 2 dishes (as we planned to 'restaurant hop' that night).... lamb beryani and bangan bharta.

The lamb beryani was more of rice than the chunks of lamb. Too much bell peppers in the rice causing hindrance to a smooth flow of consuming the beryani. 5 bites of lamb and i still had a lot of rice on my plate. Tsk tsk...

Bangan bharta was ok. Kinda watery....

Overall verdict: Nah, we're sticking to our all time favorite indian restaurant in the Tenderloin.
author: Elly G.

description:
Chicken Tikka Masala - Looked and tasted like cream and i mean full cream with ketchup

Chicken Biryani - was filled with rice and bones. 

The only thing that i like was the ambiance - otherwise a big fat zero for the taste
author: Hassan A.

description:
I'm absolutely amazed at the average Yelp rating for this place...  I find it to be completely off-base.  

We ordered for delivery at lunch time on a Sunday.  Delivery took about an hour, but was to be expected considering it was gay pride Sunday.  I appreciated the fact that the driver called to let us know that he would be late and why.  Sadly this phone call is the only reason I'm giving this place more than 1 star (which I still think to be quite generous).

Chicken Tikka Masala - Upon opening the container, the BF's first words were "looks like nacho cheese".... and it smelled vaguely Italian (like vodka sauce minus the basil).  He actually had to add water to it to cut the creaminess.  The dish was ordered medium-spicy and there was not a hint of spice whatsoever.

Paneer Tikka Masala - Same overly-creamy sauce... except with chunks of cheese in it... incredibly over-rich and with no complexity of flavor --- just tomato and milk.

Samosas - The samosa itself was passable, but the chutneys were pretty gross...  I found myself eating them anyway to get away from the creambomb Tikka Masala.  

Garlic Naan - Pretty delicious, actually... one of the best I've had in SF, but sadly the only bright spot in this meal.

Rice - Overcooked/old... puffy/crumbly texture.  Considering it was 1pm, I'm not sure how this is even possible... was it left in the cooker from last night's midnight buffet?

I felt sick to my stomach the rest of the day and actually contemplated making myself throw it back up to get some relief.

Do yourself a favor and order from Little Delhi.
author: Kevin F.

description: Quick service (pickup order), good food. Got the chicken tikka & nepalese dumpling
author: Paul R.

description:
I came in for a late lunch. The waitress at the front was bored out of her mind. So bored I somewhat startled her out of her day dream. There was only one other party here. There were about three Mexican looking cooks in the front kitchen and some more people in the back. I think they were preparing for dinner.

The interior kitsch and themey. They try to make it feel like you're in a foreign land especially with the mural. It comes off Disney land-ish, just bordering on tacky. The background music feels like the music pulled straight from an Olympic Games broadcast.

My waitress took awhile to get my order. I couldn't see why since I was the only customer here. I did however get plenty of refills and free chai which she called "Indian Tea" (wtf, just call it chai). After I was served a couple came in. I'm not sure if they're friends with the waitress but they talked in a foreign language for 15-20 minutes in a manner similar to when a friend finds out another friend has cancer.

I had the lamb gobi gosht with naan. It was alright. The food does come out piping hot and the portions are decent. The naan is disappointing. It's more like naan pizza bread in the shape of a thick saltine cracker. What it really reminds me of is Pillsbury croissant dough flattened down into flat triangles. I'm not really sure if this is is not authentic or just a different version of naan. Either way I've had better naan. Nothing terrible but it's disappointing. I can't really complain about the gobi gosht. It's just not something I would order again.

____

It's SF, throw a brick.
author: Michael H.

description: One of the best chicken moma's ever. Staff is nice and service is great. Would go again
author: Mali S.

description: Simply amazing food! Best curry we've had in the city! And the service is great! Very friendly and loving!
author: Mike P.

description:
For Lunch Buffet review:

How can you go wrong with all you can eat lunch buffet? And to top it off, GARLIC NAAN!!! This place is literally 30 steps away from the office and I am truly blessed to have it so close to for lunch time buffet.

The only bad thing is after the meal, I can't seem to finish out the afternoon without dosing off at my desk!! 

All in all, a great place to gorge oneself to death in a heaping pile of garlic naan and curry galore!
author: Jason C.

description: Fairly decent place. I order take out from here often and of the Indian places urban curry is generally the most consistent. However, there are little mistakes that have been adding up when ordering that have become increasingly frustrating and the staff had been less than accommodating when I bring then up. For example, I like papadam with my order wig his like Indian style chips and salsa. But they have been forgetting the salsa ( the spicy green sauce and the sweet chutney sauce). It's a little thing but when it happens several times in a row it gets a little frustrating. Good news is they usually re deliver them. Hopefully with future orders they'll remember to include it as the standard fare.
author: Cody W.

description:
We were tired and hungry tredding the beautiful streets of SFO and wanted some good Indian food. This plaace was nearest to where we were and thus started walking towards it.
Place has humble interiors but the food is just amazing. Everything we ordered was better than our expectations given the ratings of this place.
author: S V.

description:
Picked 4 things for a delivery order:

Achari chicken
Palak paneer
Chicken karahi
Plain naan

All were good - maybe not as good as Pakwan or some other places in the city, but definitely hit the spot on a lazy evening calling for food delivery.

Food was delivered within the time specified.  Having the option to order online is awesome.
author: Vandana N.

description:
So I tried this place this afternoon.  I ordered  Vegetarian Samosas, Nan stuffed with Chicken, and Lentil Curry with Lamb.  I also had a Mango Lassi.

  I started with the Samosa's.  Unfortunately, they were bland.  They should be flavorful with those great spices.

 Next, the Lentil Curry with Lamb.  They confused my order and brought me Lentil curry without the Lamb.  I did taste it anyway (was also bland) before  I  realized there was no lamb!...lol.  When I told the waitress, she immediately took it back and brought it back with lamb and it was much better - flavorful.  The waitress gave me free rice for the trouble.
