She could  have been more generous for the trouble - maybe give me a few of the other items for free, like the Lassi and the Nan. But I chose not to make any noise about it.  We all make mistakes.

With the Nan, I usually order Garlic Nan but decided to take a walk on the wild side and ordered Nan stuffed with chicken.  I could barely taste or see the chicken and the Nan was bland also.

Lastly, the Mango Lassi.  It was ok.  Again, it was a bit bland also.

The Waiter and the Waitress that served me were apologetic and were prompt with serving me and dealing with the issue, however they really need  to work on making everything more flavorful.  Indian food is meant to be rich and flavorful  with all those spices, as we all know.

I also had a stomachache after eating here.

It could have been an off day for them, but they need to make their food consistently tasty each and everyday!
author: Norbert D.

description:
Shame on me for taking so long to update a review.

I have been there several times now and love it everytime.

Devour:  My fav the Lamb Tikka Masala, my new fav Cream Pepper Chicken, Tandoori Chicken and Lacha Paratha.

Next Time: As Soon As Possible!!!!
author: Ron S.

description: Pretty decent delivery. We ordered pakoras, tandoori chicken, palak paneer and some rice and naan. Everything was delicious. My only compaint is that they served the hot tandooir chicken in the thin plastic containers..would be nice if they used a safer and more eco friendly option.
author: Mimi T.

description: Very nice service. Good people on staff. Their goat biriyani is great. Nans and rest of their curries are ok.
author: Anwar H.

description:
Gotta start by saying that we LOVE Indian food and were looking for a go-to place when we moved to SF.. and even though it's not at all in our neighborhood, I think Urban Curry has become that.

The first thing that sets it apart from the numerous places with similar menus and price point is the late hours. For late dinner time people like us, you can't beat Urban Curry's consistent friendly service right up until 2 am-- none of this, it's close to 11, we're going to close, maybe you can order kind of stuff. They even have a buffet until 2 am, although we always order from the menu.

The second thing that makes Urban Curry stand out is the open layout, with (most?) of the cooking happening in full view so you know nothing weird is happening to your food. It doesn't feel crowded, dirty, or like they're hiding anything, which is just the way a restaurant should be. I will say the vibe is a little different, it's kind of dark in a romantic way and the chairs are huge, which makes me feel like they were made for a royal banquet table (not necessarily in a good way).

Service and food both high-quality and very consistent (that's the key!). Good naan, good food, one of the only places we order appetizers, it's all so good we can't stop ourselves.

And, the bonus of being stuck in the middle of the North Beach strip clubs is that they never judge you here-- I've gone in dressed up or not and the service has been perfect both times.

We always find free street parking, maybe we're just lucky.
author: Ashley L.

description:
The food is very, very good,

BUT, they have now left things off of the order twice in a row.  This time it was the Naan bread, frankly an essential part of the dinner.

I called the restaurant and asked for the manager.  Manager not present.  The person on the phone was minimally competent and I recommended he allow me to speak to another responsible adult.  I told him very clearly that he was not communicating well.  (Three times.)  

He was kind, but I have no confidence he even understood the problem fully.

So, eventually, I assume the manager will find out that I am sending a weak review on both GrubHub and Yelp.  I am trying to be fair, but two omissions in two orders is a problem for me.

Unfortunately, this one star review now counts against them.  And I do like the food.  But how can I order form them if they leave things off the list?  And then, when I call them, there is no adult supervision?
author: GP R.

description: I was craving lamb vindaloo, and this happened to be on my way home.  The dish was spicy, like I requested, but it was so watered down.  There was no flavor, and all texture (burning mouth!) I could also count with one hand how many lamb cubes it contains- 5!  Plus 2 big potatoes...  I won't be going back anytime soon!
author: Joyce P.

description: Best indian food i have ever had! We tried the lamb vindaloo and the chicken tikka misala with basmati rice and garlic naan. Washed it down with taj beer. Could not have asked for anything better. Service and atmosphere were also top notch.
author: Jenna S.

description: Loved the food we got after ordering through Eat24 on the iPad. Everything was tasty and well-prepared. The chicken momo was our favorite item, but I have a feeling everything on the menu is great. Adding this restaurant to the places we regularly
author: Pani P.

description:
My girlfriend and I usually stick to a few Indian restaurants we feel comfortable with and rarely step out of our comfort zone regarding trying new places. We came here because she got a Bloomspot deal.

SERVICE: most excellent.
We were greeted with a gracious hello and shown to our table.
Aside from the great service and patience of our waiter, the other wait staff were very attentive to our needs. We are not needy people, you know what I mean. It was the kind of service you would expect at a fancy scmancy bow tie restaurant.

FOOD: most excellent.
We started with the chick pea fish (the batter was light and crispy.) Then, we proceeded to the lamb, chicken and orka, accompanied by some tasty garlic naan and basmati rice. No complaints from me.

OVERALL:
We would patron Urban Curry again to try other dishes. The restaurant was spacious, attentive wait staff and great ventilation.

thanks for reading my review, WHURD!
author: Tony N.

description: One of the best Indian restaurants in the Bay! Everything has quality ingredients and it is a large place with lots of seating! The Tikka Masala is delicious! Garlic Naan is also very yummy! I bring all my friends here :) it's a great find!
author: Haley T.

description:
I went here with the lovely Christine S.  She wanted Indian food, I wanted to spend time with her.  I do not remember what I ordered.  I do remember it was kind of flavorless.  Also, I did not finish the Naan.  I always finish the Naan.  

2 Stars, and Naan more.
author: Leon K.

description: The naan was good! It wasn't too crispy- more chewy. Not enough crispy blisters. The saag paneer was a bit bland, but the chicken tika-masala and the curry goat were spiced to perfection. The lamb byriani was good, but not memorable. Overall, good Indian food, but some dishes better than others.
author: Lindsay L.

description: This is my first bad review on yelp. This restaurant serves pathetic food and staff is low on courtesy. We got the buffet and karahi paneer on the side, except lassi everything in the restaurant was pathetic. Had a hard time swallowing the food, when we told the chef about the food he started screaming at us. Good luck if you are going here.
author: Rasik M.

description:
There was some furry in these curries! 

Urban Curry boasts exceptional great food at incredibly low prices. I come here quite frequently; even though there's tons of great Indian places close by my house (lahora;  naan and curry). 

The staff is friendly courteous; but can be a tad forgetful if they are very busy (i.e. we asked the 'water girl' for a to-go box but she forgot it; the table next to us sat with their meal for 5-10 minutes waiting for their rice etc.) 

The food is hearty portions cooked quickly; thoroughly and with dedication; they know what they are doing. 

The atmosphere is very open; so good for couples or big groups; not a romantic scene. 

ANOTHER HIGHLIGHT OF THIS PLACE IS YOU CAN BYOB!!!

 Which, unfortunately, I did not know at the time of dine (darn!) but will keep this in mind next time I go back.
author: Maple S.

description:
Couldn't have been more pleased with the service. Friendly. Passionate about the food and purpose. Chai tea while you wait. Best part was after being suggested the prawn karahi (house special with prawns, tomatoes and herbs). I asked if it was healthy, the guy taking my order said it was, and he'd tell the cook to go light on the oil. Right on.

Wish I could be as effusive about the dish. Very good, just not a lot for $14. Think there were six or seven prawns, and the tails were still on. I really don't like that. Made for a mess getting them off.

So a soft three stars. You'll love the service. Maybe you'll love the food.
author: Jason B.

description:
I so wanted to like this place!  There is a serious lack of good Indian food in this city, especially places that offer good, dependable delivery, so when this place opened nearby and seemed to be run by hip, savvy people, it seemed like a good bet. The reviews on Yelp were mixed but the overall rating was high, so we gave it a chance.

The experience started out well with a nicely designed website which made ordering easy. At payment time, it allowed you to include the tip with the total -- a nice time-saver, I thought.  The reason for this, I learned later, was that the company hosting the website collects the money there and then, so they can't adjust via credit card when they deliver the food (so if you want to use that 10% coupon someone handed you on the street, call in your order). Delivery was estimated at 45-60 minutes and it arrived in about 50.  

The meal started off well with some very nice Dal. It needed salt, but that was easily remedied.

But when we got to the main dishes, we found that they were almost completely lacking in salt, spice and spiciness.  The heat for every dish, which had been ordered either Medium or Hot, was closer to Mild. The main dishes were also swimming in grease. In addition to those flaws, the Aloo Gobhi was overly dependent on tomato for its flavor, the Bainghan Bartha was oddly creamy and soupy, and the Naan had the flavor and consistency of Wonder Bread. The Roghan Josh and Prawn Jalfrazi were both OK and saved the meal from being completely inedible.   Overall, it tasted like what Indian food might be like if made by a school cafeteria.

If you want Indian food for delivery, try Tandoori Mahal. It isn't perfect and can be inconsistent, but even on a bad night, it's FAR better than this. And on occasion, its Baigan Bartha can be outstanding.  Just allow plenty of time for delivery.

EDIT 3/23/2012:  DO NOT ORDER FROM TANDOORI MAHAL. The food will be late and it will be COLD.  The owners are completely disinterested in serving the customer.
author: Martha M.

description:
Being new to San Francisco I stumbled upon this place while out wandering around.  It was very quiet inside.  But the aroma coming from the kitchen encouraged me to stay.  

I had the chicken tikka kabob and naan.  it was divine!  Will definitely be back.
author: Jamie K.

description:
My new favorite low-end Indian place! We had the tandoori fish, mixed vegetable pakora, and vegetable curry, and potato naan. Chai is complimentary. 

It was clean, though it looks like it might be a little "clubby" later at night--the music was pounding with too much bass, so much that we couldn't hear our server--maybe start with low bass when nobody's in the restaurant, then pump it up when it's getting crowded? My boyfriend laughed because the red lights in the bathroom made it seem like a good place to process film--I don't think the owners realized the lights made it look like a darkroom! ;) 

Aside from the fact that each dish we ordered was about $1 more expensive, we wondered why anyone would go to Naan-n-curry.
author: N B.

description:
Tasty food, lots of oil, pretty heavy, very high possibility of indigestion.

Big restaurant, friendly service.

These are the things that come to mind when I think of Urban Curry. Unfortunately since I felt like I was still digesting all the cream and oil a day later, I won't be going back.
author: Jen N.

description:
Came here for a quick snack with a friend and saw the daily special of butter chicken curry so we decided to try that along with garlic and onion naan.

garlic naan
A little light on the garlic but the naan came out fresh as if they baked it to order. 

onion naan
a little light on the onion but the naan came out fresh as if they baked it to order. 

butter chicken curry
the sauce was very flavorful and although I got medium it was not spicy at all. The chicken consisted of thigh pieces so they were very juicy and not dry like a lot of curry places. 

Overall I was quite surprised by the quality of the curry and naan and would be willing to pay the a little bit extra for the extra quality compared to buffet places. They have some self serve water, plates, and tea also.
author: Robert Y.

description:
This place is just not that good. Cold food (lamb/chicken) etc. In the middle of all the strip clubs (not where you'd wanna go "eat").

The only thing going for them is their friendly and accommodating servers.
author: Sumit C.

description:
My fiancé and I went to a happy hour nearby and decided to try Urban Curry for dinner rather than deal with traffic & parking to go to Little Delhi. Despite the mixed reviews we figured we'd give it at least one chance. My fiancé is Indian so he's usually the determining factor on whether or not we return to an Indian restaurant. I had the Chicken Karahi, which was okay but I'm not a fan of dark meat chicken so I wouldn't get it again. That being said, it was good. Very tomato-y and spicier than I expected.

My fiancé had the Chicken Boti and gave it an 8 out of 10. We also had the Palak Paneer, which he gave a 7 and I gave an 8. I like mine less on the creamy side (more healthy)...he likes the spinach to be 'saucy' so he was a bit disappointed. 

We both agreed the naan was a bust. It was undercooked and tasted more like pizza dough, which made me wonder if they actually have a Tandoor oven at all.

The complimentary chai was good but the papadum was much like the naan and needed to be baked longer. The place itself is clean and nicer than I expected. 

If I were in North Beach and wanted Indian food I might come back but I prefer Little Delhi hands down.
author: Kara M.

description: I went here for the buffet lunch. Although the cheap price was a plus and the service was friendly, the quality of the food was poor, and the place was dirty. Although there were several vegetarian options, none of them were particularly good. The rasmali drew me into this place, but it was cold and unpleasant. I will not be returning to this restaurant
author: J S.

description: I'm shocked at the good reviews this place has received since I had a very different experience.  It was the worst Indian food I've ever eaten and I eat Indian food regularly.  The vegetable korma we ordered was suspect when it arrived on our table as the color of it was a  light bright yellow (not a deep golden color).  The taste was disgusting - just heavy cream and minimal Indian spice flavor.  We returned the dish because it was inedible and got vegetable curry instead which had a watery sauce and too spicy.  Chicken tikka massala was ok'ish but had the same heavy cream although not quite as bad as the navratan korma.  It was just awful.  The staff was friendly and the food steaming hot but food was really bad.
author: F S.

description:
Rarely do I write a yelp review but def a chow hound. This authentic little gem is worth yelping about.

The lamb karahi here is incredible. Try it!  Ate here for dinner.. Service is never awesome at smaller places but the food was amazing and spicy. Can't wait to go back.

Ps byob and no fees!
author: Lauren S.

description: This is my go-to for tasty Indian food take-out. Very friendly and for rice lovers - it's complimentary.
author: Cara K.

description: We came in to watch a game and the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating - will definitely be back in the future just for a good meal! Loved the spicy chicken curry!
author: Katie S.

description:
A neighborhood gem!

Consistently great and well priced Indian food! 

From the salads to the curries, from the papdums to the samosas, everything is always delectable!
author: Ali W.

description:
I would give them 2 stars because the manager was pretty nice and gave us some chai tea. However, I want to counteract the 4 stars average here because I think the food is atrocious.  I have been to LOTS of Indian restaurants.  I know what Indian food is supposed to taste like.  I've made it myself at home.

The vegetable pakoras are the worst I've had.  They were cold.  They were mostly little crumbs with only a couple of actual sizeable chunks of vegetable.  C'mon guys!  The navratan korma was bland except for the extreme saltiness.  The naan was okay but didn't taste like typical naan.  Chicken tikka masala had dry chicken and another canned tasting salty sauce.

If you are drunk, can't taste the food anyway, and just came out of the strip joint, maybe you will like this food.  If you actually care what the food tastes like and know what Indian food is all about, avoid this restaurant.
author: Desmo K.

description: Really like this place. Their vegetable korma is delicious and so is their chicken tika masala. I've only been to their lunch buffet though so I can't comment on the price of ordering individual dishes. The buffet however is a great deal at $12 and comes with naan- the garlic is a must!
author: Grace P.

description: Ordered 2 curries ( malai kofta and paneer tikka masala) and both came with the same exact gravy that tasted like ketchup. Never again.
author: Shreya A.

description: I just ordered lunch at this place. Everything was bad (mango lassi - very sour, Bhindi - very hard to chew). I literally left everything out
author: Srilakshmi P.

description:
It's Sunday night and I was in the mood for some good Indian food.  Found this place on yelp and in the end was not too impressed. I hate to say this but it gets a ......Meh........at best.  The CTM did taste like the reviews had mentioned....tomato soup and the garlic naan was the worst I've ever had.  It seem store bought and just doctored up with garlic butter and throw on a grill top to warm it up.  

The highlights of this meal: the lamb karahi and the fact it was delivered. 

I won't go back :(
author: Miss A.

description:
I've been wanting to try Urban Curry for several months, but just haven't been able to justify the trek to this curious location until a friend and I spent the afternoon wandering around the North Beach/Telegraph Hill area and literally stumbled upon this establishment at the precise moment I was craving Indian food. Actually, my accomplice would likely argue that I was craving everything I walked by... scones from Italian bakeries, pizza that smelled so lovely I forgot I was in San Francisco, a confectionery store giving out free fudge samples... suffice to say, I was starving, and this fact alone resulted in me ordering what I like to call Indian for White People: Chicken Tikka Masala (CTM). Well, my hunger was only 50% to blame. After the Brain Masala fiasco last time I felt I deserved something normal. But I digress. 

The meal started out strong. Too strong now that I think about it. Complimentary chai (which I didn't hate!) and a wonderful cucumber salad. But I'm not going to let Urban Curry ride on the coattails of some tea and diced cucumbers. 

The CTM, and it pains me to say this, was heartbreakingly bad. Way too overboard in the yogurt department. As in, I imagined myself sitting down with a tiny plastic cup of CTM flavored Yoplait. Really the biggest problem here is that I happen to vehemently loathe yogurt and generally need to be tricked into eating it (as is the case with normal CTM). But it is what it is. 

As someone who has been to just about every Indian place in the East Bay, I was pretty disappointed with my first time in the city. I even felt a little sick shortly afterward.
author: Chrissy S.

description:
This place rocks.

We always order vegetable pakora, garlic naan, and tandori fish or chicken.  Always delish.
This place is clean, the staff is friendly, and they keep the complimentary chai flowing.

Not too pricey, casual and never disappoints.

I've checked in here with my Yelp app a few times and have received a %15 off my bill for doing so.

This place makes Naan-N-Curry look like a dump.  (which it is...)
author: Tone M.

description: We went there for dinner yesterday , and it was excellent. The food was very good, better than any indian restaurant I have tried before in Sf...The service was excellent, our server (the one from Nepal, can't remember his name) was very friendly, he did a good recommendation for food to try, came many times to check if every thing was ok. Bref we will sure come back, and will recommend this restaurant
author: Hicham A.

description: It's a lot better than you assume it's going to be walking by.  The cream pepper chicken is one of my favorite dishes available in San Francisco, and the okra is outstanding.
author: Ty M.

description:
Food very good. BYOB. Service also good.

At first I was afraid of goat, I was petrified...yada yada yada.

For those who cannot eat lamb because of the weird smell, try any of the goat dishes here. Absolutely no gamey smell - and I am super sensitive.
author: T. B.

description: I was looking for an Indian restaurant during my San Francisco tour and after seeing this place with 4 stars on yelp , I have decided to go there. Unfortunately this place does not deserve 4 stars. I have ordered for chicken Momo, Lamb Biriyani (worst biriyani experience of my life) , chicken tikka masala (coconut flavored !!), Garlic naan. Me and my husband could not finish the horrible biriyani. This place does not serve authentic Indian food. As an Indian i would not recommend you this place at all.
author: Kasturi D.

description:
I work nearby. I've eaten Urban Curry at the restaurant or in take-out form over 10 times now, and I can confidently say they are one of the best in the city. I recommend the bainghan bartha (creamy eggplant dish). I could eat this every day!

Tip - they don't serve alcohol, but you are welcome to go across the street and get a six pack with no "corkage" fee.
author: Eric R.

description: Very friendly service. Food was delicious and promptly served. I got "medium" spiciness, and finished my prawns with sweat raining from my face. LoL. Lassi was delicious. Usually, I'm not a big fan of restaurant chai, but their's was pretty good. With better ambiance, I'd give them 5 stars.
author: Steven K.

description:
I went here for the late night buffet on a Saturday night. At $10 a plate this was a fantastic deal and the food was delicious. Our server was very sweet considering she had to put up with the roudy late-night crowd in North Beach.

The buffet was VERY good, not even for a buffet, but just in general. There were 5-7 different Indian recipes to choose from, and the buffet selection even included mango lassi and a selection of traditional Indian desserts. To sweeten the deal even further, Urban Curry is currently on Scoutmob, which cut our dinner bill in half to $5 a plate!
author: Andrew M.

description:
Least favorite Indian food I've had in San Francisco.  

Tandoori fish dish- soggy, lukewarm, flavor only on the outside of the fish, onions come raw.
Naan- thin, soggy, flavorless (naan!  how is naan not tasty?)
Chana Masala- really bad flavor... I've never had chana masala that tastes so chalky and poorly spiced
Chicken Tikki Masala- when the food arrived, 2 folks in our group jumped up and down for this dish...  but after tasting it, most of it was left
Samosas- again, left for the trashcan... soggy, flavored wrong

I'm surprised this has 4 stars. It's flavorless, spiced incorrectly, and even well-loved favorites like naan and samosas are not worth finishing.
author: Anjali J.

description:
2.5-3.0 stars..This review is for the Indian buffet. Went here over the weekend because my guy and I were craving some Indian food. And although the food was not awful it was for sure not the best Indian buffet I have been to.. by a long shot. 

They do have some cool perks tho. Discount of 15% to yelpers. Also it  was nice that you got a choice of mango lassi, a can of soda or chai or if you want, all three. The chicken tikka masala was decent, the lamb that they use is quality-super strong. Bengain Bharta is unlike any Ive ever eaten...but not necessarily in a good way..   You also get a choice of plain, garlic or onion naan (very nice) ..overall fairly okay food and not overly greasy.

The service was good, very nice and attentive- but I have to take stars away for cleanliness - the bathrooms are downright gross...if a place lets their bathroom look like that it makes me wonder what their standards of cleanliness are in the kitchen..

There were a few Indian families happily eating and talking away in Punjabi...so I guess that's got to be a good sign. :)
author: Sarah J.

description: I joined Yelp just so I could review this horrible place.  If I could give it zero minus stars, I would.  First issue, our waitress acted like one pissed off, put out woman.  But not to the patrons seated about 2 feet away from us, she apparently loved them.  She came back to their table multiple times, and would deliberately walk away without even turning around to address us.  Issue #2, we ordered chicken tikka kebab, chole palak and the naan stuffed with potato.  So they bring out the kebab, which is burned and flavorless.  Then they disappear.  Literally disappear. After about 10 minutes, our first dish is cold, and the remainder of our dinner has yet to show up.  Umm, there's clearly a problem here, no one seems to care or notice we're waiting for the rest of our dinner.  We ask where's the rest and btw, our kebab is now cold? They say it's coming, no reason given why the delay.  Well no thanks, we don't want cold kebab and we kind of wanted to eat everything all at once.  They take back the kebab, we wait again, they eventually bring out the palak and naan, the palak has zero spice (we ordered it hot), and both are bland.  This time, no kebab comes, they tell us they're making another batch.  Eventually that shows up more burned and dry than the first batch (pretty sure it was the first batch re-heated).  And all the while, Miss Pissed Off is still apparently pissed at us because she's been MIA the whole time.  But not to the chosen patrons to the left, she's visited them multiple times.  So we stayed and ate because we were pretty much obligated to at that point.  They offered an insincere "sorry" and gave us 10% off.  Wow!  Thanks for that!  Run. Far. Away.  Or stay, if you like being subjected to bad food and treated like dirt.
author: Marilyn L.

description:
Went here for the first time this evening. Enjoyed the ambience and the wait staff were very friendly. Good tea.

My friend and I ordered the lamb biryani, lamb roghan josh, keema naan and chicken boti tandoori plate. Everything was pretty good. I usually don't order boti because I feel like it tends to be overcooked and not usually very tender, and unfortunately I found that to be the case here. The biryani was the overall highlight; I'm looking forward to trying more of their dishes.

Overall a good experience.
author: Dara K.

description: Super delish and reasonably priced. Pakora were the best we've ever had, and the bhindi was especially good. As vegans, this was an awesome spot.
author: Wolf T.

description:
5 stars for the service and another 5 for the food!!! We came in just after they closed. Instead of turning us away however, they welcomed us in. They let us devour the buffet and never rushed us for a second. The food was amazing as always. Also, the entire staff was incredibly kind! Then, because they were out of naan, they charged a lesser price. 

I am truly in awe of their kindness and generosity. You owe it to yourself to witness how great this entire staff is.
author: Helen F.

description:
I'd go elsewhere for Indian food, seriously.

The food lacks any sort of of flavor. Honestly, I've never had 'bad' Chicken Tikka Masala... until this time. Imagine pieces of eraser in cream, without spices.

The Palak Paneer was decent as was the Lamb Saagwaala - I guess spinach is their forte.

The complimentary tea was milky, but alright the first time around, but then I asked for a second pour and received a cup of liquid that had one of the most VILE SMELLS that exists on the planet. 2 days later I still have goosebumps remembering that smell. 

The dessert (carrot pudding) was a bowl of...shredded, uncooked carrots. 

Oh. and our server reeked of pot. 

Maybe we just walked in on a bad day.

Honestly, if you want flavorful food, just forget about Urban Curry. Save your time and money and go elsewhere.
author: Kunjal R.

description:
A year ago I would have said....Delish chicken tika masala and great service. Fast and Friendly.  This is my first Yelp experience and their staff was helpful in helping me get the check in discount

Now I have to say....Delish chicken tika masala and poor service. There was no table service and we were required to walk over to an area and place our order while a young lady just hung out with a few male employees chit chatting.  The set up now is just weird and I doubt I return.
author: T S.

description: On a layover and recommended by the front desk staff. It was fantastic. We ordered appetizers, main courses and garlic naan. The sauces were so good he brought me extra without me having to ask. Staff and service outstanding. I tagged it as a favorite and will definitely be coming back!!
author: D. N.

description: Ordered chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and a chicken curry dish. Food was okay, nothing special but they're getting 1 star for bad service. Our waitress was taking away our plates and ended up dropping a plate and the food splashed onto my clothes, neck and face. Okay, accidents happen...this has never happened to me before but if you get food all over me I expect you to make it right somehow..Of course they didn't. Not coming back!
author: Elle C.

description: As others have observed, the tikka masala sauce is outstanding (I got the paneer tikka masala).  We also split another dish with fried oakra, which was a tasty compliment.  One thing that surprised me was that the rice was not free with the meal.  Perhaps this is normal on the west coast, but every Indian place I've ever been to in the Midwest provides complimentary rice.  However, every Indian place I've been to in the Midwest also seems to want to dial back the spiciness, and this fortunately wasn't the case here. The medium-hot had us asking for extra water, and was definitely extra-hot by our usual standards, which I actually appreciate. If I ever get back to SF, I will go out of my way to have that tikka masala again.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Tonight was Urban Curry lucky night.  There wasn't Monday Night Football for me and my boys to go watch, so we're stuck looking for something else better to do.  And we decided that we'll have dinner and talk like, well, men who don't talk about football, so we talk about girls.  Urban Curry happens to be right next to a lot of places where you can see, um, girls around.

- Place can host a big party, spacious
- next to Paradise? (you know what I'm talking about)
- price reasonable so you have extra cash to go blow it off next door.

We ordered everything below and they were yummy as yummy can be:

Chicken Tikka Masala
Lamb Kahari, spicy
Shahi Paneer
Naan bread
Roti
Rice
author: Rahim R.

description: I love this restaurant for their sauces and combination of spices whether it's off the menu or their buffet. These entrees do not disappoint. Everything else is just ok. I still don't understand why they have chow mein as a buffet dish...lol!
author: Catalina C.

description: I have been ordering delivery from this place quite often during the last six months and I am very satisfied so far. In particular, I really love their chicken tikka masala, and everyone that I have suggested this to loves it as well! They are quite consistent and polite with their delivery, and they even brought me a rice pudding on the house the other day.
author: Vasilis G.

description:
** Delivery **

Could only give one star, because we didn't eat the food.

We ordered:
Chicken Curry
Aloo Gobhi
Basmati Rice

We got:
Aloo Gobhi
Some sort of chicken dish
Vegetable samosas

Oh well ... we were hungry.  

Served the Mystery Chicken dish, cut a piece to discover RAW dark meat chicken.  (sinking spell ensues)

Now, I'm not a foodie, nor do I pretend to be, but I'm pretty sure I've never seen Chicken Tartar on a menu, nor have I been asked "How would you like your chicken cooked? (to which I'd reply "Yes, please) 

Perhaps I have unresolved chicken issues from my childhood and should seek therapy.  I don't know.  But the sight of (and thought of) raw chicken puts me over the edge.

Sorry Urban Curry, but I couldn't trust, or risk, eating the other food.
author: brandie y.

description:
Urban Curry was the first stop on my first night ever in San Francisco. Nate and I were in the mood for Indian, and couldn't make it out to Berkely before Nate's favorite Indian place closed, so we settled on Yelping Indian food within walking distance. Urban Curry was our destination of choice.

Urban Curry is in a curious location - it's so nice, but it's surrounded by strip bars and burlesque. Weird, but whatever. It wasn't busy at all, and we were seated immediately. Our waitress convinced us to go with the buffet - all you can eat, plus naan of your choice, and mango lasse (which Nate was really excited about) all for $9.99.

Everything was fresh and really good. My go-to Chicken Tikka-Masala was so creamy and hot; the naan was some of the best I've ever had (we both got the garlic).

The service was great. It was a great start to a San Francisco foodie weekend!
author: Sarah C.

description:
Saag paneer 2star
Chiken tikka masala 3star
Kheer 3star
Chai 2star
Naan 4star

Friendly waiter
Small portions
Complimentary chai
For this level of food , Not cheap

Overall: not recommended at all
author: Neda M.

description:
I can't believe all the bad reviews this place has.

I've only eaten here twice, but each time deserved all five stars.

The first time I came here, the food was so spicy I couldn't eat without the help from the yogurt I had to order in order to keep eating.

Two friends and I went last night and ate a ton of really great food.

Complimentary Chai tea
Plain and Garlic Naan
Vegetable Samosa
Shrimp Pakora
Vegetable Curry
Vegetable Biryani

And my friends ordered two Chicken dishes which I didn't eat (vegetarian).

The food has so much flavor, and I could even watch them make the naan in the kitchen from where I sat,which was interesting. I also talked to them and made sure the food wasn't as spicy as it had been last time.


What I think is great about this place is not only the food delicious but it's really well priced. A basket of plain naan is only $2, and a basket of garlic naan $3.

The service is incredibly friendly, too. Our server was very helpful, and even gave us the vegetable samosas on the house by the end of the night.

The people I took really liked it and asked me if we could go again some time soon. Unfortunately we all live on the other side of the city, but otherwise I'd go more often.
author: Nicole L.

description:
I love their web site for ordering takeout!

The chicken tikka masala is good, and the paneer naan is good too.  I thought the dishes were a bit too spicy at "mild", but they were good.

Great rice pudding.
author: Niniane W.

description: We arrived kinda late at night, around 10+, it was empty and I started to doubt the restaurant. We ordered vegetarian briyani rice (we always do this) and coconut curry. Service was good, the older man working at the restaurant was kinda quiet but very attentive. My partner found some kind of mysterious specimen in his glass after he finished drinking the water, disgusting.. but was taken care of quickly. I'm sure it wasn't in purpose, the restaurant was clean as I could tell. Food was great, I loved the rice a lot, one of the best I've eaten thus far, seemed kinda popular too since some other tables ordered the same. We had a coupon from Yelp but decided not to use it, so that's how good it was!
author: May G.

description:
The buffet says 10pm to 2 am, but they close at 3 am and you still get the buffet! What does that mean?

That means after you drain your paycheck on a night out on the town that is San Francisco, you can fill your stomach to your heart's desire - gaining that nourishment you need after the damage you did to your body.

The verdict? The food was delicious. To be honest, I don't really remember what was served in the buffet. The first few stations had a consistency of sauce, which was great with Indian rice. I love their chicken, and the naan bread - best I ever had. Freshly made upon order.

The servers were nice. They play random club music in there. They serve seeds that act like a mouth wash. Note: just chew them and spit them out. It's harder to swallow.

Being the only ones there at 2:30 am made our experiences there so much more awesome.
author: Jason S.

description:
I need to go back and try it again; my first time there with the buffet was good. 
The food was good, and the naan was fresh made.

It's definitely the prettiest indian buffet I've been to, with everything in big copper pots, very clean.
author: Charlie H.

description:
Delicious.  Went there around 4:00 yesterday for a late lunch/early dinner.  

Got the Naan and Keema Karahi.  It was spicy!  That was a nice unexpected bonus.  A lot of places don't seem to spice their Indian food enough any more.  Definitely check this place out.
author: Troy C.

description: The chicken tikka masala is exceptionally good here! It's very flavorful and tangy, savory and not too sweet. The saag aloo was also very flavorful and filling (unlike some saag dishes that can be bland and watery, this one is chunky and creamy). The samosas are generous and super tasty, and the staff is really friendly and full of suggestions. I only hesitate to give 5 stars because it's in sort of a dodgy part of Broadway, and they only have Budweiser (no King Fisher or Taj Mahal). I'm definitely going back for more, and though I don't live nearby, will go out of my way to frequent this gem.
author: Amanda F.

description:
Delicious!!! They delivered across town in exactly the time they said they would, with a super tasty dinner. They were so friendly too!

Just the right amount of spiciness and flavor.

i will definitely order from them again.
author: I. L.

description: I order Indian food from Urban Curry at least once a month. It's always fast and extremely tasty. I've never had a bad experience!
author: Ian M.

description:
If you want to eat really good Indian food, try Naan 'n Curry. I expected so much more from Urban Curry just by the name of the restaurant itself. 

You get little for your money and the food was super generic. The spices tasted weird and the flavors were pretty bland. I could have just saved myself $20 and picked something up from Trader Joe's.
author: Linda T.

description:
Not getting the 4 stars rating...not even close.

Good location.  Spacious and comfortable seating.  Service was pretty good...although I will never understand why some places will clear your plate when someone else is still eating, it just seem rude.

Complimentary chai, not bad.

What we ordered:
mango lassi - $2.99 - they went out so hubby tried the regular lassi?  it's milk, yogurt and sugar?  it's ok

basmati rice - $1.99 - meh

plain naan - $1.99 - meh

chicken masala - $6.99 - mostly sauce with few chunks of overcooked dry white meat.  sauce was not good - hubby says it tasted like cream of tomato - enough said

lamb vindaloo - $8.99 - we asked for extra spicy and it is less spicy than regular vindaloo.  chunks of lamb and potato, not bad.
author: Gloria H.

description: My second visit in a week. I love this place! Both times, I've gone in an off-hour. The first was at 3:30 PM or so and the waiter apologized that the buffet had been taken down. Didn't matter to me. I asked for a recommendation and he gave me a wonderful one. Turns out he is also the owner. The second time I visited, I did just make it in time for the buffet and it was very good. Especially the tandoori chicken which I  crave.
author: Paula H.

description:
I love indian food.  Is this not apparent yet? Well, I love Indian food within walking distance of home.  And if it's not a buffet, I love going with lots of people to get lots of dishes.  And that's just how my trip to urban curry went down.  

6 of us shared 6 dishes (one from each of their menu categories), and some naan and rice.  I tried karahi for the first time (at least that I know of) and was very impressed.  We had to get the staples: chicken tikka masala, lamb vindaloo, tandoori chicken, and saag paneer.  But then we opted for some goat biryani because i somehow convinced everyone that goat is delicious (which it is! though I guess it just highly resembles lamb).

Anyway, everything was great.  Nothing was bad.  I wasn't blown away.  But it's a place I'd gladly eat at again and again.  Plus the prices were quite reasonable and we had a little food leftover at the end.  All these things equal a win in my book.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
I gave this restaurant two stars just because of the extremely quick delivery and friendly delivery guy, but the food was nothing I would order again.   

The chicken tikka masala was excessively creamy and bland, and resembled an Italian pasta sauce more than an Indian sauce.  There was no flavor to the sauce aside from cream and tomato, and the sauce-to-chicken ratio was extremely unbalanced.  Even something as simple as a pinch of salt would have benefited this dish immensely.   

The palak paneer was seasoned slightly better than the tikka masala, but instead of being creamy was watery and a bit unappealing to the eye.  

I ordered both the tikka masala and palek paneer medium spicy, but I detected no spice at all.

The cucumber salad was ok, not great.  A bit more acidity in the dressing would have been nice, as would allowing the cucumber to sit in the dressing longer to actually absorb some flavor.  Most of it just ended up at the bottom of the container and became diluted by the watery cucumbers.  

The onion naan was actually pretty good and tasted fresh.  It was a generous portion brushed with butter and topped with caramelized onions and fresh cilantro.   

Overall, the food I ordered lacked the complexity of flavor and spice that Indian food usually offers.  I wasn't expecting total authenticity, but this place is way off.
author: Holly E.

description:
Meh. 

Meh.

It was OK. Meh. 

I don't like to spend time and money on ... meh. I'd rather spend more and have it be damn good; not meh.

Not going back.

Meh.
author: Tom M.

description:
I usually don't eat Indian food but I was craving something other than pizza and chinese for a late night nosh. 

I ordered the vegetable samosas, chicken vindaloo and chicken biryani around midnight via the Eat24hours.com site (very easy to use!) and the food arrived about 30 minutes later. 

There was a generous portion of each dish and all were perfectly seasoned and delicious. Urban Curry allows you to specify Mild, Medium or Hot for the spice level. I chose Hot for all of the dishes was pleasantly surprised that my mouth hovered right below en fuego mark. 

The only downside was the $25 delivery minimum but I had a great late night meal and will have plenty to snack on for the next few days. 

Will order from here again!
author: Joanna M.

description:
3.5 stars rounded up.

I've been to Urban Curry a couple times and left with a very full belly on both occasions.  

The service here is a bit on the slow side (-1 star) but they are friendly.

I've had CTM, bhengan bartha, aloo gobhi, lamb karahi, lamb biryani, with garlic naan and basmati rice over the two dinners there.

The lamb karahi definitely stands out for me.  It's a super flavorful dish, with tender and juicy chunks of lamb.  This dish makes me want to work my way through their Karahi menu it was so good.

Aloo gobhi was another favorite at my table, since it was nicely spiced but wasn't very heavy to eat.  

The CTM was fine, nothing to write home about, and same with the bhengan bartha.  The BB could have been served hotter, but it had a nice creamy texture which I enjoyed.  The lamb biryani didn't has as much lamb as I had hoped, but I guess that is typical for a rice dish.

I think the food tends to be a tad more on the spicy side here, so don't be surprised.

I live only a few blocks away from here so I'm sure to be back when I get that craving for good Indian food.
author: Naoko M.

description:
I read through most reviews for this place and they don't do justice to their food. 

Now, 
This place has the most amazing tea i have ever had in US, even though i make tea daily and have been doing so since i was 14, their tea beats my tea hands down, no questions asked.
I did not try their regular curry dishes But and its a big but, try their nepalese cuisine. Trust me its the most authentic nepalese cuisine you can eat and i know this because i come from an indian state that borders Nepal. The food made me take a trip back home especially the chowmein, chicken manchurian and MOMOsssss ! 

If i ever travel to SFO, i have a fixed dinner place from now on !
author: Ujjwal B.

description:
I'm loving Indian food lately and had to come here. Found a coupon from restaurant.com and it's only 2 blocks from the hotel! How have I missed this place before??
The garlic naan is so good and garlicy! The papadum was delicious, lamb vindaloo was spicy and oh so good and the goat karahi was okay. I forget goat can be very fatty and lot of bones. The spicey sauces were so tasty.
The food rocks! I guess they have a late night buffet which I thought about but wouldn't be able to use with the coupon. The buffet was all-you-can-eat for $10 bucks!! We left as they were starting to put out a variety of food. I would like to try that sometime, just to get more variety of the foods.

The web site stresses the service as being good. Well, it wasn't good but it wasn't non-existent either. They could have done a better job; but we also didn't need anything.

The after dinner tea was just right too.

What I can't understand is how people think this food is bland! Do you not have taste buds?? Have they been burned off from too spicy food before?? lol
The food is wonderful and I can't wait to go back sometime.
author: Sandra R.

description:
I went to Urban Curry last night for the first time with a couple of very good friends.  
I made a reservation for 7pm ~ it probably wasn't necessary since there were no other diners.  I can't explain that AT ALL!  This place is REALLY good!!!!  And the prices were reasonable.  The three of us ate until we were stuffed.  Food, beverages and a heft tip came out to about $60.

We had the chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, lamb biriyani, and naan.  All three were super tasty and the servings were generous.  The only thing is that it could have been a little spicier.  We asked for medium, but I guess they took the safe road.  That's fine though.  Better to be not spicy enough than too spicy. 

The location might be a little off-putting for a lot of people.  It's right in the middle of all the strip clubs on Broadway.  Oddly enough, I feel quite comfortable and safe in that neighborhood.   If for no other reason, it's high traffic and there is usually a lot of police presence.  I wish it was one hill closer to my apartment, but this is San Francisco.  You can get anywhere in about 20 minutes!
author: S. Y.

description: Great location and great food. The chicken tikka masala doesn't disappoint. The lamb kabob was cooked to perfection. The naan was perfect. The staff is friendly and helpful. There was fast service. The ambience is just OK. But overall excellent food!
author: Brooke B.

description:
Urban Curry, you caught my eye the first time I strolled past you amongst the flashing lights on Broadway.

I've visited you 3 times so far and you have not disappointed. I appreciate your genuine hospitality and inviting dining room with 'solid' tables and chairs, dressed with nice glassware and China. 

Your food is delicious! I appreciate the variety of  Indian + Pakistani cuisine you offer. I've especially enjoyed the flavor-packed Chicken Karahi paired with your more mellow Bainghan Bartha. Your fresh out of the oven naan is a delight.

I must return soon. Thank you!
author: Cathy K.

description:
Really nice atmosphere, very vegetarian friendly. Amazing menu selections. I will be coming here again! The street it's on may discourage you from going, but the cute interior, friendly staff and yummy authentic Indian cuisine is great.
I also used a Yelp coupon when I went through my smart phone.
author: Sarah A.

description: I will never Oder from here ever again, today I ordered food for my boyfriend Via Eat24. I ordered him $30 worth of food since the delivery limit is $25 when checking it shows the percentages of what would you like to tip..so I picked one and had it sent to my boyfriends work..Besides the fact that it took almost 2 hours for him to receive his lunch ( thank god I ordered it early) the delivery guy was absolutely rude! When my boyfriend gets the food the delivery person one asked him for more money, why would he ask him for more money if I laid with my card and it gave me the total of the amount before I proceeded to checkout! Seemed a little sketchy to me! With that he also asked my boyfriend if he can leave him something! I work in an industry were tipping helps a lot but tipping is for the kindness of people's hearts it's never required!! However I left tip on my card when checking out!!!! So not only is this super sketchy delivery person asking for more money which was already processed with tip he was prob trying to make extra cash and pocket the money saying that they didn't charge me but he also asked for another tip saying he didn't receive one which is BS cuz it added to my total!! So I suggest no one order from here unless you're okay with  the delivery man trying to scam you !
author: Ricky R.

description:
Urban Curry has really great Halal Indian and Pakistani food. As a soon to be former resident of nearby Chinatown I will miss this neighborhood gem and their friendly service.

Each time I've been here the staff has been extremely courteous. Once I had a coughing fit while eating a spicy curry and the wait staff was nice enough to check on me that the food wasn't too hot. It wasn't I was just a bit under the weather and the spicy curry on a cold SF winter night was just what I needed to clear up my sinuses.

Halal means no pork, no alcohol by the way.  But they have no problem if you BYOB (Booze or Bacon).
author: Alex O.

description: These people are crazy. They can cook the chicken in such a way that even my grandma cooking is no match for them. They have a open kitchen so we saw the cooking people running here and there. I guess to creat masterpiece one has to be insane. The final verdict was we will come back to this odd place again. That is, if my stomach didn't explode from eating too much Chicken Tikka Masala and Garlic Naan. On the contrary I did ran in some bad reviews bout this place, looks like we all have good days and bad days. It's only human nature that once we pay for something we expect nothing less. But don't mistake hospitality with obligation because looks like they are having fun working. Not trying to have fun while working. After all all it takes is a smile and plate full of yummy food for me to give them 5 star. Good job you crazy bunch of immigrant people. Keep cooking.
author: Ankit G.

description:
I am a night crawler and I am a fan of any food establishment that stays open past 11pm. So a few Saturday nights ago my boyfriend and I decided we were hungry for Indian. We hadn't eaten dinner yet.  He asked what time it was and to my surprise it was 11:15pm already! Geez where are we going to get Indian food at this time? Urban Curry!! We hopped on the 45 busline and got there around midnight. 

We walked in and were quickly greeted.  The restaurant was massive and nicely decorated. The waitress asked us if we were getting the buffet.  A  buffet from 10-2am for $10?! Sold! The selection was slightly larger than what I'm used to at Indian buffets and I enjoyed the vegetarian selection (there had to be at least 4).  It also came with nan and unlimited basmati rice.  The food was hot, spicy and delicious.  This place proves that the quality of the food doesn't have to suffer becausee it's a buffet.

To top it all off, when I checked in we received 15% off the bill. Sweet! I was totally satisfied when i left Urban Curry.  I will be back to try the al carte menu.  

Money Saving Tips: go to restaurants.com and buy a certificate or use scoutmob, or check in :)
author: danielle l.

description:
Warning - check your bill!!!!!
I ordered vegetable biryani to go and somehow ended up with an $11 bill for a $7.99 dish! Strangely, what was written on the ticket was $7.99 for the entree, $.96 for tax (who knew tax was so high these days!) and a total of $10. But the guy verbally told me I owed $11 but would take off $1 for my 10% Yelp discount... ?

As for the vegetable biryani, its mediocre - very very spicy and is mostly rice with a few pieces of cauliflower and carrots and a sprinkling of peas.
Lastly, my take out did not come with any napkins or utensils. Such a weird experience!
author: Sharon W.

description: It was okay, and the price is good, but the food didn't taste all that great unlike almost all other Indian food I have tried before. I don't think I will be returning. Utter meh.
author: Joe L.

description: I've eaten here a few times, I like the fact you can bring your own beer or alcoholic beverage you would like to have with dinner. You seat yourself when you walk in and you get your own silver wear, napkins, and water which I found different. The food was good quality but I thought it could use some more flavor. My friend didn't like what she ordered and they took it back with no questions asked and took it off our bill. She really liked the yellow curry when it was brought out to us. I have not had a bad dish there. Good food and reasonable prices, I would stop again if I am in the area.
author: Brandon O.

description:
One word - Karahi.  The Lamb Karahi I had was amazing.  Palak Paneer was great, was least oily paneer I've ever had - loved it.  Chicken Tikka Masala - excellent.  I've had better samosa; it was overly mushy inside, consistency not right.  I'd recommend the Tikka Masala and Palak Paneer but strongly urge you to try the Karahi -it was just superb.  I'm hungry just thinking about it.

Service was good, servers kind.  Recently under new management in last 6 or so weeks.  New owner is personable and dynamic.  Explained how they made the dishes and the origins.  Convinced us to go in and try and we're so glad we did.  Will be one of our regular stops.  They deliver too.  If you're driving, heed the parking sign restrictions.
author: Liz K.

description:
I am seriously craving this right now! Located next to "Garden of Eden" strip club, I never would have thought Broadway would have such a delicious Indian restaurant. 

We went early on a Friday, probably one of the first people there for dinner, and were treated to chai tea. We ordered Naan, some of the best Chicken Tikka Masala I have ever had, and the Chicken Jalfrazi. The prices are also hard to beat... each entree is about $6-8. I can't wait to go back... oh, AND it was enough for lunch the following day!
author: Kristin F.

description:
Read about this "cheap eats" place on sfgate.com. Love Indian food...

The Shrimp Pakora was good.
Mango Lassi was really yummy.
Complimentary Chai Tea was pretty good.
Saag Paneer was quite nice (asked for medium spice and WOW, it was spicy!!!).
The vegetable curry was the downer. The vegetables were overcooked and mushy, the curry was a bit watery, and it was on the "not so good" end of the scale.

There are other Indian restaurants in the city that for a "cheap eats" kinda place we'll go back to.

The staff was very nice. The place was very clean. The ambiance was good.

I can't see us going back...
author: Mark M.

description:
Without a doubt, my friend and I agreed:  This was the best Indian food we tried. We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Karahi and Garlic Naan.  Can't say anything bad about their food, service or the atmosphere of this place.  It was a little confusing trying to locate exactly where this place was on Broadway, but if you're coming from Market St area, going north on Columbus, then it's to your right, where Columbus and Broadway intersect.  

When we got here on a Sunday evening, my friend honestly was a bit weary since no other customers were here, but after trying their food, any worries he had went out the door.  We were wondering why there weren't more customers in here, since their food was awesome, but on the other hand, since it was quiet, it created for a relaxed and chill moment in time, to really concentrate on our food;-)  

We weren't quite familiar with Indian food, so I asked the waiter for recommendations and he had suggested the Chicken Karahi, which was delicious - just the right amount of spice.  The Tikka Masala was so mellow and as for the Garlic Naan - it was the best I've ever tasted, seriously.  Definitely worth your visit and easy 5 stars here.
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
Very good food. Got Lamb Vindaloo and garlic naan. The naan was very fresh, and the lamb was tasty, but it was very spicy. I suggest if you usually go with medium spicy, ask for mild vindaloo here in this restaurant. Cos the medium dish here  was already spicy enough. :D 

Besides that, the waitress was very friendly and helpful, which makes you feel welcome in the restaurant.
author: Jane R.

description:
Friendly staff and delicious pumpkin chai to sip on for free while I waited for my to-go order. 

The Chicken Vindaloo was great. Nice and spicy with tender pieces of chicken. A couple fatty bites but not much. 

I should have listened to some of the reviews I'd read on the Tikka Masala as I agree, definitely just tasted like chicken in tomato cream sauce (that you'd put with pasta!). There were chunks of breast meat, which I normally really like, but they were a tad to firm and not very tender. 

I'm still giving it 4 stars for the service, chai and Vindaloo though!
author: Ali K.

description: Great Indian buffet, with exquisite Indian food. Their price is only slightly higher than other Indian buffets in the area, but the quality of the food makes it an excellent choice. Many of the dishes are quite hot, which I personally like better. The atmosphere is good, and the service is excellent. A great value and always a good food experience.
author: Larry H.

description:
I could have SWORN I wrote a review for this place months ago.. But apparently not. So here goes.

When it comes to Indian or Pakistani food, this is my new regular spot! The malai kofta and bainghan bartha [both vegetarian] are my favorite entrees, by far! Suuuuper good sauces. The veggie somosas, daal and garlic naan are also must-haves. My boyfriend is hooked on the chicken tikka masala. The portions are perfectly sized, leaving me with some left overs for later and the prices are so on point. You honestly get more than you pay for, in my opinion. Especially with the complementary chai latte and 15% off if you mention Yelp. Cher [hope I spelled it right], who always seems to be working, is genuinely nice and so is the rest of the wait staff. I'm just stoked I live so close!

Oh yeah, and it's BYOB. [:
author: Sarah S.

description:
I think this is the first time I've ever been to a restaurant where they give Yelpers a discount.  It's already cheap and they offer an additional 15% off for us?  Talk about a deal!  If you ever want to try Indian food but don't know what to order and thought it was a little pricey.  No need to worry here.............just order everything.  Have your waiter help you.  We had our waiter, Suro.....which I think that was his name, help us with the ordering.

The food is good
The place is clean
The service was good
The location....does it really matter? 
Competition....Tandori and naan and curry down the block.  Why go there when this place is all of the above.
Price..........you can't beat it

Chicken pakora appetizer
Garlic naan
Samosa
chicken tikka
curry chicken
balsmati rice
coke(the soda)

Everything was great it just wasn't phenominal.  The food is 3 1/2 but the service and price really brings it up to 4 1/2............so I rounded it down just because I think it could've been better.  Trust me.............I will be coming back.

The whole meal after our Yelp discount...........22 dollars
author: jason g.

description: The tikka masala is the best! Great service, good food, and they deliver. I've also had their ghobi ghosht, lamb vindaloo, and they're tandoori chicken. All so good!
author: Sofia O.

description:
I have never written a yelp before and honestly never thought I would actually take the time to write one... until now. In fact, I signed up for yelp this evening to review Urban Curry. 
I lived in Boulder, CO until recently and my boyfriend lives nearby Urban Curry and I was  excited to try it. We have ordered take out twice (in the past three days!) and both times the food and service was absolutely wonderful. We ordered the chicken gobhi and lamb jalfrazi both times and I would eat here ALL of the time if i could! Their biyranis are also very delicious and full of amazing flavor! The Roti is perfection. I really cannot say enough good things about this particular place of business!
The prices are awesome and they are open late! 
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Urban Curry and I will continue to give them my business!
author: Kimberly W.

description: Delicious! It is worth the extra walk from the Financial District when you have a craving for chana masala, saag and naan.  I'm looking forward to trying the other entrees.
author: Allison E.

description: I'm giving this star to the delivery guy, he's awesome and he earned it. However this is the worst, least authentic, most bland Indian food I've ever had. The reason its cheaper than a lot of the other Indian food in SF must be the money they're saving on spices. The Tikka Masala I had was a uniquely awful combination of watery sauce and bone-dry chicken. If you actually like Indian food, avoid this place.
author: Amy F.

description:
The food tastes so good
And Wifey-san is happy
At Urban Curry
-----

My wife said this was the best Indian food she's ever had, so that's already worth a few stars regardless of my opinion, but on top of that, it was legitimately good and they gave me a Yelper discount (always appreciated).

I was a bit confused because on the menu Chai costs $1.99 and they gave it to me for free, but I'm not one to be ungrateful for things like that.

I asked for my curry spicy and they certainly delivered.  When I ordered a second plate of rice it seemed to have more rice than my first plate, and I appreciated that as well.

It does cost more than your average local curry place, but it feels cleaner and classier inside, and it's the only Indian restaurant that I know of (or will be going to) in the North Beach area.

The one thing that caught my eye in kind of a funny way, was the HUGE painting on the wall of a Roman marketplace--obviously a relic from whatever restaurant used to operate there (who cares).  It's kind of cute and made me wonder what the Indian food in Rome tastes like (do they even have any there?)

If you like Indian food, you should try Urban (Roman) Curry.
author: Jin D.

description:
Stumbled out of the rain and into Urban Curry on a stormy Saturday afternoon. There is nothing like super duper tasty chicken karahi, some garlic naan, dhal channa, and  biryani to warm the belly and give you the recharge you need to head back out into the nasty weather. 

in particular, i really enjoyed the service & the ambiance... 

enjoy your 5-stars Urban Curry... I hope more and more people start enjoying your karahi like I did.
author: Peanut S.

description: HORRIBLE DELIVERY SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!! this is the 2nd time the food is reaching 1.5hrs late and on top of that the guys asks me for a tip!!!!
author: sindu m.

description:
It was a cold SF afternoon when I had the craving for curry in the Financial District/Nob Hill border.

I ordered ahead so I could have 10 minutes to walk there, pick up my curry and walk back to the office. From the outside it's sketchy and sandwiched in between two strip clubs on Broadway, directly across the street from two other strip clubs (you know, that part of Broadway). 

I walked inside and it was a completely different world. It had contemporary furniture and old world charm with soft oil paintings, very polite staff and open spaces. Best of all, the restaurant didn't smell completely of curry even though the food was deliciously flavorful.

The host and I made small talk while my chicken vindaloo and plain naan were being packaged. He said they have been open only two months and they have 4 other locations. "The same name?" I asked.

"No" he said. "The others are all called House of Curries."

My heart sank at that statement. I'd only ever been to the UC Berkeley House of Curries and I knew from experience not to order meat because it was always overdone and that things were better than naan and curry, but not fantastic.

For a chicken vindaloo and naan it was $9.50. I walked back to the office and tentatively took my first bite. The chicken was juicy and perfectly cooked. The vindaloo was slightly sweet, slightly tangy and very spicy. Best of all, it was not overly greasy and had just the right chicken to potato to sauce ratio. Oh, and the naan was spongy and moist. 

It made me realize how much worst the same ownership can make a restaurant when they're in a college town and know they can get away with it. It also made me realize that I can get an amazing vindaloo in the Bay Area in a CLEAN restaurant with fantastic service.

Trust me, I will be back often.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Omg!! When in Nob hill this place is a must. In fact, and I NEVER do this, I actually went to this place two nights in a row? Being a foodie tourist this is saying something I assure you. Everything tasted really fresh and if you like spicy stuff they ain't shy. This is the real deal.

The service was super friendly and both times we went we came in later. I mean one time 20 min to close later ( sorry ) and even though that time they were pretty much closed up and the music from the kitchen had already taken over the restaurant they served us with a smile and not a hint of " oh man hurry up you dumb tourist" 


A massive amount of food for the money probably the cheapest two meals I have had in this city hands down. Two people for fewer than 30 bucks, trying to literally gorge themselves on this place. (O.k. there is no beer or wine)

The masala papadum is probably the best I've had but I would not consider myself a super connoisseur or anything. Either way an absolute must in S.F. for me...
author: Robert H.

description:
Didn't this place used to be a porn shop before Urban Curry came in?

Anyways, came in with a group of friends on a rainy day when we were looking for dinner.  After being turned away from 2 restraunts that gave us an 1.5 hour wait because we didn't have reservations, I remembered that Urban curry just opened not that long ago and I was craving indian food over Italian.

Came in, the place was kind of empty but filled up pretty fast after we came in. 

- Got the Paneer Tikka Masla .  It was alright, but not spicy at all and a little disappointing.
- The naan was awesome, fresh and yummy
- The chai came free with the meal, but wasn't expecting much.  It tasted like hot milk with a little chai flavor in it.
- My friend got the Mutter Paneer which was a lot better, but a little to spicy for my taste.
- The waiters were very friendly but kind of forgot about us after the place got really busy (hence the -1 star).  Had to go out of our way to get their attention for them to clear our table and get the check.

Pretty cheap and lots of vegetarian options.  Lots of seating and good for larger groups.

Left urban curry with a pretty good feeling and yummy paneer in my tummy.  I'd def recommend and come back again.
author: Kameron K.

description:
With a name like Urban Curry, you'd almost expect something hip and modern, maybe even with a fusion flare - but what you get is a generic Indian eatery with traditional dishes. 

That's all well and good, and wouldn't have warranted a poor review, but the food itself was uninspired and mediocre. I've eaten a lot of Indian in this town, and this was by the far the most boring. Small portions gave way to bland flavors. We were all hungry, but ended up leaving a couple dishes relatively untouched. You can do a lot better.

We were one of only two tables occupied on a Thursday night at 7pm.
author: Bryan K.

description: Found the restaurant on Yelp while visiting San Francisco.  Upon entering we felt the ambience was average but the restaurant appeared clean and uncluttered.  The food was the shining star in our experience.  It was absolutely delicious! My husband ordered the Chicken Tikka Kabab and I had the Paneer Makhani with Garlic naan.  I loved the food so much that I made it a point to let both the manager and chef know personally.  I also packed up leftovers to eat the next day.  Having been to many Indian restaurants here and in India...I have to say this meal was one of the best! The waitstaff was also very helpful and efficient. 5 out of 5!
author: S S.

description:
Horribly disappointing...Urban Curry has a 4 star yelp* rating w/ over 90 reviews, something is seriously wrong with this.

Firstly, the restaurant is situated in the heart of Stripperville, which is odd, but not surprising in SF.  The ambience inside of the restaurant is dated and unimpressive.  The place was probably less than half full so we were asked to choose our own table.  We chose one right by the window and were given 2 menus and some water.  We ordered:

1. Mattar Paneer - I ordered this mild, but it came out HOT HOT HOT, luckily I had the foresight to take a Tums beforehand.  This dish was really sour and spicy, no hint of sweet or creamy whatsoever.  The cubes of paneer were clearly evident, but hardly any sign of peas.
2. Vegetable Curry - 90% cauliflower, 5% carrots, 2% peas, 3% chili oil and not much else.  S.B. hates cauliflower, so he was particularly dismayed.  This dish was really oily.
3. Basmati Rice - not much to say about this.
4. Plain Naan - this was the only saving grace of the whole meal, it was fresh, hot and drizzled with ghee which made it smell and taste deliciously like butter.
5. Raita - unnecessarily runny.

We only ate about 30% of the curries we ordered, and 100% of each the naan, rice and raita.  It was that bad.

The plates were dirty when they dropped them off pre-meal, post-meal, the waiter asked us for help stacking plates when he was clearing the table.

Whole fiasco cost us $24.00 (tax and tip included).  Never again...!
author: Burrito M.

description:
Urban Curry is so inexpensive, I had to order more and i did!

Order:
Vegetable Samosa
Fish Tikka Masala
Garlic Naan
Daal Soup
Tandoori Chicken
Balsati Rice

I have to give in and say... ALL THE DISHES DESERVES 5 STARS!
Flavor just blast in your mouth and the chicken are so tender. Service like others say was very attentive and friendly. All those dishes above were ordered for 2 people, and we had leftovers which made another order for lunch the next day ;) i definitely recommend this place to anyone craving indian/pakistan food!
author: Nancy N.

description:
I went as a party of 4 for early Saturday dinner, around 6pm. We ordered ~ $45 worth of food, and had a prepurchased coupon 20 for 40. The food and service was worth the full price, in my opinion.  

Ordered everything mild except one: 
.plain roti
.plain nan
.rice for 2
.chicken tikki masala
.chicken with lentils
.palak paneer .medium spicy 
.fish kahashi

I liked the creaminess of the tikki masala sauce, counter to some other reviews. I liked that the palak paneer was rich and not too saucy or watered down like in some places. Kahashi was really surprising in flavor and good, the fish was first fried which wasn't desired but wasn't bad. The lentils dish was good, hearty. 

Every dish had a different flavor and texture. Every dish was cleaned to the last drop. 

Service was excellent. We had a baby at our table, which gave us an advantage since the waitstaff loved coming by to see her. She asked if the dishes were too spicy and we said yes for the folks who thought so, and she came by with a batch of yogurt sauce to cool the fire (good sauce). Attentive and friendly.

Not sure if I'd try this place during the dinner rush or late night crawl, but for sure I'd go again for the pleasant experience off-peak.
author: Loocha L.

description:
What can I say that people haven't said already? not much...

Pros:
- Delicious, delicious, delicious! we ordered the chicken tikka masala, chicken vindaloo, garlic nann and green salad. both entrees were divine & garlic nann was one of the best we've ever had! crispy yet doughy and full of flavor. yummmmmm.
- Excellent, friendly service
- Excellent price

Cons:
- Unfortunately parking was tough. we parked across the street at a parking lot and paid $10. not much but would've been nice to not have to pay.

Overall, EXCELLENT! can't wait to go back!
author: Lo P.

description: nice little indian place. I've only gotten take-out, so my review is based off that. Samosas were good, so was chicken tikka masala. Not any thing to write home about, but definitely decent, good food.
author: Jessi M.

description:
Nice yummy tea (freeeee) and naan. Skip the CTM if you like anything else. "Medium" isn't all that spicy.

Samosas are HELLA good.
author: Miranda E.

description:
I'm a fan! We live and work downtown. We love Indian food. We are watching our budget weekly. I also have a pet peeve of smelling like the kitchen after dining.

As fans of House of Curries in the East Bay on College Ave. and Solano Ave, we were told to go here. This is the newest restaurant started by this owner and chef. After going a handful of times, we've decided it's our go-to Indian restaurant. It's different from House of Curries. The flavors may be a little more rich, a tad spicier, not as large servings. It works very well for me.

I encourage you to dine here for a comfortable, affordable, yummy dinner. The people that work here are very kind, courteous, helpful and hard-working.
author: Holly F.

description:
My boyfriend and I were looking to try a new Indian spot near our place, and found Urban Curry on good old Yelp. Urban Curry's great location, coupled with the 15% off promotion for mentioning Yelp, made it an easy decision. 

When we got there, we were greeted by their friendly staff and were happy to see reasonable menu prices. We received complimentary chai tea (yummm), and ordered garlic nan, chicken tikka masala, and lahori cholay for dinner. It was all delicious!! Our bill was less than 30 bucks (15% discount included). 

Sparknotes version: Great food, friendly staff, charming ambiance, and reasonable prices? yes, please!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Wow...the past reviewers were NOT exaggerating when they were hyping up this restaurant.  My bf and I decided to try it out and see what Urban Curry was all about.  

Let me say first, this place has amazing service.  Our waiter was so nice and attentive, which was great! Everyone who worked in the restaurant was also very friendly, which added to the whole ambiance of the restaurant.  

We ordered samosas, chicken tikka masala (our favorite - the sauce was so creamy and tasty!), dahl mahkni, rice, and garlic naan.  Everything we ordered was of high quality and the prices were unbelievably REASONABLE (great deal and generous portions). 

This is our new favorite casual restaurant - hands down!!
author: Cherlyn M.

description:
The best Indian food I've ever had! The chicken tikka masala was yum yum, the sauce wasn't too heavy, it was perfect! I was able to eat it without rice, but we did order some garlic nann, which was very tasty and soft. My bf ordered the dal chicken, I wasn't a big fan of beans, but it was really good, the chicken was tender and not over cooked. 

Just like everyone else said, the service was great, the place was clean and we left with satisfying tummy, but without the smelly hair or cloth. 

Btw, they are in the process of applying for the Hookah license, which my bf is super excited about! Can't wait to go back!!
author: Kai Z.

description:
This place is definitely a step above every other Indian/Pakistani place I've been to in the city. I feel like most places have pretty good food. But what sets Urban Curry apart from everywhere else? Hand down their service. 

My GF and I swung by for some lunch the other day after craving some tikka masala and naan. After walking in I was expecting some angry guy to take our order, throw us a number, then go bus and set our own table... something Ive come to expect at almost every other place. 

We were quickly greeted by a friendly hostess who seated us promptly. Nice table settings, cloth napkins, stuff you would expect at most any SF restaurant. We were served quickly and the food was great. Tikka Masala, Aloo Palak, a garlic and potato naan. Enough for leftovers. 

I guess what makes the workers mad and irritable at other places is that they are open till the wee hours. Usually when I have my curry cravings. That the only thing I wish Urban had... really late night hours. But till then, lunch and regular dinner cravings can now be satisfied here! 

...ooh! 15% off if you mention yelp!
author: Roy L.

description:
This place is great. I had no idea an Indian restaurant among all the strip clubs on Broadway would actually be good. It is definitely brand new, but the great thing about that is the wait staff is eager to please and since they don't have their liquor license yet, it's BYOB! 

The ambiance is relaxed, but still a bit elegant. Food is very good for the price. We had the chicken tikka masala - creamy and delicious - and the lamb vindaloo - yummy! Our waitress even offered six levels of spiciness to choose from. I will surely be back soon, especially once they get their license to serve hookah.
author: Jamie Q.

description:
Considering the price and the service, this place deserves 3.5 stars.  I feel bad giving it only 3 stars because this is far better than the average hole in the wall Indian joints in the city. However, the service bumps it up and the cleanliness as well. I think UC is more of a late night drunk food place. We ordered the eggplant, mushroom masala and chicken tikka masala.
