They were nice and threw in naan on the house. The naan was good, but it was a bit salty. The rice was good.  The chicken tikka masala was good, but I think roti's and amber's chicken tikka tasted better.  The mushroom masala was a stellar 5 stars.  The eggplant dish was all mush without any real pieces of eggplant. Not sure if that is how they usually make it, but even despite the consistency, it wasn't very flavorful.  

Anyway, I'm sure when you are drunk from a bar on Broadway, all of the food will taste delicious.
author: Natalie S.

description: This place is awesome! We loved it so much the first time we came that we decided to come back for our anniversary. We ordered the pappadums to start, and chicken tikka, palak paneer, rice and garlic naan. The food was delicious, our waitress Maureen (sp?)was super friendly and attentive, and we loved the free chai! We will definitely be coming back here!
author: Matt W.

description:
I walked by several times since it opened and I always tell myself "eh....maybe another day" and today was that day.

I met up with my buddy for lunch there.  We walked in and there were two  large parties and another party of two so I figured it couldn't be bad.

Decor-open floor plan, clean, dim lighting.  

Service-the only complaint I have is that it took a while to get our food.  

Food:

Chicken boti-juicy white meat on a sizzling platter with bell peppers, and onions.  It's a bit sour from the lemon, but it was the most perfectly cooked chicken I've had in a while.  I could see the juice when it was placed on our table.

Chicken tikka masala-more yogurt than spice.  It's not as savory as naan and curry's tikka masala.

garlic naan-cooked perfectly, but was the last item to come out....I found that kind of weird and quite honestly it kind of irked me when I saw the entire kitchen staff just chatting away when it took almost half an hour to get our food.  

chai-kind of watered down.  It's lacking a certain creaminess.

this is one of those restaurants where I would come for the naan and sizzling platters, but I wouldn't be in a hurry to order the curry again.
author: Michelle S.

description:
I tried this place with an old friend. Not feeling adventurous I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala which was very different than what I get in other places (Chaat Cafe and Mefil are my two favorite places close to where I live). It was much too creamy in taste for me and lacked the taste that I am used to from almost every single other Indian place I have ever tried.

The place has a good atmosphere and the fact that you can bring your own beer (my friend went on a beer run encouraged by the waiter) makes me give it 3 stars instead of two. With all the good reviews I wonder if I should have ordered something else
author: Brian S.

description: Pretty good, spicy.
author: Michael E.

description:
Came here with a friend. In the midst of all the surrounding nudie bars, it's strange to find a pretty good Indian place. 

We ordered:
Plain naan
Rice
Lamb Tikka Masala
Tandoori Chicken 

Naan was delicious -- fluffy and slightly crispy on the outside. Lamb Tikka Masala was also very tasty. The lamb was nice and tender, and the tikka masala was flavorful. I wish it had more spice to it though. 

I asked my friend if it was okay if I got the food spicy since she normally can't handle spicy food; she said it was okay. The server saw this whole exchange between us though and so when I tasted the food, it didn't taste spicy at all (although my friend said it was very spicy to her -- so props to the server, I guess, for accommodating to her). 

Tandoori Chicken had good flavor, but was dry :(
author: Wendy S.

description:
Found this place through Yelp and it was everything we expected from reading the reviews. Great tasting food at a great price.

We ordered:
Aloo Naan (delicious!)
Chicken Tikka Masala - went for the regular spice here as we weren't sure how spicy it would be. It was just the right amount of heat for us, not being able to handle ultra spicy foods. Loved it.
Chicken Tandoori with breast meat - came on a sizzling pan, spicier than the tikka masala.
Basmati Rice

I also ordered a chai which I wasn't charged for, as someone else also mentioned. No complaints here about that! We got the 15% discount for mentioning Yelp, so all up it came under $20. For that price it was a great meal, and it was pretty empty (we were one of only two tables there) so the service was prompt too, without being irritating. Nice and clean inside. I'd definitely go back if I lived in San Francisco!
author: Amelia J.

description:
Relatively new restaurant. Obviously still working some things out, but trying very hard to make things great!

Date & Time:  12/27 7PM 
Crowd: Mid 20s and Thirties, Not Very Full
Atmosphere:  Friendly but empty
Decor:  Some Indian/Pakistani? paintings line the walls, some hookahs, pretty bare and minimal
Service:  We had two servers. The first didn't have very good English, but was very nice. The second ended up taking our order and was also very nice. A little slow, but we weren't in a rush.
Imbibe:  Chai tea, more bitter than usual, but sugar was provided, quite good actually
Devour:  Starded with garlic and paneel naan which was quite good. Cucumber salad was unique and had a kick, shared four entrees of lamb kebobs, rice and goat meat, a spinach dish which was quite delicious (paneel... something), and a chicken dish with creamy tomato curry. It was all good.
Total:  ~$45 w/ the Yelp 15% discount for 4 people and a lot of food
Helpful Hints: Don't come her in a rush.
author: Tyler G.

description: Awesome curry and naan! Loved the korma and butter chicken. Easy delivery!
author: Kristi N.

description:
This restaurant is fantastic!!!!

Great food! I would highly recommend trying the buffet. There are SO many items, including a number of vegetarian ones (which is very important to me as a vegetarian). Multiple dessert items in the buffet as well...yum! I was also impressed by the exquisite presentation of the buffet (they had these nice, artsy pots instead of boring old trays). The food was warm and delicious.

The staff and service are excellent as well. They really care about their customers. They can also customize your dish for you. I was in the mood for a mushroom curry (which was not exactly listed on the menu) and they readily accommodated my request. The prices were reasonable as well, so if you are looking for great food, excellent service, and an overall fun experience on a budget, Urban Curry should be  your next stop! :)
author: Radhika R.

description:
Used to come here sometimes for lunch.

I think I always got the Chicken Tikka Masala and it was good every time.  Never dined in, but it seems like a cute place.

Love the chai as wel!
author: Nancy C.

description:
There's something to be said about a place calling itself "Urban Curry" and then having old school furniture, kitschy place settings, and beige colored walls with water color paintings filling the whole space. While their setup is disappointing (I really was hoping for a more contemporary Mission-style eatery to liven up the Broadway strip), the food and service are great. Conveniently located close enough to service us lazy Tel-Hi dwellers, Urban Curry offers a wide range of traditional indian dishes for a fairly reasonable price. The chicken tikka masala, aloo ghobi and naan were delicious. AND they hooked me up with a 10% discount because I lived in the 'hood! This is definitely not a trend-whore establishment like DOSA but it does offer up very good indian food. 

Overall, awesome. I hope this place has the staying power to brave the black hole that is the Broadway strip!
author: Jonny Bobby G.

description:
As far as I am concerned, there is a new champ in town. 

Urban Curry is fantastic, prices are good, staff was extra courteous. 

We had standards like Chicken Tikka Masala, naan, etc... All was the best we have had.

Prices were very reasonable.  I highly recommend it.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Nothing to dislike (not even being surrounded on all sides by seedy strip clubs):

* Lamb Karahi was delicious (albeit a tad salty). (According to our server, karahi is a signature dish of this restaurant).
* Restaurant is clean. You will leave not smelling like you just left an Indian restaurant.
* No ghee overload. You will not be gulping water by the end of the meal.
* Spicy food is spicy food. You won't be disappointed.
* Prices are reasonable. And a lunch party of 6 doesn't automatically incur a gratuitous gratuity.

Picky people should note that the chicken dishes are in general dark meat, except for the chicken tikka masala and perhaps one or two other dishes.
author: Rob T.

description: I had such a great time here. The food was delicious. Fresh, nice rich flavors. Loved the rice and garlic naan bread. The sauces had the perfect color and texture all around pretty good. We struck up a conversation with the folks and  it turns out the owner is from Katmandu and he worked as a Sherpa.  Not just that but  the dishwasher had climbed Mount Everest 7 times! Totally humble, unassuming guy who took on one of the worlds more death defying challenges, not once but many times over.  A splendid way to spend my night.
author: martha s.

description: Quick service, cheap (especially with the 15% Yelp check-in discount), and nice and tasty.
author: Greg H.

description:
During a lunch time adventure, my coworker and I ended up at Urban Curry.   We were greeted with a smile by the waiter and seated.  We had the chicken tikka masala and the bainghan bartha (Baked eggplant cooked with onions, peas, tomatoes, bell peppers, herbs and spices. )  with 2 onion naans.  We ordered the dishes to be medium spicy, but they definitely were a bit more than that.  Both dishes were delicious.  The onion naans were made fresh, but one was a tad bit on the burnt side.  The service got a little slower as the lunch hour groups began to arrive.  One waiter for the entire restaurant... Not good.  2 dishes + 2 onion naans + extra 15% for mentioning yelp = ~$20. =)

Overall, it was a great dining experience.  The food was yummy, nice wait staff, and relatively inexpensive.  Can't wait to go back =)
author: E C.

description:
During a recent trip to San Fran, I decided to check this place out based on Yelp Reviews. Very very impressed

The inside of the restaurant is very elegant and the staff is very kind.
I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala with mild spice level, basmathi rice (not included with dish, ??) and plain naan. Food tasted great.

However, the location is in a type of red light district (surrounded by strip clubs)

This is the only Indian restaurant where the Chicken in Chicken Tikka Masala was not shredded to smaller pieces. 

Would love to go back in the future.
author: Harshal P.

description: Another delicious meal at the Urban Curry. We tried the Lamb Coconut and of course the Chicken Tikki Masala. We helped ourselves to the self serve Chai Tea many times. The lamb coconut was creamy thick and delicious. The chai tea was very flavorful and not watered down.
author: Brad M.

description:
This is the best indian place which I have found in the FiDi/North Beach area. 

I come here from time to time with my co-workers. They always have plenty of seats to accommodate our large groups and the service is prompt. The tables are covered with white linen and this place appears to be in an old italian place from the look of the walls. 

When you expect a dish to be spicy it is quite spicy, be ready.
author: Eric G.

description:
Great, quick and friendly service!  Chicken Tikka Masala with Garlic Naan was great!! Lamb tandoori was awesome although a wee bit more spicy than the 'medium' level that we asked for.  

Best thing we ate were these fried cheese cubes on the appetizer menu...SO GOOD with the sauces they provide!!!!!

Definitely would come back.
author: Vincent M.

description:
I was out with some friends and we were trying to find a place that was within half a mile of Pier 23 where our good friend was having a CD release party.  We're looking at things within half a mile on Yelp, and came across Urban Curry being rated at 4.5 stars after ~55 reviews.  [While, in most cities, 55 reviews generally suggests the reviews have gone be on the point of the employees and their friends trying to build up the restaurant, in a city like San Francisco were many restaurants have 1000 reviews, it's hard to say.]

We were NOT disappointed. Now that's not to say we weren't worried when I first got there... is right next to the Garden of Eden strip club.  But when we entered, we are greeted with a very well apportioned space, nice decor, and lots of space. In San Francisco, you don't find a lot of restaurants have space between the tables--especially in North Beach. This restaurant had a generous amount of space between the tables and our party of seven did not feel at all cramped.

The food: the prices are amazing! But hardly an item more expensive than seven or eight dollars.  The quality of the food is quite good... it's not nearly as savory as Lahore Karahi (which I consider the ultimate in Pakistani comfort food), but each and every dish was well-made and delicious. Even though the menu indicates that Chai tea is $1.99, they said it was complementary. I don't know if that was just because we have a large group or because they just put that on the menu that way so vagrants don't come in and start drinking it-- but bravo--way to keep up with Naan 'n Curry, with a bit classier atmosphere and better service (i..e, service).  

We also noticed that they had some goat items on the menu.  We were not feeling adventuresome enough to try it, but maybe next time there will be some goat tried. We stuck with vegetable curry, chicken tikka masala, lamb curry, eggplant, and saag paneer.  At several dishes of rice and naan, and we had dinner for seven people per under $50.  Oh yeah, if they're still running their yelp promotion of 10 or 15% off that's pretty cool too...   but given the neighborhood, the atmosphere, the price, and the quality of food, 4.5 stars seems right on.
author: Jaime R.

description:
The area was kind of shady and there was a drunk guy walking around yelling at people...that was interesting.

Anyway, I had the lunch buffet and there was a good selection--also unlimited naan.  The waitress was really accommodating; she was on top of refilling waters and clearing plates etc. I really wanted samosas but there weren't any on the buffet list but the waitress actually brought out some for me!  That was really cool.

Food-wise, it was okay/good.  Not as flavorful as I hoped it would be.  The chicken in the Chicken Tikka Masala was a little too dry for me.  Nothing really wowed me and I was hungry so yeah... There's also a section that has fresh fruits. So to recap...there's rice, curries (chicken, lamb, eggplant, spinach...and i forgot the rest), a lentil soup, tandoori chicken, naan, and that was about it I think.

Three stars for the food but one more star added for great service.
author: Hwan L.

description:
Great food and excellent service.  The staff was very attentive and even gave my older friend extra containers dipping sauce asking her to return when the sauce was gone.  I was very impressed with the waiter's kindness.  

The naan was really good and the Tikka Masala sauce was super yummy.  I want to go again to try some other dishes.  

We had an appetizer, two main courses, naan and two glasses of wine for $30.  Wow!  Where can you get that value in SF?
author: Cynthia R.

description: Solid indian food for delivery.  I ordered everything HOT.  When they say HOT its freakin HOT!  My fat is still sweating after eating this two days ago.  I felt like I was Fat Man vs. Food.  It was so hot my boobs were lactating.  Its THAT hot.  The chicken tiki masala the next day has the texture of humus.  Probs cuz I ate it cold.  Fat people are lazy to heat up food.  The Lamb Bryani rice was pretty good.  I will definitely order again in a few months.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Good food, good serving sizes, nice prices. 

I order take out from here.  I almost always order the chicken tikka masala.  Yeah, yeah, I know.  White people food.  However, their CTM is seriously delicious and I just can't bring myself to order anything else--I don't order take out all that often, so I want to make sure I get something that I know that will be tasty.
author: Séamus C.

description:
Really great new spot!  Delicious Indian food (even my Indian friends agree). Nice atmosphere with a very warm, friendly staff. Excellent value.  Almost 5 stars.

Some may find the location initially challenging, as it is on Broadway in North Beach between a wine bar and strip joint (a low grade one at that). However, the restaurant itself is quite inviting.  I've returned several times in just a few months.
author: Duke K.

description: Very nice staff and we thought the food was delicious:  Chicken curry, Lamb Rogan Josh and Aloo Palak, with garlic naan.  Having read the reviews, we asked for spicy, and they delivered!  They also threw in free gulab jamun which was also delicious.  You do bus your own dishes, silverware and water but we preferred it; it enables you to control the pace of your meal and there's no pressure to order too much.
author: Onj J.

description:
Delicious Indian food, GREAT service, and easily accessible location.  We ordered the onion chili salad, which was the one thing I didn't think was delicious, as it was just a plate of chopped, raw onion and chili powder on top.  wtf?

The rest of the things that we ordered were really delicious.  The aloo palak, navrattan korma and bhindi masala were all tasty and spicy as ordered.  The naan was also pretty good.  We also got a free dessert that was tasty, but I have no idea what it's called.  It sort of looked like a tasty pile of dirt.
author: Linh N.

description:
As far as curry goes, the food here is spot on. Problem is they didn't give me any reason to come back. I feel as if I could get this food anywhere, and possibly cheaper. 

I didn't like the decor, and the TV was a bit loud for my dining experience. But I did enjoy the open kitchen, so I could watch my food being made. 

Service was reasonable and friendly. If I find myself in the neighborhood and wanting curry, I will go here. But I wouldn't make a special trip just to eat here.

Palak paneer was really good, as was the garlic naan. But rice isn't included, so you have to order a few servings to feed everyone at the table.
author: Vanessa B.

description: This is for carry-out. Ordered here several times and each time the food has been amazing. Chicken tikka masala is our go to and one of the best we have had in the city. We have had some lamb dishes as well and all are super flavorful with plenty of pieces of meat in each dish.  Food is always hot at pick up and friendly service.
author: Chris C.

description: Excellent service.  Great food.  Reasonable price.  The owners gave my kids delicious mango lassi and my husband aloo matar (not on menu) on the house plus free refreshing chai tea.  Kids had naan, roti, chicken tiki masala. We had lamb curry and saag paneer.  All wonderful. Not salty,  lots of spices, just the way it should be. We are big foodies.  Would definitely recommend this place.
author: Mu H.

description: Awful delivery service. We ordered from Grubhub and the food showed up 50 minutes late. It took seven tries to get someone on the phone to handle the situation. SF food delivery is severely lacking in quality in comparison to NYC and this just solidified that fact. The food is fine but at this point all I taste is bitterness. Try your luck somewhere else.
author: Monica L.

description:
I can't really say I'm an Indian food connoisseur, but most places make my favorite dish, Chicken Tikka Masala, pretty much the same. This place was no different, so I'll just say that the food was average.

The thing I'd like to warn about is that even though the entrees seem reasonably priced, your out-the-door cost will be higher than you'd think Indian food should cost. This is because this place actually charges you for both naan and rice, things I usually have with my CTM. When all was said and done, this place cost me a pretty penny while the food was just average.

We forgot to mention the Yelp ad, so we didn't get the slight discount. Maybe instead of that, you guys could offer some naan and rice as part of the entree.
author: John C.

description: This is the third time here. Samosa is better than vegetable pakora. All biryanies (if you'd prefer rice) and karahies (if you'd like to have something with sause) are delicious. Don't forget to drink your Indian style milk tea after your meal. Enjoy!
author: Turunc P.

description:
Came here for lunch and I left extremely pleased!  Prices were decent for lunch, but they could probably include naan or rice with the dish for lunch specials (even smaller portions would be acceptable). 

Service was very pleasant and the environment was welcoming, although I think they could do without the white table cloths and let the food do the upscaling (Maybe a reason they are not as busy as they should be for lunch).

The food was as good of indian cuisine as ive had in the city, with teh exception of Lahore Karahe or Shalimar.  Urban Curry's advantage over those places are that you can leave without reaking of indian food the rest of the day.  I had the Goat Karashi, which was absolutely perfect!  Spicy but actually with an aromatic spice flavor, rather than just heat.  The Garlci Naan was excellent as was the Eggplant and Mixed Veggie dishes I tried.  

Urban Curry will definitely be seeing much more of my business and as that of as many people as I can bring there in the near future.  Well done Urban Curry!

P.S.  If you are the owner and are reading this, I highly recommend having someone stand outside with some small samples to snag the high volume of lunch-goers heading down Broadway...you wont be disappointed.  ALSO....I am very disappointed in the lack of beer!  Get on that guys!  Especially in the drunkard neighborhood you're in.
author: Mike H.

description: We had a group of 24 people. At first things were going great. Our table was set and ready for us, and the staff gave us a friendly greeting. Surprisingly there were few other customers, and it was Saturday night. It took a long time to get our orders taken, and delivered. And it was at delivery that the confusion began. The servers walked around calling out the entree names as if we were at some sort of auction. All you have to do is number the chairs and match the entrees to deliver a more professional service! Everyone at the table complained that their food was uncomfortably spicy, even those who asked for mild. Some dishes got lost or mixed up. My coworker waited almost an hour for his dish.
author: Mark S.

description:
We may have found our newest indian spot.

BF brought me here last night. I guess they opened a few days ago. 

had appetizers, i ordered my usual tikka masala and bf ordered lamb. every dish was amazing. spicy but not overwhelming. the masala sauce was creamy and tomatoey. naan was fantastic. and... they were offering a discount on dinner.

fantastic! i'll be back.
author: laura f.

description:
Hubby and I tried Urban Curry, as we haven't had Indian food in quite some time.  As usual, we consulted Yelp to find the best-rated Indian joint in the North Beach area.  As we made the walk to Urban Curry, the first thing we noticed was that the joint really is sandwiched in the strip club district.  That made the quality of the place suspect--how good can Stripper Curry be?   

The decor of Urban Curry is a bit on the bland side--they could use some sprucing up, especially given the neon lights blasting on Broadway just outside its front doors.  The restaurant is quite large--offering spacious seating for parties big and small.  The host of this joint is what upped my rating from a 3 to a 4.  He was very friendly, but not in a fake way.

We enjoyed a few staple Indian items, including the Garlic Naan and Lamb Vindaloo.  The Vindaloo itself was quite spicy, causing me to inhale copious amounts of water and air in attempts to soothe my burning tongue.  In other words, that Vindaloo was awesome!  We also ordered an eggplant dish--we weren't too excited about that dish, but it was probably more a matter of taste than the dish being poorly prepared.

LIke I said, foodwise, this joint gets 3 stars.  But given the incredibly friendly service, I had to tack on another star.  If you're yearning for some Indian food, and you're in North Beach, Urban Curry is a great place to go (not to mention the prices are incredibly reasonable)!
author: Alexis N.

description: Excellent food,great price, and excellent service! Order their specialty dish, serve on a small pan.
author: Ray K.

description: We've been ordering delivery from Urban Curry for a long time and it's consistently excellent Indian food at a reasonable price. I have nothing but positive things to say about their food and service -- thank you!
author: Jill F.

description:
This place is really good... so, how come it's always empty? ...At least for dinner. I pass by this place every single day around 6:15pm, riding home from work on my bicycle, and it is always empty. When I've stopped in for dinner, staying til about 7:30, it stayed pretty empty the whole time. Two or three parties came in the entire time. 
Maybe they are popular for lunch? I hope so! What a waste if all the people working in the Financial District couldn't see past the throng of good eats on Kearney to make it out to Broadway. Ok, so it is a little far for a great portion of the FD, but for those of you working closer to Broadway, here is a good change of pace from your Chinese eateries and Vietnamese sandwiches. 

The mango lassi is very tasty here and it's pretty large too, which I appreciated. The curries are good, and I must say, I appreciate that they don't drown the curry in oil like other places. Though it is delicious (I have Shalimar in mind, and yes, I love them), sometimes you want to eat some good Indian curry without thinking you might keel over from clogged arteries. The oil deficit makes it just a tad less tasty than Shalimar, but believe me, you'll feel so much better in the hours after your meal. I'm a fan of the Aloo Palak (spinach and potatoes). All curries are $7-8.

The naan comes out pre-cut into 4 pieces. This is me being very picky, but I like it when one big naan comes out, all fluffy and ready to be torn apart by my hands. 

This place has a very clean feeling (it is relatively new), and the painted walls and other decor all makes it pretty nice-- without the nice restaurant prices. 

The guys here seem bored without customers. I see them hanging around outside until they see a customer walk inside. Go pay them a visit. They're nice.
author: Saori E.

description: Coming from an Indian (who's eaten in India): fantastic! Their Indo-Chinese dishes are right on point, and made me feel like home. I would highly recommend venturing out from the boring, typical CTM to Chilli Chicken (not as spicy as the name might suggest), Fried Rice, or Chow Mein. Their naan was perfectly made, and had that signature aroma. New favorite in the city!
author: Varun V.

description:
This place is a slightly better Naan n' Curry in a mecca for more expensive foods.

I had the lamb jalfrezi and my friend had the chicken korma. The korma's sauce was pretty good but the jalfrezi left something to be desired. We also had the rice, which was standard, and the garlic naan also felt like it was toned down from others I've had in the city.

I don't think I would go out of my way to come back because Lahore Karahi and Shalimar are not too far from me in the other direction of nob hill.
author: Anthony K.

description:
Came here with my cousins and sister for lunch today and it was pure yumminess.  We ordered the samosas, garlic naan, onion naan, paneer naan, chicken tikki masala, and the fish karahi.  Everything was delicious but my favorites were definitely the garlic naan and fish karahi.  We definitely cleaned the pot that the fish karahi came in...the sauce was so yummy!  I also had a mango lassi to wash it all down (basically tasted like a mango smoothie but with yogurt instead of ice cream).

Man, that was such a satisfying meal.  To my surprise, I didn't smell like Indian spices when I left, which made it that much better.

Note: We mentioned Yelp and was able to get 15% off (good until January 10th) so definitely go and check it out!  Once again, I owe it to Yelp for helping me find such a great spot (cuz god knows I would've never found Urban Curry on my own, haha) ~  thanks Yelp!
author: Katelynn L.

description: Except for the nan, the food was basic, but good.  The nan was jot fresh.  The ambiance sucks.
author: Ed R.

description: I've never really ate a lot of Indian food. I think this place is my first. My friends and I went for the $13 lunch buffet as oppose to ordering by dish. We were quickly seated in the many tables by the waitress as we entered. Like any other buffet, you get yourself up from the table and grab a plate to feast. I tried the noodles and curry chicken first. The noodles were fantastic. It was well seasoned and nothing to overwhelming in taste. The curry was delicious, but the chicken that came with the curry felt kind of dry and tasteless. It makes me think that the pieces of chicken were not cooked long enough with the curry. The cooked lettuce was just ok. The red-ish colored chicken drumsticks were good though. There's also fruits, veggies, milk tea, and probably more than I haven't mentioned. Other than that, I felt like the selection was very limited for a buffet. The service was great. The complimentary garlic naans that came with the meal were also enjoyable. One of my friends went crazy on those. The waitress was very attentive to the diners. Plates were being taken away whenever we were gone to hunt for more food. Our glass were always filled with water. Overall for the price and food, I say I'll be back if there aren't better Indian places in the city or just needing a quick fix with friends again. Maybe we'll go without doing lunch buffet next time.
author: Tony C.

description: Great food with reasonable prices. The aspect of this restaurant that makes it really outstanding is the service!  Very accommodating and patient.
author: Jenny G.

description: Service is HORRIBLE!!! Taking their sweet time. Food does not come out until an HOUR 1/2 later...SERIOUSLY!  I was a sitting duck waiting to be fed and I had to pay for parking. Much longer Than expected. =(
author: Julie B C.

description: The food was good, but the service was kind of weird. You pay before eating and nobody seems to really care, I had to take cutlery, plates, glass myself, and I wasn't even sure about it because the waiter didn't really show up. They offered tea though.
author: Jonathan V.

description: This has become my favorite inexpensive Indian restaurant in SF! I grew up in SF and have eaten numerous times at pretty much all the cheap Indian restaurants from TL, to North Beach, Richmond, and Sunset. Service is courteous, the atmosphere is warm and clean, and the food is good. I have not yet tried their buffet.
author: Kimberly D.

description: Yummy garlic naan in North Beach if you aren't feeling up for Italian. Good service, good food, good prices.
author: Madeline N.

description:
I will start off by saying I rarely eat indian food, by rarely I mean at most twice a year.  I walked down Broadway today and this huge Grand Opening sign caught my eye.  Being that it's new to the neighborhood, I ordered a good amount of food to get a feel for this place.  

What stood out the most was that the staff was very nice.  They seemed very gracious to their customers, something which is always refreshing to have in North Beach.  I was expecting a small take out place as I was opening the door but it's actually a pretty nice restaurant with very high ceilings.  The food was very well price and there was a lot to choose from.

As for the food, I'm sad to say it wasn't mind blowing.  I did order dishes that I had never ordered before so I don't have a strong basis for what it should and should not taste like.  I ordered the chicken vindaloo, vegetable korma, side of rice, onion chili salad and garlic naan.  I was shocked when the bill came out and saw how cheap the food was.  The portions were very good and the ingredients seemed very fresh, it just wasn't my cup of tea.  If you're in the neighborhood wanted to try something new, it's worth giving it a try!
author: hanh b.

description:
This is more of 3.5 stars but I'm rounding up just because the service was so darn good.  The place was dead at 8 on a Fri evening...  hmm a little concerning.  The food was quite good especially at near Naan n Curry prices (N&C = gross).  The chicken pakora wasn't good but eerything else was.  The chicken tikka masala and pan fried fish (forgot the name) were excellent.
The ambience is likely the biggest detractor... the restaurant just feels too big.  However the service was way above my expectations and 5-star worthy.  If you're looking for Indian fare in NB, it's worth checking out.
author: Toby C.

description:
An absolutely fantastic place. And easily one of the best places to have Indian/Pakistani food. The place is neat and the food is excellent. It gets really crowded but despite that the place is well managed. 
We tried their food delivery once (it was a bulk order for around 50 people) - that wasn't upto my expectation (and thats where they lost the 1 star) - And if I wouldnt have held that against them - then this would have been a 5-star review.
author: ani n.

description:
On a street that is mostly known for drunken debauchery -- which I have admittedly partaken in -- Urban Curry (and its next-door neighbor Vin Club, but that's for another review) deserve a whole lot of credit for rising above and delivering excellence.

After traversing the Tenderloin in hopes of finding a go-to Indian spot, I was disappointed with the results.  A six-month long treasure hunt nearly went fruitless until I stumbled across this place walking home from work last year.  

A number of things can destroy the experience at an Indian food restaurant, but Urban Curry avoids those pitfalls.  The meat quality is great, the currys are delicious, service is excellent, and complimentary chai tea follows a very filling meal.

I've had tandoori, biryani, chicken and lamb entrees, and never once felt let down.  My Indian routine typically rotates chicken tikka masala and lamb vindaloo, but this is a place that I know I can try something new without reservation.  Try the roghan josh - just avoid getting it too spicy, or it will burn for days.

My only concern with this restaurant is that it just doesn't fit in with the area and it's typically empty.  Most of my visits have been on Thursday nights for dinner, and it's rare to see more than six or seven tables filled up.  Really hope this place makes it.  It deserves customers that will remember eating their meals the next morning.

Urban Curry professional athlete comparison:  Steve Prefontaine
It's best-in-class, but you just hope it's not short-lived.  (Too soon?)
author: David M.

description: Solid Indian food at the edge of North Beach.  Excellent Indian is surprisingly difficult to find in the Bay Area, but Urban Curry does well--dishes are flavorful and spicy, not weak like many other places.  We ordered chicken tikka masala, aloo matar, and naan, and would recommend all of them.  Mango lassi was delicious though admittedly hard to get wrong.  Service took a little longer than I would have liked, atmosphere was nice and calm.  We used a Yelp deal and it worked seamlessly.
author: Charles W.

description: This place was not bad, though a little bland.  I'd rather be at Mehfil, but this location is closer to me.  I like that I didn't smell like curry afterwards.
author: Erika C.

description: Halal Meat is served here, based on Signs posted on window of Restaurant. Kind of in a seedy part of town, but near the financial district so stopped in here for lunch.  Tried the Lunch Buffet for $11.99 which was made up of about 10 dishes including Butter Chicken (a little watery), Palak Aloo (Spinach & potato which was pretty good), Keema, Lamb Curry, Tandoori Chicken, Mango Lassi (good stuff) and Kheer (rice pudding - which was good), fruits for dessert.  I also ordered Garlic Naan (was pretty good) and a Chai to go.  All the food was pretty good.  The interior decor is very nice and spacious.  Very friendly service.  Parking on street is difficult.
author: Irfan R.

description:
We work in this neighborhood, so the opening of a new restaurant is grounds for a team outing.  The 8 of us showed up for lunch promptly at noon, to be greeted by eager and slightly anxious staff.  We were showered with beverages of all sorts (I'm not sure if the free chai and soda are here to stay, or if they are promotional Grand Opening deals, but they are awesome.)  We outsourced our ordering the Indian in the group, who happily took over and ordered authentically in Hindi an array of vegetarian, chicken and lamb dishes, both spicy and mild, with rice and naan.

Slow-forward 45 minutes.  Our only complaint (and the reason for 4 stars instead of 5) was that the food was very slow to come out.  They apologized multiple times and the chef came out personally to explain that he had been stuck in traffic, and to check on how we had liked the food.  However, the food itself was excellent - tender, flavorful, spicy in all the right places.  I give them our whole-hearted endorsement, with the caveat that there may be some just-opened glitches to work through.
author: Kaz W.

description: I usually do take-out here (it is my default Indian restaurant), but I have also eaten here several times. It is suprisingly good (I say surprisingly because of its location by all the strip clubs). The restaurant has a new, friendly owner. The food is also good. I love the chicken boti. If you're going to eat in, I would recommend the buffet (believe it is $10 and really good). I am not sure if the buffet is every day, but they definitely have it on Fridays.
author: Rami R.

description: Good food, friendly staff but food was meh... many other better options
author: Jennifer T.

description:
The doorman at the Fairmont described Urban Curry as in a "Very Urban" part of town. I think he was worried that as guests we might not like the area. But after reading Yelp reviews we knew what to expect.

Ok as others have mentioned the place was almost empty, but I can understand that when you are next to a strip club! But what about the food! It was amazing. 

Inside the restaurant is very clean and tidy, nice decor comfy chairs and very attentive and friendly staff.

We had Paneer Pakoras to start whicih were fantastic, followed by a Chicken Tikka Masala and a Roghan Josh, with a side order of Lacha Paratha. On advice of other reviews I didn't go for the spicy option for my first time. The waiter said it was pretty hot if I chose that. Also had a  Mango Lassi also on advice from other yelpers. 

Also for you low carbers the Lacha Paratha is a whole wheat bread which is at least keeping with low carb diet in idea!

Everything was phenomenal, this was seriously one of the best Indian meals I had ever had. Not only that we mentioned that we found him on yelp and got the 15% discount!

Can you give 6 stars? This place is a hidden gem!
author: Mark T.

description:
My God am I glad this place opened.  I've been to a few Indian places near my work and this place blew them all out of the water.  They actually serve you unlike Naan and Curry.  Great food.  They just opened and I've already brought friends and coworkers who in turn brought their friends and coworkers, etc.  

Great atmosphere, hookahs available, and soon to have a liquor license.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.
author: Eric R.

description:
Very nice service, complementary Chai Tea!  

Went for lunch, Chicken Tiki was good, not outstanding, good Naan.  What I really like was the Karahies.  Meat or fish served in a traditional pan. Must try! 

Not as pricy as Tandori Mahal and much better service with better ambiance/food than Nann & Curry.  Check it out.
author: Mitch F.

description:
Went here for my birthday and this place is pretty good! I love the naan, it's delicious compared to my Trader Joe's naan. It took awhile for the food to come, but I'm guessing its because they just opened for dinner. 

Aside from that, if I never yelped this place I probably wouldn't know that there's food around there. For the longest time, I thought it was all strip joints!! Glad I found this place and definitely will come back.
author: Nancy L.

description:
This is my new go-to for delivery Indian. Roghan Josh, karahies, most vegetarian curries are fantastic, and the best Indian delivery I've had in the city. (Doesn't beat a trip to Shalimar etc., but I'm at home and lazy.)

The chicken boti was so dreadful I didn't believe it came from the same restaurant, but the other curries are so amazing I'm leaving it at four stars. Go for the curries, skip the tandoor and biryani for now, be happy.
author: Matt F.

description: feel like i need to give this place a bump. had another great meal there. you all have to get the karahi! does everyone only eat chicken tikka masala?? also had the tandoori fish which was delicious. recommend not ordering delivery through a third party because yes, it is extremely unreliable.
author: Melissa T.

description: We had the dinner buffet which was a quick and easy fix.  It cured our craving for curry that night. The wait staff is very hands off, we had to get our own water from the wait station and grab a can soda out of the cooler.  If we wanted anything off of the menu we would have had to go get someone to order.  It is set up like a restaurant, not an ordering line, so I felt a bit confused.
author: Kristen F.

description: Craving some Indian food the other night and wanted to try some place new. Decided on Urban Curry because you can get a restaurant.com coupon for here. Had the Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Vindaloo. Both excellent and I enjoyed the spiciness. Also got an appetizer and a salad. With the coupon the whole bill came out to $17 bucks including tax and tip. Can't beat that anywhere else!
author: Justin J.

description: amazing service, kind peeps serving some serious food. also pro wrestling was on tonight so that helped
author: Vicky N.

description: We had Aloo Gobi, chicken tikka masala, palaak paneer and a lamb dish.  All of it was so good, especially the palaak paneer.  The host was really nice as well!
author: Jason H.

description: It was good Indian food.  Funny that it's in North Beach.  I'll go back if I'm in the area again.  Great service.
author: Sport G.

description: I always think of Urban Curry when I'm craving for indian food but for the past 5 times I've ordered from here, I have been let down. I always order the Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Vindaloo. I could say that this place makes the best curry in SF before but not anymore. I wonder if they have changed chefs because the curry is never consistent anymore. Sometimes its spicier, sometimes it watery, and sometimes its so bland. I wonder what went wrong? I hope that they do read this and fix the curry so I can start ordering from them again. No where is better than here so PLEASE FIX IT!!! Thank you and I will write a new review.
author: Malisa W.

description:
review of delivery. 

yelp fail.  4 star average, really?  

the good: great website, easy ordering, great service.
the bad:food relatively bland, curry dishes over priced

i ordered
- garlic naan
- tandoori chicken (leg)
- basmati rice
- chicken tikka masala (medium spice)
- rogan josh

$30 without tip.  the curry dishes (the chicken tikka and rogan josh) came in really small tupperware.  as in, barely enough for a meal.  i'd estimate it was a cup and a half of food, maybe 2, mostly sauce.  they did NOT feel like $8 or $9 worth of food.  what should've been a feast was barely 2 meals for me.

then there's the quality of the food
- naan - completely nondescript.  tastes like store-bought naan with butter and garlic on top.  the best naan has charred the bread just enough to make some bits crispy.  this was too thick.
- tandoori chicken - this was probably the best thing.  it was a thigh and maybe a third of a drumstick.  reasonably well seasoned, but by no means outstanding tandoori
- rice - it's rice.
- chicken tikka masala - watery sauce.  it was actually very sweet, which just didn't taste right.  chicken tasted like it had been tossed in after and not cooked in the sauce.  this just didn't taste good
- rogan josh - this was better, but still, very watery sauce, and relatively unflavorful

would i order again? i probably would, to try their other dishes.  the convenience and friendly service are appreciated.
author: T L.

description: Solid 4 star lunch place.  I thought the staff was attentive and the food was really good, too.  I would be back here more often if it wasn't so far from my work.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Food: Tasty, fresh, semi-spicy and rich.  It wasn't greasy and oily like a lot of Indian joints in the area. 

Service: The waitress was sweet, friendly and quick.  She didn't even care that I didn't tip.  She just smiled and said good bye.

Atmosphere: It's spacious and cool, definitely not stuffy or formal.

Price:  At about $9 an entree, you don't get that much food.
author: Mack D.

description:
The food here is delicious.  I had the paneer tikki masala and it was one of the best that I have had.  We also had the garbanzo beans (I can't remember the name- I think it was Chorley.)  It was recommended by the waiter and it did not disappoint.   

The only item that was so-so was the samosa.  I would skip it next time.

The service was good. No problems at all. (Although I am annoyed that I forgot to mention Yelp to get my discount. Ugh.)
author: J D.

description: I've been really hanging out for some good Indian so when I stumbled upon this place on Yelp I was eager to check it out. Decor is a bit tired but that's completely excusable given its a no frills restaurant. Food was ok but a bit lacklustre- samosa was clearly from a packet. Also, travelling alone presents some real difficulties when dining out so I brought my laptop with me to send some emails during dinner. When I asked about the wifi the waitress looked at me like I'd just asked here for one of her kidneys and told me I was wrong, they don't advertise free wifi. Star off!
author: Alex S.

description:
Delicious food, handsome staff, spacious and elegant interior, quality food at reasonable prices, convenient location. 

My review is for to-go/take-out orders only:

Service:
The gentleman who took my take-out order helpfully guided me to a meal option that suits my dietary needs of the day. He was also very cute :-) (same guy on the phone as at the cash register), as was the older gentleman who had my to-go order ready for me.

Please offer Lunch Specials, please! :
The restaurant would make more lunch $$ if it offered a few "Lunch Specials." ($5-10, complete with rice, chicken/seafood, and vegetable. Extras like raita and naan can cost extra."

Serving containers:
Also, it would be more convenient for "workers who grab lunch and run" if Urban Curry served the proposed Lunch Specials in "two-sides and a main"-type to-go containers. They put my chicken tandoori breast (delicious!) in a flimsy cardboard "french fry" trough, which stressed from the chicken's heat and juices, quickly disintegrated in my hands.

Cutlery :
The spork they included with my takeout was cute, but also very flimsy. The chicken tandoori breast was very tender and juicy, but the spork was not up to the task of feeding me. And so I ate with my fingers, BBQ-style.
author: Carrot C.

description: Terrible, tasteless, watery food.  AND, they promissed to bring chutney with my order and did not.  Worse part, I tipped 20 percent when they delivered.  Stupid me!
author: Marina F.

description: Food was ok, ordered malai paneer and kadai paneer, malai paneer was nothing special and kadai paneer was definately something different and good. It was spicy as well. But their free chai was very poor. It was tasting as if the milk has burnt out. 3 stars for me..
author: Keyur P.

description: We were visiting the city from out of town and we were craving some Indian....we walked by Urban Curry and read the great reviews so decided to try it. It was delicious! The Indian Chef did not disappoint on the chicken Tikka Masala, one of our favorite Indian dishes. The chicken and sauce were to die for, our standards have gone up higher. Also the staff was very nice, especially the manager
author: Ray H.

description: Awesome Indian restaurant, great food! Everything was made fresh and HOT and SPICY! We ordered the chicken tiki masala, chicken biryani and another plate with lamb, it was mouth watering and delicious. Definitely go again and get their Yelp deal!
author: Angela H.

description: Urban Curry is delicious!  Their food is authentic.  Their portion sizes are satisfying and the service is excellent.  I love to grab take out on my way home from work sometimes and I am never disappointed.  I am so happy to have found Urban Curry.  Everything I've tasted I have been very happy with and I've tasted many of the dishes.  Go here!
author: Allison M.

description: Customer service was great and the food was yummy (although we should have ordered it on the spicy side because medium didn't cut it). The chicken was moist and I really enjoyed the goat curry. Also the price was reasonable :)
author: Jimmy W.

description:
My sister & I were in Chinatown and we got a hankering for Indian food. I looked up nearby restaurants on Yelp and noticed that this place had great reviews, so we decided to check it out. We're so glad we did!

We were part of the really early dinner crowd (we got there around 5:30 and were the only patrons for a while) but it is such a beautiful building that we didn't mind at all. I've broken down my review into 4 categories below.

1) Food: This was honestly the best Indian meal I have eaten in a few years. The vegetable pakoras were just right with good yoghurt sauces on the side. The masala sauce in my chicken dish was creamy with just the right combination of spices, and the chicken was tender. My sister had the chicken vindaloo, which was spicy enough to give off a great taste (and give her the sniffles) without overpowering the dish. The naan and roti were ample and warm -a perfect compliment to our meals. Finally, the rice pudding was awesome! Not to sweet or smooth (horrible mistakes when it comes to rice pudding) it was a refreshing way to cleanse our palates at the end of the meal.

2) Service: The service here is first rate! Granted we were alone in the restaurant for part of the meal, but our waitress was really on top of the ball. She didn't hover (I hate helicopter servers), but she did make sure to eyeball us every few minutes to make sure we had everything we needed. I don't think I ever saw my water glass go down past the halfway mark. The owner also came out at the end of our meal to introduce himself and ask after our dining experience.

3) Price: I really think this place should be categorized as a $ place as rather than a $$ place. My sister and I had a Chai tea, an appetizer, 2 chicken entrees, 2 bread dishes, 1 side of rice, and 2 rice puddings for under $25 with tax. This was dinner, not lunch! The portions were really huge- 3 people could definitely have eating this meal and left the table full. Plus the Chai tea and the rice puddings were on the house! 

4) Miscellaneous: They have an open kitchen, which I LOVE. You can see people cooking your dishes from pretty much anywhere on the floor. The restrooms were also very clean, and the whole restaurant was casually elegant.

Go to Urban Curry- you won't regret it! I will definitely be back with friends!
author: moni b.

description: This place has nice decor, good food, and great service. Raita is complementary, which I love because it calms a spicy dish. We had the goat biryani and chicken vindaloo. There wasn't very much meat in the biryani but it had a good taste. The servers were great at checking in and making sure that water was plentiful. And the hosts dropped by to check on the food as well, which was great. The place is surrounded by topless bars which is kind of funny, but it's definitely worth going too!
author: Anony M.

description:
Ideally I'd love to give this place a 4.5, but I'll settle for 4. 

I ordered for delivery tonight, online. What took away from the star rating was that it took 1.5 hours to get the food. The fact that the delivery guy was apologetic and refused to take the tip (which I insisted he did anyways) made up for that more or less.

Now on to the food. Hubby and I ordered garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, samosa, basmati rice, baingham bartha, and  lamb vindaloo. OMFG!!! It smells awesome!!! You can smell every spice in there. The chicken and lamb were ordered "hot", and yeah, my stomach will hate me for it. You can smell the pepper in it, and you can definately taste it. 

Food is great, and I am typing this up before I go into a food coma. Next time though I think I'll call them to order food.
author: Katia T.

description: Delicious and cheap eats. Love the BYOB. I love indian food any time of day but particularly for lunch if I'm hungover or for late night eats. This place has a buffet on Friday and Saturday nights til 3am (or some crazy hour). How ridiculous is that! I had never had karahi before but learned about it being a signature pakistani dish. Since we had the scoutmob deal we went to town and feasted. Lamb karahi, okra, chicken tikka masala, veggie biriyani and garlic naan. I would definitely go the karahi and veggie biriyani again.  You know an ethinc restaurant is legit when people of that nationality are eating there and this is such a place!
author: Jessica H.

description:
I took my curry-mad boyfriend to San Fran for a long weekend and, after reading the reviews for this place, thought it would make a great place for dinner. Think again. All I can say is: Have any of these other reviewers eaten curry before?

The food came out way too fast, for one. It had clearly just been reheated. We started with samosas, which were flavourless and way too oily. Then we had chicken tikka masala, palak paneer and vege curry (so, we were starving and looking forward to the food). All tasted about the same as the $6 lunch buffet curry house near my office. Bland, reheated, urgh.  The service was terrible, although the waiter did seem to be run off his feet.

We left the food and the restaurant, me with a sad face. I really wanted to treat my boyfriend and the whole thing was a huge disappointment. Don't do it.
author: Anna F.

description: um i am so very disappointed i searched yelp saw 4 stars got food for delivery, chicken beryani is so tasteless!!!! palak paneer is so greasy and again tasteless, the only good thing was the mango laassi and that's it  waste of money
author: Sabad M.

description: Good, solid Indian Food.  The owners are cool too. Worth the trip over to NB.
author: A S.

description: I was impressed with the service above all. The lamb tikka was totally awesome. Veggie dishes were solid. Good appetizers and the mango lassi was off the hook. Not much in the beer selection section. Nice bathrooms, simple decor - probably wouldn't take a first date, but I'd def go back with a group or a friend or gf.
author: Jordan S.

description: Best Indian food near my office, great prices, really fast service, and a very yummy vegetarian selection.
author: Aaron S.

description:
First time having Indian food. I do not remember what I had, a chicken plate with thick cheesy red sauce. my friends had other selections, I do have to say it was a pretty good experience, the service was prompt although our server wasn't helpful with us new timers explaining what the flavor and food was like.

bread was good but a little burnt.

When you ask for spicy it's super spicy, my friends broke a sweat so be warned!
author: Sarah C.

description: Aside from being in an interesting part of San Francisco, this place serves really good Indian food. I had the Lamb Tikka Marsala, Fish Vandaloo, Krahi, Coconut Curry, Roti and some Naan and definitely love every single plate (although I must say be careful when you tell them you want your curry hot because they really mean HOT and SPICY). I love how clean and simple the restaurant is. Also thought their choice of music was pretty good, usually modern Indian pop, which I think would be the Indian version of Justin Bieber. Anyway, definitely will return to Urban Curry again.
author: Polly L.

description: The spices and flavors were off the mark. On top of that, the service was slow (we were only the second seated table in the restaurant), and the portions small. Two out of three desserts were not available at 6PM in the evening. A bust all the way around. The hunt for good Indian in SF continues....
author: Eric M.

description: 3.5 stars. If you've got urban in your name you really need an in house rapper...that aside I did have some good food. The Lamb Karahi was quite good, i've never had it before but thaks to the yelpers before me on the recommendation. The chai tea and naan were also good. Now i'm a Chicken Tikka Masala slut...for real i'm back home and eating some now and i've gotta say their is super meh. Like most store based sauces it is very tomato based. That aside, great service and a nice yelp check in special. Just remember, don't ever go full retard and don't go for the CTM here.
author: David P.

description: Excellent service and good food. Had the Buffet on Friday, lots of variety.
author: K Z.

description: Really tasty lunch buffet.  The staff was super nice, and accommodating.
author: Mike W.

description: I had dinner here last night for the second time and I think this is my favorite Indian food place I've found in the city so far.  I know it's the quintessential white-person Indian food but their chicken tikka masala is absolutely delicious.  The naan is perfectly cooked, just the right combination of doughy and crispy.  They offer complimentary chai with dinner, which I am a big fan of, and they make a yummy mango lassi.  The prices are reasonable, the service is friendly, overall a great dinner.
author: Heather D.

description: This place is unexpectedly delicious.  I don't know what but we just ducked into this place and I thought - eh, this won't be that great. The decor is a bit weird. But the food was FANTASTIC.  I could NOT stop eating, and kind of overate, actually.  I'd give it a 4.5, and would def return.
author: Alph G.

description: Just tried their Chicken Karahi and it was soooooo good....The best I've eaten in the whole of San Francisco.....This restaurant beats any other India rest. hands down...just no competition whatsoever....Their Chef is authentic and the food is as good as you can get in India or Pak.....just the best....5 stars without a doubt...:)
author: Nilesh J.

description: I eat curry all the time, this place is way over rated, this place has a lot of potential though.  The restaurant is very nice and looks new, but nothing great way over rated, chicken was way to dry  Shalimar is 10x better anyday.   My gf and I eat tikka masala several times a week n this place is just bland and lacking flavor I can see all you people giving it 4-5 stars but you are obviously not into good tikka cuz this place is on the bottom of my list! The white yogurt tasted old n too sour.  I pay half the price at naan n curry and get way more food  and it taste better sorry urban I will not come back very disappointented.  A little too expensive as well my naan which I pay $1 everywhere for was 2 here and it was paper thin and hard as a cracker, very unsatisfying,  this place needs improvement!
author: Chris B.

description:
The food was excellent. Tasty curries, light and fluffy naan. The two or three stars off is all because of the service.

Hey you - Mr. manager guy in the glasses standing around looking important and ignoring everything - while you're pretending you're too special to do any work, things in your restaurant went to Inept status. 

Your lone waitress was overworked by the large parties there for lunch, and you ran out of rice. We sat and waited 45 minutes for our rice. It hadn't arrived by the time we finished our lunch, so we canceled it and away we went.

How on earth do you let your Pakistani restaurant run out of rice? And continue to be out of rice for the course of your customer's lunches?

Incompetence. Ineptness. 

We won't be back.
author: Mark S.

description:
solid indian spot in north beach surely beats the pants off of naan n' curry.

went here for a team lunch and we got to try a variety of different dishes.  the lows were typical staple items like naan and chicken tikka masala.  after those 2 disappointments it could be easy to blow off this place but where the strengths lie are the a-typical dishes.  the biryanis and karahis are the highlights and the tandoori items.  the fish and and seekh kabab karahis were stellar along with the veggie and lamb biryanis.  the lamb seekh kabab on its own was pretty darn good too.  the keema naan was definitely a lot better than a it's plain counterpart.

another thing to point out is the price.  this is a very affordable restaurant and it's good to see that because of that there isn't a lack of quality.  too bad they don't deliver.
author: Swarup B.

description: I enjoyed my meal and experience at Urban Curry on a quiet Tuesday night. The Lamb Karahi was fantastic (and a recommendation from my server!). I tried the Chicken Tikka Masala, and it wasn't worth purchasing. Definitely get some Naan, and you'll have a great meal.
author: Ryan G.

description: Great place love the lamb vindaloo and the fish curry. Over all a great experience the service was also excellent and attentive.
author: John N.

description: i ordered for delivery and with noisy bs in the background... i barely could  make out the guy say "we are not delevering today" ok awesome this place  is obviously sht
author: Andy H.

description: The food was great and super friendly customer service. Definately, will come back :)
author: nicolle t.

description:
we had a big lunch outing here a couple weeks back and although i was initially excited about checking out the vast menu, i was more than a bit disappointed at how disorganized the service was. sure, it's tough serving big groups so our food will undoubtedly take longer to prepare, but not knowing how many rices vs. naans and not adjusting the heat of dishes as we had asked? didn't someone write these things down when they were taking our orders?

the food was only okay as well... nothing really made me jump out of my seat, so to say, though it was nice to have fish tikka masala instead of the usual chicken or paneer. that disorganized first impression just really put a damper on my day, so it's hard to enjoy any meal with that in mind. i might give it another try, but definitely not when the restaurant is busy!
author: Andrey C.

description: Chicken Karahi!!!!! That was some good Indian food. Nice atmosphere. Helpful wait staff.. what more can you ask for. Decided to by pass Chicken Tikka Masala for once and try something new. Went for the Chicken Karahi, Aloo ghobi, rice and garlic naan for two people. Perfect amount of food for two good eaters. Can't wait to go back and eat there  again!
author: B. C.

description: Pretty good  food, I could see this being a very popular everyday type of spot. It isn't fine dining, and it isn't super cheap. Good food, good service, good prices...would recommend!
author: Chris S.

description: I don't understand where all the four- and five-star reviews for this place are coming from. Based on one meal there, I don't think this place is anything other than another Naan N Curry kinda spot: generic food served in relatively modest portions. One dish, a chicken in a tomato-based sauce, tasted like sterno (still had the taste in my mouth the next day). Another, a spinach dish with potatoes, was undercooked. The naan was more like raw pizza dough than naan, and the rice tasted like it had been made in a very large batch a day or two earlier.
author: OuterLands X.

description: Very mediocre tasting naan and lamb curry.  Mango lassi was very good though. Very reasonable prices..
author: Matt B.

description: This plae was yummy but I can't believe no one on yelp posted that it's BYOB. The garlic naan was amazing. I eat Indian food all the time and it was very good. The kema naan also good, a naan stuffed with spicy chicken. My chicken tika was average. It tasted good but needed a little mote spice. Not heat spice but flavor spices. My husband got the lamb tika which actually tasted more flavorful than mine. All in all a good meal but don't forget to BYOB
author: Jessica S.

description: Discovered UC about a month ago, and have eaten there three times now. Simply, some of the dishes here are the best we have tasted outside India (although I've never been to Pakistan). Usually have vegetarian and everything is fresh and lively. I really like that they didn't ask us "how spicey do you want it". Just leave it to the chef, and how the dish -should- be cooked. The paratha is exceptional.
author: David K.

description: You may notice that the majority of my reviews are five star. This is not because I'm a particularly nice guy, but because I vet stuff before shelling out any $. And so it was with Urban Curry - only after a couple of recommendations from my real, live, Fremont living, IT working Indian/Pak friends did I venture to UC. And it didn't disappoint - great prices, big portions, high quality ingredients (lamb had almost no fat or bone), very friendly staff, and a nice environment. Well worth your rupees.
author: Nick C.

description: I would give this place 0 stars if I could! Folks wanting good Indian food, do your self a favor and stay away. The curries are so bland and the rest is so horrible- you dont want to eat here!
author: Ratna K.

description: Five stars for being nice! I was walking to work and needed some steamed rice to go with leftovers and I stumbled upon Urban Curry. Got some rice and they didn't charge me a penny! I will be going here to eat soon!
author: Vivek S.

description: The new owner was super friendly and generously offered me a cup of chai while I waited for my to-go order. I had the chicken tikka masala and it was Delicious, the best I've had in a long time. I'll definitely be back!
author: Carrie L.

description: Not authentic. The only thing that tasted good was the chicken tika and naan, so if thats all you're getting, you mine as well save your money and get it from trader joes. The chicken beryani rice and samosa was off and not up to par when it comes to authenticity. We were going to naan n curry, but the reviews for yelp* tricked us. (Again).
author: Queen S.

description: Lamb curry was flavorful, everything very fresh and tasty. Most importantly, the service was excellent.
author: Adam J.

description:
Had food delivered:

Chicken Tikka Masala - OK - sauce seemed more like creamy tomato pasta rather than masala sauce 
Lamb Biryani - meat was dry and the rice was bland
Ssag paneer - spinach was just mush, too spicy and without any of the delicacy of flavors it should have

The search for good Indian in SF goes on.....!
author: Maryann M.

description: I've been to all the curry shops in the area and this is by far my favorite.  The service was awesome.  All the food was super tasty and the meat was particularly tender.  Medium spicy was exactly that, medium.  The garlic naan was soft and delicious, not overpoweringly garlicy.  Copious free tea and water refills.  Nice decor, subtle music, and very clean.  I'll be back for sure.
author: Mikey P.

description: I really,really have to say that this is this best Indian I have had in this city. Went back last night and had the Malai Kofta which was outstanding. So creamy and perfect amount of spiciness for me. The Naan is so chewy and golden, perfection! I crave this place and can't wait to go back. The ultimate North Beach find!
author: Kelley D.

description:
yeah. i would go back again. i had the chicken tikka masala for lunch just now. good stuff, the chicken wasn't dry as i had feared from other reviews. staff was courteous and attentive. chai on the house and entertainment for waiting. pretty clean place...and it didn't have a strong curry smell. 

not sure about the man feeding his pet parrot inside the establishment...
author: Eric R.

description: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in SF. It's easy to overlook, as it's sandwiched between strip clubs on Broadway, but it's well worth braving the sketchy folks who line the street. I've yet to bring anyone here who hasn't raved about it or rushed back on their own -- the food is fresh, well spiced, reasonably priced, and the owners/managers/waitstaff couldn't be nicer. The chicken tikka masala is, in a word, awesome. As is everything on the menu, really.
author: Melissa H.

description: I have to generally agree with the above reviews. Food was great...I got completely stuffed for about $13. The wait staff was impeccable....friendly, proffessional, (but not faking it). Typically when trying a new place I get my standard. For Indian/Curry its Tikka Masala and Garlic Naan. Both were perfect portions...and delicious. I then usually order ont thing outside of the norm....this time I got the cucumber salad. Simple yet brilliant. The chai wasnt bad either. Great place...ill be going back.
author: Clayton D.

description: I didn't think this restaurant was very good. I eat Indian food several times a week, I love it, so I think I'm a fair judge. First off we found the waiter to be extremely condescending, which put us on edge. Our dishes were the vegetable biryani (I'm still waiting on the vegetables.. but plenty of rice) and the chicken karahi. Both dishes were over the top spicy, almost inedible. The naan was very bland and had almost none of the characteristic oven flavor you expect from naan. I would probably try this place again if I was in the neighborhood, but I would not go out of my way.
author: jen w.

description: It's a shame this place calls itself an Indian/Pakistan place. And it's an even bigger shame that my fellow Yelpers have given this place a good review. I agree with the review below: my boyfriend and I also left this place greatly disappointed. We are visiting San Francisco and were excited to try some San Fran Indian food, expecting it to be slightly different but yet yummy. Boy were we wrong. Everything was a huge disappointment, from the karahi chicken the waiter recommended to the biryani. We each ordered a mango lassi and it tasted exactly like the $4 ones I get at Indian fast food restaurant Tawaa. This is was definitely not a good choice for two out of towners looking for a good meal...
author: Ivonne M.

description: Had the Chicken Karahi and thought it was an exceptional dish, very flavorful and went great with Garlic Naan.  The Karahi is a boneless chicken sauteed with tomatoes, herbs and spices in a traditional pan.
author: Daniel T.

description:
Excellent food
Great prices
Very friendly and attentive staff
Clean, nicely decorated space.

So happy it's a hop, skip and a jump from work!

Best Tikka Masala in the city.
author: BH ..

description: Definitely a place to go for great Indian food!  Went here twice and both times a hit!  Food takes awhile to get, but well worth it as it is made fresh for you!  Will be back!
author: Joseph C.

description: It was alright, the tikka masla smelled and tasted a little like chef boyarde but my husbands was better.  Still we sadly will not be returning here.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I honestly don't know much about Indian food as far as what makes it authentic.  But this place is the BOMB! Good portions to feed two, fresh taste & smell and not to mention cheap prices.  Nice ambiance for a date ;)
author: Misty B.

description:
So in my never ending quest to find the perfect Tika masalla (so I spelled it wrong.. what are you going to do, give me a D-) I eagerly anticipated the opening of Urban Curry. I work near there and walked by it the month before they opened with anticipation and questions like:
- What will their Tika M. be like and will it like me?
- Do they take credit cards with questionable credit?
- Is it gonna be high-end or a dive with rat traps
- Do they give locals discounts to local worker bees (other than the strippers two doors down)?
So my fellow yelpers I have nothing but good things to say. The Tika was all I dreamed of and more. The sauce was perfecto. Creamy and not to spicy. The chicken was tender and not dry like some places (ie naan and currry) and the prices reasonable. The place is a definite step up from the before mentioned dive but not too classy where you think a collared shirt is in order. The guys that work there are super interested in dialing it all in and asked me multiple times how it was. At the end the main guy came and sat down and basically said make yourself at home. We also chatted about the meal, the naan and life in general. At the end of it all I felt almost like bearing my sole and telling him about my secret addiction to Tika masala and how I had to go through a 12 step program back in the 80's... but then i thought i should end this rant and just say GO! You'll love it.
author: Lindonesia S.

description: I would agree the food is good, but the home delivery service is terrible.  I ordered our evening meal on line and was quoted a delivery of 45 minutes.  An hour and 20 minutes later I called the restaurant and with great difficulty got the person to look up my order.  It was cancelled because they did not have a driver and no one called me to tell me my meal was never coming.   I called Kennedy's Irish Pub on Columbus and they delivered lovely Indian cuisine in 25 minutes.
author: Michael L.

description: I love chicken tikka masala! I have heard good things about this place so I decided to order take out from Urban Curry this evening. Got to love a carb filled dinner... aka naan and rice with chicken tikka masala! The food was fabulous and the service was very fast! Also- I am pretty sure this place has a good health rating unlike some of the other cheap Indian food places I have been taken to! Thank goodness for cheap Indian food and a grade A health rating! I don't think cheap and grade A health rating exist in this city- but I was wrong! I think Urban Curry fits this! Besides take out- it would be a cute place for a date! Very cute restaurant! I will definitely be coming back here for some good Indian food!!!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Very tasty indian food, very very affordable for the amount and quality of food that you get. The food is very well seasoned and doesn't depend on just spiciness for flavor. Don't get me wrong I loveeee spicy foods and one of the things I got was an extra spicy lamb vindaloo which was actually super spicy but I was still able to discern the spices in the vindaloo through the heat, love it. The ambiance and decor is really nice and the tables are sufficiently large and spacey. The waiter was friendly and efficient.
author: Anine Y.

description: Great value and tasty food!! I stopped in randomly on the way home one night and was pleasantly surprised at the food. The staff is very attentive and friendly. Overall, a great experience!
author: Brandon U.

description: We ate dinner here on a Sunday night when places on our "to do list" had waits of 45 minutes to an hour. We love Indian food and saw that there was definitely no wait here (only two other occupied tables) and the kiddos were tired and hungry. We ordered the veg pakora, but alas, they were out so we opted for samosas. We also ordered garlic naan, palak paneer, basmati rice, and chicken tikka masala. All were delicious with a few minor suggestions. The samosas were a bit dry (potato AND rice filling) and so was the chicken in the tikka masala. I'm not a fan of white meat in such dishes as dark meat is juicier. The garlic naan was the truth. This is the way it should always be. The kids liked it too. They were able to accommodate our need for mild food and were very patient with my rice throwing two year old. Go here.
author: Celia A.

description: I came here after seeing Lahore Karahi and Shalimar mentioned in the same review. While I still have my allegiances, Urban Curry was great. Good service, nice decor, plenty of flavor.
author: Jordan K.

description: I was just lamenting that there was no good Indian lunch food on Polk after spending $12 on an unnamed place nearby that was not great, and was happy to find Urban Curry after trying their food a couple weeks ago and it was great! It may be a few blocks further through the tunnel, but it's worth it. I took away the vegetable curry, potato bread, and some rice. I'm SO happy to see that they can now deliver to me at my shop on Polk, I'm definitely going to take them up on this service, as I can't get away from work for very long during the day. See you soon Urban Curry!
author: Michelle H.

description: I just went out to dinner here tonight the food was amazing, the service was friendly, and we were served pretty quickly. All over a great experience!
author: Corey D.

description: My sister & I had dinner here last Friday (her review is under moni b. below) and I loved this place so much. Every dish & course was fantastic; nothing was off the mark at all. I have had a lot of chicken tikka masala in my day, but this creamy version was a cut above. The wait staff was very attentive, and the restaurant itself was very beautiful. I'm already planning a trip back this Saturday!
author: J B.

description: Best lamb curry I've ever had in my life. Absolutely wonderful. The garlic naan was awesome. The serving sizes were exceptional. The price was great, especially with the yelp discount. Huge mango lassi for a decent price. The atmosphere is pretty typical Indian kitsch but the very friendly staff makes up for it. I would highly recommend it to any fans of Indian Cuisine.
author: Vincent V.

description:
Good food, good service, nice atmosphere, and great prices. My friend and I spent $16 each (tax and tip inc.), and had two meals' worth of food left over. The garlic naan was delicious. I also enjoyed the bhindi masala and the chicken boti. Plus, you get free chai at the end of the meal! I would happily go back here.

My only complaint: what was up with the lighting in the bathroom? The dim, orange light made me feel like I was in a vampire nightclub (a la "Blade," I guess). Weird.
author: Mike B.

description: My first time ordering out at Urban Curry base on the reviews on Yelp. I've had their Prawn Vindaloo, Chicken Tikka Masala, and Palak Paneer all three dishes were spicy flavored! next time I'll ask for medium spice and maybe one dish of spicy... There Mango Lassi, Onion and Garlic Naan was good as well.
author: Jossy S.

description:
