We ordered Karahi Paneer. It is not on the menu but they will make it if you ask them. We have also tried Lahori Chole and Malai Kofta. All three dishes were very good. Their Roti is also pretty good.
They are friendly and service is good.
author: V J.

description: This was great!  The Papadum was crispy and obviously just done, the 3 different lamb dishes were all super tasty with tender and fallapart lamb, the Aloo Gobhi was totally different that usual but superb.  The Mango Lassi were awesome.  To top it all off, they delivered it!  It was great.  I will totally eat there again.
author: Mark O.

description: I stop by here all the time for takeout on my way home from work. Always delicious and usually ready when I call ahead on my way out the office door. If it's not ready they give you chai while you wait. Solid food, clean space, nice staff.
author: newintown k.

description: Our meal was excellent! The food was a delicious; the service was excellent. Thank you, Urban Curry, for a great evening!
author: Eva S.

description: Great location!  My first Indian dining experience and the staff at Urban Curry were wonderful.  I don't have anything to compare it to, but the food was amazing in my opinion.  The noor bread was good, I had the seafood curry and the shrimp was huge!  The atmosphere felt was very authentic and I will definitely visit again!
author: Marissa P.

description: For the price, this is very good Indian food. The Onion naan and chicken tikke masala are the best.
author: Kent L.

description: Very nice Indian resturant. Nice people and good food
author: Nav T.

description:
this place just opened a couple weeks ago and i thought i'd give it a try today. i was very very very impressed. 

the staff was extremely friendly and very hospitable. i got a 10% discount just for living nearby and trying them out. 

the food is incredibly flavorful. i ordered a few things:

1) chicken tikka masala - excellent. spicy and flavorful. also good amount of meat/sauce ratio. very filling
2) sag paneer - also very good. the cheese cubes they used were generous in size and the spinach was mild and savory.
3) samosas- these were great. the outside texture was crispy when you first bite in, then turns delightfully chewy as your teeth sink in deeper. 
4) naan - good quality naan. its hard to do naan wrong, but a lot of indian places do. they did not. 

overall, i see this place mixing into the rotation of 'places i recommend highly in my neighborhood.' i love that there's a good indian restaurant in northbeach. finally!
author: ashoke c.

description: I ordered from Urban Curry last night when it was raining hard. I ordered online and my food arrived in a timely manner, especially considering the bad weather and the fact that I ordered half an hour before closing time from across town. ;) (I made sure to tip well) They followed my requests regarding the food (extra spicy lamb vindaloo, with whole wheat garlic naan), and I would definitely order more food next time.
author: Ursula E.

description:
Karen was nice enough to take me out to dinner and let me choose where to eat. She's vegetarian and I like lamb. There's no better choice than going to an Indian restaurant. I found Urban Curry from Yelp, where I go if I want to try something different. Going down the list I could see mostly 4-5 stars and hey, how could you go wrong? So Urban Curry it is.

We were standing at the door at 5PM, waiting for it to open. Walked in, impressed right away. It's clean, very clean. I work in a clinic. Cleanliness and hygiene is my main thing. Since we were the only patrons there, we got all the attention. The staff was warm and courteous. Right off the bat, complimentary Chai tea. Nice. Very nice. 

Karen had the eggplant. She couldn't stop praising the taste.

I ordered: 
Fish Pakora for appetizer. The batter was just right, not doughy at all and the fish was fresh and tender.

Lamb Karahi. Now this one was an adventure. Why? Because I was so ecstatic about the place and food, I totally forgot to ask them to make it mild. When the dish came, I looked at it, and the waiter, thinking "I'm fried!" He told me to try and see if it's too spicy. I did. It was tasty, and painfully HOT! I told him I would work around it. During the entire dinner, he was so concerned that he came over a few times to make sure I was OK. I was NOT OK, but to tell you, NO REGRETS! I was drowning the meat in yogurt to neutralize the spice. I wanted to eat it. It was so damn good.

The Naan was to die for. It was fluffy on top, and crispy at the bottom. I brought some naan home but totally forgot about it for a few days. Pulled it from the fridge, stuck it in the toaster oven and it was just as good as new.

I had tears running the entire time but it's all worth it. I'm definitely coming back and bringing my friends too. The food is delicious and the price is right, and not forgetting the 15% off if you mention Yelp. As long as I write a reminder on my hand to order everything mild, I'm good to go!
author: Cordeon H.

description: Got the chicken tikka masala and a mango lassi to go at lunch. Very friendly staff and it was a short wait for the food. Delicious free chai while you wait. Very happy to have a GOOD curry restaurant near work!
author: Jo E.

description:
I really like Urban Curry. I was a bit put off by the name at first, but boy, it's good food here. 
This place leans towards the Pakistani style food, which is good - there's plenty of straight Indian around. They settle my Chicken Tikka Masala craving with gusto, do a great Mango Lassi, and give me a cup of chai while I wait for take-out.
Sounds like I've gotta give the Aloo Naan a go next time!
author: Eric D.

description: i almost never have reason to be in north beach, which i was completely not fussed about until i discovered the deliciousness of urban curry, and now am bummed that it is such a trek.  seriously, i don't remember the last time i had such delicious indian food that was not that expensive and actually had a lovely atmosphere.  the naan was especially fantastic.
author: ehnonymus ..

description:
I was reluctant to try this place, until I saw the Yelp reviews.  I've since been there several times and have yet to be disappointed.  First, of all, the place is clean and spacious.  The service is always friendly and attentive and the food is very worth-while.  So far, I've tried and can recommend the following:

- Chicken Tikka-Masala
- Lamb Karahi
- Lamb Boti
- Garlic Naan

If you can't tolerate spice in your food, it's best to make that known.  On some dishes, you'll be asked to specify the level of spiciness.  With Indian owners and Mexican line chefs, "medium" is pretty spicy.

Last time I was in, they offered a 15% discount if you mentioned Yelp.  I don't know if this discount is still available.  However, even undiscounted, the food is very reasonable.

The only reason that this place doesn't get 5 stars is the location.  The place is located in the heart of the Broadway/Kearny/Columbus triangle, so if you go on a Friday or Saturday night, you'll have to wade through all the bridge-and-tunnel riff-raff that invariably collects there.  I've limited my visits to weeknights for just that reason.

Good, cheap food and friendly service will keep me coming back.  Highly recommended.
author: Eric O.

description: Had fun eating here with friends. Nice and quiet. Food was ok. Palak paneer was kind of bland.
author: Crystal H.

description: Urban Curry is really a good 4+ and I was really pleasantly surprised with the service, food and entire experience. First of all, they have full sized tables that are actually big enough to spread out. Four of us were seated at two tables, each of which would have been a 4-top in most establishments. We arrived early and stayed late and were never once rushed or made to feel uncomfortable. Between the four, we pretty well covered the menu - started with fish pakora and papadum, then a big plate of basmati rice and shared roghan josh, paluk paneer, goat biryani and paneer naan. (I have probably slaughtered these names!) Had to cancel some pepper cream chicken, just too much food. The servers were super nice and enthusiastic in their recommendations and the prices were extraordinarily reasonable. I was prompted from one of those recent email deals but even without that, it would have been a good deal. Great find.
author: Robert M.

description: Delicious. We ate lunch there kind of early so we pretty much had the place to ourselves. We had Pakoras and Samosas which were hot and delicious. Then the garlic naan, aloo palak and chicken tikka masala...each dish was delicious! Some of the best I've had in this city...Also the staff was amazingly friendly...the service was perfect.
author: richard w.

description: Urban Curry is my favorite Indian place around. I go nearly every week. Great Chicken tika masala, awesome chicken karahi and the garlic naan is delicious. The staff provides awesome service and is always friendly. Your also able to bring in your own beer!
author: Greg L.

description: delivery service is great. tried the lentil soup, lamb vindaloo, aloo gobi, and garlic naan. lamb was a little dry and the gobi was just ok. good garlicky naan though.
author: Debbie Chiou S.

description: It was sad to see this place almost empty on a Friday evening but I guess they must get a lot of late night diners, given the neighborhood.  My friend and I almost thought this place was out of business because the sign and front looked pretty rundown.  I would recommend sprucing up the exterior to make look more obviously open and inviting.  But it was quite nice when we were inside.  I appreciated the free chai even though I only ordered a mango lassi (generously large glass) and papadum.  My major complaint: the mint and tamarind sauces that are served with papadum were watered down and flavorless here.  The tamarind sauce was completely runny and flavorless- unfortunately the worst I've had at any Indian restaurant.  But the papadum were great and we got a lot for the price.  The service was very friendly and attentive, but when my friend asked for yogurt, the waiter asked if she wanted yogurt or raita, she said yogurt, and then he said okay but brought her raita anyway.  She didn't mind but I would have!
author: Mara H.

description: food was good, clean bathroom, i could not complain.  the lahori cholay was tasty, naan was fresh.  i noticed unusually kind service, served us all tea in elegant cups with saucers before dinner and after, this seem to make everyone at my table so happy.
author: Noel J.

description:
We decided to try this place as a group last week.  We usually head over to Naan-n-Curry for our Indian cravings, but trying something new is always fun.

We went in for lunch and the place was pretty much empty.  We had a group of about 10.  The owner and host was extremely nice, welcoming us, arranging some seating, and overall just being very friendly.  

The price was very fair for the high quality of the food.  Chicken Tika was at $7, then we all shared naan and rice.

In the end, we all agreed that we'll be back.  It's a short walk up Broadway for us, and we also intend to have them cater a lucnh in the office in the near future.  If you like Indian food (especially Naan-n-Curry, Little Delhi, etc.), give Urban Curry a go.
author: David R.

description: I'm a huge fan of Indian food, so when I found this place I was ecstatic. The people are friendly, but not SUPER welcoming when you first get seated (one of the reasons I didn't give the full 5 stars). The entrees are large, and most are served "family style". The tikka masala is amazing, as well as all the Tandoori's and naan. Everything is very fresh/flavorful with not TOO much spice (but you can ask them to kick it up a notch or two), and the tandoori's were still sizzling when they got to the table (as they should be, but I've been disappointed at other places).We ordered 4 items for 4 people and there were plenty of leftovers after we all stuffed ourselves. When I'm in the mood for Indian, this is the place I want to go. Only other negative about this place besides the lack of enthusiastic greeting: the hours are a little funky. All in all- I love this place and have yet to find better Indian food...definitely my number one choice!
author: Ashlee M.

description: Oh my, I ate until I could only waddle, not walk. It was unintentional. The lunch buffet was really good (and spicy). I ate so much I could only drink one beer (to my shame and embarrassment) at happy hour a couple of hours later. Number of buffet choices wasn't real large (thankfully, I might have eaten myself to death), thus 4 instead of 5 stars. I'm a fairly athletic guy in good shape. I don't usually overindulge. In the spirit of true Americanism, it was their fault for making the food so tasty :)
author: J J.

description: My two daughters and I went to SF for a little shopping and we all agreed we'd like some Indian Food. We found Urban Curry on my daughter's iphone and followed the directions to get there.  When we arrived the owner sat in the front window eating, what we later found out was kheer, and motioning for us to go in.  When we went to the door we noticed they were closed.  They weren't due to open for a few minutes, but he opened early to accomodate us.  The ambience was awesome and the waitress from Nepal was so sweet.  The food was great.  I will always remember the kindness of this restauraunt owner and his kind staff.
author: Rachel N.

description: this place was a last second choice and it was quite nice.. an ecletic mix of spices with nice dishes.
author: barabara b.

description: the food is awesome, the service is excellent, and the price is right. a perfect workday lunch spot.
author: grant l.

description: I ordered chicken vindaloo, lamb vindaloo and vege biryani.  Vindaloos were too watery and lacking a certain spice.  Vege biryani just lacked taste.  I wanted to like this place, but I guess I will just stick with the place down the street from home.  I will not be going back to Urban Curry.
author: Cynthia C.

description: The food's terrible! Seriously don't understand how so many yelpers found it good. The biryani was half cooked -- and while I asked for extra spicy, the food was barely savory and nowhere close to spicy. The lentil soup was so watery that I don't think they used any lentils to make the soup. It seemed more like water mixed with salt and curry powder with a few tomatoes and onions thrown in. Awful!
author: ila v.

description: Went 4 lunch and had a good food. The quality is good, spice is less, bit oily but okay, service is good but it slow. Overall its good and i will go again.
author: Arun C.

description: Ordered their Signature dish, Lamb Karahi (?). It came in a wok and was spicy and delish. Chai and rice were good and hot, but the Garlic Naan was just a bit much. Waiter was attentive and knowledgeable. Service was quick.
author: Bev M.

description: Some of the best Indian food I've had in SF- Curry Village is probably still the best, but this is pretty darn good. Went around 4pm on Saturday and it was empty, although another couple came in as we were leaving--- we didn't really eat lunch, so came here for an early dinner. Service was fantastic, constantly refilling our water glasses, offering us complimentary chai (delicious, although the best in SF is probably Kasa's), and bringing our food out very quickly, so it was hot, fresh, and delicious! We split the veggie samosas which were so hot they melted in our mouths, filled with well-spiced potatoes and peas, and garnished with fresh mint. These were served with very tasty mint and tamarind sauces on the side. This was followed with  an order of whole wheat roti (well-cooked, but still pliable and hot and fresh), and an order of Navrattan Korma (an orange curry with paneer, carrots, and other veggies) and Aloo palak (spinach with potatoes). Both were delicious, and seemed very fresh (including the spinach, which did not seem to just be reheated frozen stuff). The Navrattan was definitely the winner, but both were great. Overall, the bill was $25 exactly (including tax), but we had a 50% off Scoutmob coupon so it was only $12.50! Of course, we tipped on the pre-coupon amount because they definitely deserved it, and if we are ever in the North Beach neighborhood again (is this right? I'm in the Mission so I'm not so well-versed in the other neighborhood boundaries in the NE side of SF), we will definitely stop by before heading to City Lights to browse their books.
author: Amanda S.

description:
my husband and i bought a ton of take out here using our groupon.  we got our favorite standard dishes:  Chicken Tikka for him, a Lamb Karahi and the Spinach w/ home made Cheese (palak paneer) for me.  
The staff could not have been nicer.  They told us to be seated at a table while we waited and sincerely offered to bring us waters.  The man who took our order was very specific when inquiring about our tolerances for heat and the cooks delivered a level that was perfect for us.
I'll admit that to me the Tikka tasted a bit like a sweet tomato soup, but my husband was over the moon with it and it's his regular dish.  i was thrilled with my Lamb dish, and it only tasted better when i revisited my left overs two days later.  The flavors had continued to develop while it sat in my fridge.
My whole wheat roti was perfect, perfect.  it was freshly made and had bubbly, crispy parts in it.  My man likes the Paratha, which i find a bit oily but he LOVED it.
Mostly, we're really excited to have good indian food in the neighborhood.  They don't deliver yet, but they're right on Broadway near Columbus and it couldn't be easier to get to.
We're looking forward to making Urban Curry a regular part of our take out routine.
author: passion f.

description: after few people told me try this restaurant i went there with there high expectation but not so please food was not great one of curry was rotten service was ok come on u guys can do better
author: Surinder S.

description:
For my first review ever I wanted to check out a current hot spot on Yelp to see what the fuss was all about. Urban Curry is the real deal!
The host/owner guy when you first walk in was super friendly.The place has a nice feel to it, with several hookahs laying around for decoration. 
We ordered the Tandoori Chicken which was cooked perfectly with just the right amount of lemon taste. The Lamb Kabob which look like breakfast sausage come with grilled onions and bell peppers, it taste like heaven. You get four pieces of heaven by the way. 
We also ordered Paneer Tikka Masala, it's a homemade cheese with creamy sauce which is perfect for dipping with your Naan, we ordered the regular one and it was fresh, soft and hot. The prices were great and well worth the portions. 
The only drawback is that's it's located on Broadway and Columbus where parking is a pain, so bring lots of coins for street parking (25 cents=8 minutes) or park in the lot down the street ($3 every 30 minutes) but the lot gets full.
Enjoy!
author: El N.

description: I've walked by this place many times, usually when rushing back to the office from a yoga class, so while I love Indian, I didn't have the time, nor did a buffet sound appetizing after yoga. So finally I decided to just walk up that way for lunch and try it out. The food was solid, not the best I've had (I used to go to the Amber buffet down in MV), but I wasn't expecting amazing. It was good food though. Everything looked fresh and in the end I just love rice and lamb curry with naan so while I tried everything, the chicken in the various dishes seemed a bit dry to me so I just went back for more curry. I would give it 3.5 stars for food, but what boosts it up is the great service. I wasn't expecting any service for a buffet, maybe someone to tell me to sit wherever I wanted, but not much more. When I walked in, I was greeted, asked if I had been here before and when I said no, he gave me a full tour of the buffet describing each dish. He came by to check on me, clear my plate, etc. Overall, a great experience. Obviously the more you eat for the $11.99 the better the value, but I felt my 2 modest plates of food were worth it. Note, the food is mostly spicy, which they tell you. Everything but the chicken tikka masala. I like my food spicy and had no issue with it, it wasn't too much, but may be for some.
author: Lauren M.

description: Service was amazing, decor was very cute (sort of fancy), food was extremely tasty, and it was nice and clean. The man who ushered us in was very friendly in suggesting dishes, even quizzed us about indian cuisine (in a friendly way) I would absolutely recommend Urban Curry to everyone..
author: Silly E.

description: I went twice and had an experience similar to that of other yelpers.  For my first trip I had Biriyani.  No offense to the people of Pakistan, but I think Indians make it better.  It did have a little kick to it, so I decided to go back and try something else: Chicken Karahi.  I REALLY liked it, and again I didn't even have to ask for them to make it spicy.  The restaurant itself is a nice and tastefully designed (so in a way it's out of place being so close to "Garden of Eden" et. al.), and the staff are very friendly.  I'll be back!
author: Ed F.
